Whatever wondrous jewels There are in this world, in others, And in higher realms are in no way Equal to the jewel of the Buddha. He is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Buddha is the best in the world. If it is true that he is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Peace, cessation, as wonderful as amrita, The Dharma contained in Shakyamuni’s mind In meditation has no equal. If it is realized, there is thereafter no misery. It is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of genuine Dharma is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. The eight phases taught by the Buddha Are four pairs of stages of the Sangha. Persons so worthy of generosity are rare on this earth. Generosity to them becomes immeasurable. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Principal among the holy, provider of the wondrous, Great light, best of brave ones, Great wisdom, most sublime, The bhagavan alone fully knows what is best and what is not. He is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Buddha is the best in the world. If it is true that he is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. The sublime samadhi without obstacle, Boundless intelligence, was taught by the tathagata. He compared that samadhi, in its stability, to a vajra. There is no samadhi equal to it. It is wondrous, inestimable. This jewel of samadhi is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Like firmly closed doors immovable By even the four powerful winds Are the wise who have seen the four truths. They are unmoved by mundane speakers. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. The omniscient one is all-seeing and outshines all others. Omniscient, he has all powers. Most sublime, he is free from all fixation. The bhagavan alone knows all the thoughts of others. He is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Buddha is the best in the world. If it is true that he is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. It ends samsara and is unmoving and unchanging. Flawless, it fully liberates from all danger. It is cessation. It is wonderful. It is emancipation. Utterly stainless, it is a peace that the intellect cannot steal. It is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the genuine Dharma is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Great suffering revealed, they seek happiness. They see the truths and have vigilance. They have no doubts about the precious truths. They will not take an eighth birth. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Most sublime, he knows the absolute truth. He knows what is best and what is not, and engages in absolute truth. He has realized the sublime that cannot be stolen. He is the best rescuer of those who suffer. He is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Buddha is the best in the world. If it is true that he is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Through resolve they develop meditation. They are liberated through constant diligence in Gautama’s Dharma. Not led astray, they enter the arya Sangha And are no longer among the ordinary. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. It is rare for those who have seen the truth To do wrongdoing, but should they do so, It is unfitting for them to conceal it, Because the nature of things is consistent. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. In all worlds, including those of gods, There is no one superior or equal to the Buddha. The teacher of gods and humans is unsurpassable. The guide is the supreme physician. He is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Buddha is the best in the world. If it is true that he is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. In the first month of summer Shakyamuni Attained genuine Dharma in the forest. There is nothing superior or equal to the Dharma. Those who encounter it are no longer among the ordinary. It is wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the genuine Dharma is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here. Having exhausted past wrongdoing, they do no more. Free from contagion, they are fearless and without misery. Because its root has ceased, becoming does not arise. The Dharma blazes like a torch. They are wondrous, inestimable. The jewel of the Sangha is the best in the world. If it is true that it is best, then by that truth May there be the utmost joy and goodness here.
rdzas brgyad shis brjod/
The Offering of the Eight Auspicious Substances

mang+ga laM swasti b+ha wan+tu/ deng 'dir 'dzam bu gling thams cad kyi rgyan/ 'jig rten kun gyi 'dod dgu'i 'byung gnas/ rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ljon pa rnams kyi brten pa'i gzhi/ byang chub kyi ljon pa bzang pos brgyan pa/ lha mi kun gyi bsod nams kyi zhing dang mchod sdong gcig pur grub pa'i gnas rdo rje'i gdan zhes sam 'don pa bsgyur/

mangalaṃ svasti bhavantu Today, here at the ornament of all Jambudvipa, the source of everything desired by all the world, the ground in which grow the trees of the buddhas and which is adorned by the good bodhi tree, the field of merit of all gods and humans, the foremost stupa, Vajrasana (or alter the liturgy),

'di nyid du rgyal ba nyid kyis bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyi mthus bkra shis brjod par bya ste/ sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes yungs kar phul nas bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu la brten nas deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du yungs kar gyi rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / yungs kar rdo rje'i rigs te thams cad du/ / bgegs rnams ma lus rab tu 'joms byed cing*/ / mthu stobs yon tan phun sum tshogs gyur pa/ / bkra shis des kyang bgegs rnams zhi bar shog / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ bram ze kun+d+ha lis rtswa dUrba phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du dUrba'i rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / dUrbas tshe ni 'phel bar byed pa ste/ / rdo rje sems dpa'i tshe ni rab bsgrubs nas/ / nyon mongs skye shi rgyun chad gyur pa yi/ / bkra shis des kyang tshe ni 'phel gyur cig / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la lha mo brtan mas li khri phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du li khri'i rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / li khri dmar po dbang gi rang bzhin te/ / chos rnams ma lus dbang du 'dus nas kyang*/ / chos kyi rgyal srid rab tu brtan gyur pa'i/ / bkra shis des kyang rgyal srid brtan gyur cig / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ glang po che sa srung gis gi waM phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du gi waM gi rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / gi waM dug gsum 'joms pa nad kyi sman/ / sman mchog chos nyid rab tu rtogs gyur nas/ / nyon mongs zug rngu med par gyur pa yi/ / bkra shis des kyang sdug bsngal zhi gyur cig / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ khyim bdag bzang skyong gis zho phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du yang zho'i rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / zho ni kun gyi snying por gyur pa ste/ / snying po rnam dag ye shes mchog rtogs nas/ / yon tan kun gyi dbyings su gyur pa yi/ / bkra shis des kyang dug gsum zhi bar shog / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ gzugs kyi lha mo 'od 'chang mas me long phul nas bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du yang me long gi rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / me long ye shes rgya mtsho chen po yis/ / ye shes rgya mtsho mchog tu dag gyur te/ / rnam dag chos la thogs med longs spyod pa'i/ / bkra shis des kyang sgrib pa dag gyur cig / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ shing gi lha mos shing thog bil ba phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du bil ba'i rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / bil ba rgyu rkyen 'bras bur bcas pa'i chos/ / 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i spyod pa kun/ / byang chub snying po mchog tu gyur pa yi/ / bkra shis des kyang don kun 'grub gyur cig / sngon yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shAkya thub pa la/ lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis dung dkar po g.yas su 'khyil ba phul nas/ bkra shis pa'i rdzas su byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i mthu las/ deng 'dir gnas chen 'di nyid du dung dkar gyi rdzas kyis bkra shis par gyur cig / dung ni chos kyi sgra rnams sgrogs pa'i tshul/ / ye shes rgya mtsho nyid du dag gyur te/ / chos rnams ma lus yongs su ston pa yi/ / bkra shis des kyang tshig dbang thob par shog /

I declare auspiciousness through the power of those substances that the Buddha himself blessed as auspicious. When Vajrapani, the lord of secrets, offered the completely perfect Buddha Shakyamuni white mustard seeds, the Buddha blessed them as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance white mustard bring auspiciousness. White mustard seeds are of the vajra family. They conquer all obstructors without exception. Their power and qualities are perfect. Through their auspiciousness, may obstructors be pacified. When the brahmin Kundhali offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni durva grass, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance durva bring auspiciousness. Durva increases longevity. Through the accomplishment of Vajrasattva’s longevity, May kleshas, birth, and death cease. Through this auspiciousness may life increase. When Prithividevi offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni sindhura, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance sindhura bring auspiciousness. Red sindhura is of the nature of power. All dharmas having been brought under control, May the dominion of Dharma be utterly stable. Through this auspiciousness may dominion be stable. When the elephant Airavana offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni gorochana, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance, gorochana, bring auspiciousness. Gorochana is the medicine that conquers the three poisons. Through this supreme medicine may dharmata be fully realized. May the kleshas lose their sting. Through this auspiciousness, may suffering be pacified. When the householder Bhadrapala offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni yogurt, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance yogurt bring auspiciousness. Yogurt is the essence of everything. Realizing the pristine wisdom that is the pure essence, May I reach the expanse of all qualities. Through this auspiciousness, may the three poisons be pacified. When Rupadevi Prabhadhari offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni a mirror, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance, a mirror, bring auspiciousness. With this mirror, the great ocean of pristine wisdom, May the ocean of pristine wisdom become pure. May I unimpededly experience pure dharmas. Through this auspiciousness, may obscurations be purified. When a tree nymph offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni bilva fruit, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance bilva bring auspiciousness. Bilva represent dharmas—causes, conditions, and results. May all conduct, mundane and supramundane, Lead to the supreme essence of awakening. Through this auspiciousness, may all aims be accomplished. When Indra, the ruler of gods, offered the completely perfect buddha Shakyamuni a right-swirling white conch, the Buddha blessed it as an auspicious substance. Due to the power of that, today, in this great place, may this substance, a white conch, bring auspiciousness. From this conch issue forth the sounds of Dharma. Purified as the ocean of pristine wisdom, May I teach all dharmas without exception. Through this auspiciousness, may mastery of words be achieved.
rgyal srid sna bdun ni/
The Offering of the Seven Articles of Royalty

'khor lo lag tu thogs la/ lha rdzas las byas lte ba shin tu zlum/ / rtsibs stong ldan zhing mu khyud rab mnyam bzang*/ / sdang ba'i dgra las rnam par rgyal gyur pa'i/ / 'khor lo rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / bdud thams cad las rgyal ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo nam mkha'i mthas gtugs par bskor nus pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the wheel, recite: Made from the materials of the gods, with a perfectly round hub, With a thousand spokes and a perfectly even rim, It brings total victory over spiteful enemies. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious wheel. May I have the power to turn the Wheel of Dharma, victorious over all maras, throughout the reaches of space.

nor bu rin chen thogs te/ rin chen ngo bo lha rdzas baiDUr+ya/ / kun tu dpag tshad tsam du snang byed cing*/ / dri med nyin mo ji bzhin mtshan de bzhin/ / nor bu rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / tshe dpag tu med pa'i 'od dang ldan zhing lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa thams cad rang rang gi gzi brjid kyi zil gyis gnon pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the jewel, recite: The essence of the precious, the vaidurya of the gods, Illuminates all within a radius of a yojana. Stainless, it is the same throughout day and night. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious jewel. May I have the light of Amitayus and the power of surpassing in splendor all mundane beings, including the gods.

btsun mo rin chen thogs te/ gzugs mdzes lta na sdug cing tshul bzang ba/ / pags pa'i mdog legs 'jam zhing dri mchog ldan/ / yid 'ong 'dod dgu'i reg bya dang ldan pa/ / btsun mo rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin zhi ba'i tshul gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don bde bas bsgrub pa la yid bzhin du 'byor ba'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the queen, recite: Beautiful, pleasing to behold, with good demeanor and Excellent complexion, she is gentle, supremely fragrant, Lovely, and her touch desirable. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious queen. May I have the ability to easily accomplish the transcendent benefit of myself and all other beings, as intended, through tranquil samadhi.

blon po rin chen thogs te/ gang yang rgyal ba'i mu tig mdangs ldan pa/ / gser sogs mang po thub la phul ba ltar/ / bzod ldan mtshungs pa'i khyim bdag nor ldan te/ / blon po rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / lha'i mig rnam par dag pa thob ste 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang ldan zhing rang dang gzhan gyi don/ dgongs pa ma lus pa thams cad mthar phyin nas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the precious minister, recite: His unmatched complexion is as lustrous as pearl. He has wealth like the masses of gold offered to the sages. This wealthy householder has patience. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious minister. May I attain the utterly pure divine eye and have the seven riches of the aryas, the power to accomplish all intentions for the benefit of myself and others, and unimpeded knowledge of all dharmas.

glang po rin chen thogs te/ yan lag thams cad legs skyes sa la ni/ / rab gnas gangs can ri 'dra glang po che/ / rgyal po la 'os mkha' la rab 'gro ba'i/ / glang po rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / stobs bcu dang ldan zhing bdud bzhi'i stobs tshar bcad nas sems can thams cad theg pa chen po la 'jug nus pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the precious elephant, recite: This elephant, like a Himalayan mountain, Abides stably on the ground and is well-formed in all his limbs. He is fit for a king and can fly through space. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious elephant. May I have the ten strengths and the ability to eradicate the forces of the four maras, and establish all beings in the mahayana.

rta mchog rin chen thogs te/ tho rangs dus su phyogs rnams ma lus pa'i/ / sa rnams bskor te slar yang zlog gyur pa/ / rma bya'i mgrin pa'i spu ltar yid 'ong ba'i/ / rta mchog rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / so sor yang dag par rig pa bzhis 'gro ba rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su thogs pa med par bskyal nus pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the precious steed, recite: At dawn, he circles through the earth in all directions And then returns. His hair is as dazzling as a peacock’s neck. May there be, here and now, The auspiciousness of the precious steed. May I have the power to establish all beings in the expanse of nonabiding nirvana without impediment by means of the four perfect awarenesses.

dmag dpon rin chen thogs te/ 'gro dang ldog dang kun nas 'ong gyur pa/ / ma lus bdud dpung 'joms par byed pa yi/ / dpal ldan 'byor pa'i dpung tshogs dang bcas pa/ / dmag dpon rin chen deng 'dir bkra shis shog / thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i dgongs pa mthar phyin nas/ 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo mthon po nyi shu 'joms shing ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang dang ldan par gyur cig /

Holding the precious general, recite: Accompanied by his forces rich with splendor, He conquers all the hordes of Mara without exception, Whether they are advancing, retreating, or approaching from any direction. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious general. May I perfect non-dual means and wisdom and have perfect pristine wisdom and the power to topple the high mountain of the twenty views of the self.
bkra shis rtags brgyad 'bul ba/
The Offering of the Eight Marks of Auspiciousness

'od 'bar rin chen tog gi khyon yangs shing*/ / khor yug nor bu'i dra bas rnam par mdzes/ / gser bzang mchog gi yu bas brten pa can/ / rin chen gdugs mdzes deng 'dir bkra shis shog / dri med rab gsal mngon par 'khyud pa can/ / rdzu 'phrul dang bcas chu gter rab bskor zhing*/ / dgos 'dod kun stsol de dang gnas gcig pa'i/ / bkra shis nya yis deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rin chen bzang las mngon par grub pa'i phul/ / 'dod dgu ma lus 'byung ba'i rin chen gter/ / lha rdzas gos kyis mdzes par brgyan pa yi/ / bum bzang mchog gis deng 'dir bkra shis shog / dpag bsam shing dang skyed tshal bzang rnams las/ / mngon par byung ba'i pad+mo gsar pa rnams/ / yid 'phrog dri dang ze'u 'bru 'dab 'phreng ldan/ / pad+mo mchog gis deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rab mdzes g.yas su legs par byung ba yi/ / gangs ri dang 'dra ma lus phyogs rnams su/ / yid 'phrog sgra sgrogs rgyal ba mnyes byed pa'i/ / dung mchog rnams kyis deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rab mdzes gzugs mchog yid kyis bris pa bzhin/ / rnam par rab bkra thugs mtshan 'dod dgu stsol/ / lha yi gnyen gyur rgyan rnams kun gyis mdzes/ / dpal gyi be'us deng 'dir bkra shis shog / phyogs las rnam rgyal rin chen rgyal mtshan bzang*/ / sna tshogs dar dang nor bu'i drwa bas spras/ / dgos 'dod kun stsol rin chen tog gis mdzes/ / rgyal mtshan mchog gis deng 'dir bkra shis shog / gser las legs byas lte ba shin tu zlum/ / rtsibs stong ldan zhing mu khyud ma nyams mdzes/ / dang po'i sa las rnam par rgyal gyur pa'i/ / rin chen 'khor los deng 'dir bkra shis shog /

Blazing with light, its peak is a jewel And its vast canopy beautified by webs of jewels. It is supported by a handle of finest gold. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the beautiful, precious parasol. With stainless clear vision, They dart miraculously through the water. They live in the source of all that is needed and wanted. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the auspicious fish. It is the best of all that is made from good, precious materials. It contains precious treasure that is the source of all that is wanted. It is beautifully decorated by divine fabric. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the supreme good vase. These lotuses are newly sprung up From wish-fulfilling trees and fine gardens. They have enchanting fragrance, their hearts, and all their petals. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the best of lotuses. They are of the utmost beauty and well-swirled to the right. They are like snow-covered mountains. Their enchanting sound Is heard in all directions. They please the buddhas. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the supreme conches. It is of the utmost beauty, the finest form the mind could draw. Colorful and bright, this symbol of his heart bestows all that is wanted. Beautified by all ornaments, it is beloved by the gods. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the glorious knot. Victorious over all directions, this precious victory banner is excellent. It is decorated by variegated silk and webs of jewels. It is beautified by a jewel peak that bestows all that is needed or wanted. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the supreme victory banner. Well-made from gold, its hub is perfectly round. It has a thousand spokes and is beautified by an unbroken rim. It transports one from the first stage to utter victory. May there be, here and now, the auspiciousness of the precious wheel.
mar pa'i bkra shis/
Lord Marpa's Song of Auspiciousness

mar pa'i zhal gsung bkra shis/ de nas lho brag lung pa'i mi mang po bsags te/ sras kyi che 'don/ gzims khang gi rab gnas ston mo bzang po dang bcas pa mdzad pa'i ston gral du/ bla ma mar pas bkra shis mnga' gsol gyi mgur 'di gsungs so/

Lama Marpa gathered many of the people of Lhodrak, proclaimed his son’s greatness, and presented a fine feast in celebration of the consecration of his residence. During it, he sang this song proclaiming auspiciousness:

bla ma bka' drin can la gsol ba 'debs/ / nga yi brgyud pa rin chen 'di nyid la/ / nyes ltung med pa'i bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / gdams ngag zab mo'i nye lam la/ / nor 'khrul med pa'i bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / nga rang mar pa lo tsA la/ / zab mo gnad kyi bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro la/ / byin rlabs dngos grub bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / bu chen slob ma'i 'khor tshogs la/ / dad pa dam tshig bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / yon bdag yul mi nye ring la/ / mthun rkyen tshogs gsog bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / las dang bya ba thams cad la/ / 'gro don byang chub bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / snang zhing srid pa'i lha 'dre la/ / chad mdo btsan pa'i bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog / 'dir tshogs khrom gyi lha mi la/ / bde skyid smon lam bkra shis yod/ / bkra shis des kyang bkra shis shog /ces gsungs so/

I supplicate my kind gurus. This precious lineage of mine has The auspiciousness of freedom from faults and downfalls. May that auspiciousness prevail. The short path of profound instructions has The auspiciousness of freedom from errors and mistakes. May that auspiciousness prevail. I, Marpa Lotsa, have The auspiciousness of the profound point. May that auspiciousness prevail. The gurus, yidams, and dakinis have The auspiciousness of blessings and siddhi. May that auspiciousness prevail. My great sons, my entourage of disciples, have The auspiciousness of faith and samaya. May that auspiciousness prevail. My patrons and the people of this area, near and far, have The auspiciousness of gathering the accumulations, the favorable conditions. May that auspiciousness prevail. In all my actions and activity, there is The auspiciousness of beings’ benefit and awakening. May that auspiciousness prevail. The gods and spirits that appear and exist have The auspiciousness of my strict command. May that auspiciousness prevail. The gods and humans gathered here have The auspiciousness of my aspiration for their joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail.
sgar chen bkra shis/
The Auspiciousness of the Great Encampment

bkra shis kyi dang po bkra shis pa/ / sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byon pa yin/ / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / bkra shis kyi gnyis pa bkra shis pa/ / dam chos 'khor lo bskor ba yin/ / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / bkra shis kyi gsum pa bkra shis pa/ / zhing mchog dge 'dun tshogs rnams yin/ / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis pa/ / bka' brgyud ngo mtsharacan rnams yin/ / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / gzugs med gzugs kyi khams kyi lha/ / bsam gtan nang gi dga' bder ldan/ / de bzhin bdag cag bde skyid shog / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / 'dod khams 'dod lha rigs drug rnams/ / 'dod yon sna tshogs rnams kyis rtse/ / rtag tu dga' dang bde bar ldan/ / de bzhin bdag cag bde skyid shog / mi mchog 'khor los sgyur rgyal ni/ / rgyal srid bdun la sogs pa yis/ / gling bzhir phun sum tshogs pa la/ / rtag tu bde zhing skyid par spyod/ / de bzhin bdag cag bde skyid shog / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / sgar chen gnas mchog 'dzam gling rgyan 'dir ni/ / chos rgyal sku tshe brtan par shog / bstan pa phyogs bcur khyab par shog / 'phrin las thams cad 'grub par shog / mang pos bkur ba shAkya'i rgyal po'i rigs/ / rgyal bas lung bstan bod kyi chos kyi rgyal/ / mes dbon rnam gsum sogs kyis rgyal ba'i bstan/ / bod du spyan drangs rgyal srid gnyis bskyangs pa'i/ / bden pa chen pos deng 'dir bkra shis shog / rgya gar rgyal po'i rgyal srid dang*/ / rgya nag rgyal po'i dpal 'byor dang*/ / hor gyi rgyal po'i mthu stobs sogs/ / 'dzam gling kun gyi phun tshogs bcud/ / thams cad sgar gnas mchog 'dir 'du bar shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / sgar chen gnas mchog 'dzam gling kun gyi rgyan 'dir ni/ / bdag cag bsam pa yid bzhin 'grub par shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / yul dang skad rigs mi gcig pa/ / mi rigs rnam pa sna tshogs pa/ / bde skyid yang yang 'dir 'tshogs shog / bkra shis de yis bkra shis shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog / 'phral skyid pa 'jig rten mi yi chos/ / dga' bde smon bzhin thob par shog / phugs skyid pa dam pa'i lha chos la/ / dus rtag tu 'bral med 'byor bar shog / bkra shis kyi rab ma 'dzam gling rgyan/ / 'dzam gling rgyan gyi bkra shis shog / bsam pa yid bzhin 'grub par shog / bde skyid phun sum tshogs par shog /

The first auspicious auspiciousness Is the coming of the Buddha to this world. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. The second auspicious auspiciousness Is his turning of the genuine Wheel of Dharma. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. The third auspicious auspiciousness Is the supreme field, the communities of the Sangha. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. The most auspicious of all auspiciousness Is the wondrous Kagyü. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. The gods of the form and formless realms Have the internal joy and pleasure of meditation. May we have such joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. The six types of gods of the desire realm Revel among diverse desirable qualities. They always have joy and pleasure. May we have such joy and ease. Chakravartins, supreme among humans, Always enjoy with pleasure and ease The seven articles of royalty And all that is best in the four continents. May we have such joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. Here, in this great encampment (supreme place), the ornament of Jambudvipa, May the Dharma king’s life be firm. May the Dharma fill the ten directions. May all activity be accomplished. The line of the Shakya kings, venerated by many, Was continued by the Dharma kings of Tibet, as the Buddha prophesied. The three forefathers invited the Buddha-dharma to Tibet. They reigned over the two dominions. By the great truth of that, may there be auspiciousness here and now. The majesty of the kings of India, The wealth of the emperors of China, The power of the emperors of Mongolia, And all that is excellent in Jambudvipa: May all of this be amassed in this encampment (supreme place). May there be perfect joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail. Here, in this great encampment (supreme place), the ornament of Jambudvipa, May our wishes be fulfilled as intended. May there be perfect joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. May people from different lands with different languages, And of different races, Frequently assemble here in joy and ease. May that auspiciousness prevail. May there be perfect joy and ease. May mundane dharmas that bring immediate ease Be acquired and bring the pleasure and joy that is wished for. May the divine genuine Dharma that brings lasting ease Be always present without separation. The utmost auspiciousness, the ornament of Jambudvipa: May Jambudvipa be ornamented by auspiciousness. May our wishes be fulfilled as intended. May there be perfect joy and ease.
ces byang chub kyi sems rin po che snying gi dkyil du mi 'bral bar 'dzin pa karma pa chos grags rgya mtshos sbyar ba'o/
Karmapa Chödrak Gyatso wrote this while keeping precious bodhichitta inseparably within the center of his heart.
bden pa grub ma/

d.crumb: The One Who Taught the Truth…

f.d: The Aspiration “The One Who Taught the Truth…”

bden pa grub cing bden par gsungs pa gang*/ / mtshungs med ston pa nyid kyis rang gi bstan/ / 'jig rten khams 'dir yun ring 'bar gyur par/ / smon lam mdzad pa de bzhin cher 'bar shog / 'og min gnas su sku ni rab grub nas/ / dga' ldan du ni rgyal tshab sa bcu'i mgon/ / ma 'ongs 'dzam gling 'di ru sprul pa'i skur/ / snang mdzad de yi smon lam bdag 'grub shog / rgyal ba byams pas rgyal tshab nyid mdzad nas/ / bskal bzang sangs rgyas drug pa nas bzung ste/ / snang mdzad bar gyis sprul pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston/ / karma pa yi smon lam bdag 'grub shog / ces pa 'di rgyal dbang chos grags rgya mtshos chos grwa rtses thang du stsal ba'o/ /

The one who taught the truth that has been proven true, The incomparable Teacher, made the aspiration That his own teachings would long blaze in this world realm. So may they greatly blaze forth just as he aspired! In Akanishta he’ll achieve the kaya and then become The regent in Tushita, a protector on the tenth level. And in the future he will become visible in this world As a nirmanakaya. May I fulfill his aspirations. He will become Maitreya’s regent and display Miracles from the time of the sixth buddha of This fortunate aeon till Vairochana appears. May I fulfill the aspirations of the Karmapa! This was given by Gyalwang Chödrak Gyatso at Tsethang Monastery.

dge 'dun sde rgyas 'chad rtsod rtsom pa dang*/ / thos bsam sgom pa'i bya ba kun 'phel zhing*/ / 'dus pa mthun dang tshe ring nad med sogs/ / 'dod dgu du mas phongs par ma gyur cig / 'byor ba rnam thos bus kyang 'gran med cing*/ / btsun tshul nye ba 'khor ltar bag yod par/ / gzhan don spyan ras gzigs kyi phrin las bzhin/ / karma pa yi bstan pa rgyas byed shog / ces pa 'di mi bskyod pas so/ /

May the Sangha thrive! May their scholarly activities And listening, contemplation, and meditation flourish! May they all be harmonious, live long, and have good health! And may they never be deprived of all they need and want! In riches may they be unrivaled by Vaishravana, And in their conduct may they be as careful as Upali! In helping others, may they act like Avalokita, And may they always spread the teachings of the Karmapa! By Mikyö Dorje

phyogs bcu'i zhing du dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi/ / phrin las ma lus sgrub pa'i karma pa/ / chos grags rgya mtsho zhes byar grags de yi/ / deng 'dir bkra shis bde legs 'byung gyur cig / bdud bzhi las rgyal rgyal ba'i phrin las pa/ / karma pa bstan bstan pa'i snying po ni/ / phyogs mthar kun khyab khyab cing rgyun mi 'chad/ / rtag par rab 'phel 'phel ba'i bkra shis shog / dkon mchog gsum gyi bden pa dang*/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang*/ tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mnga' thang chen po dang*/ chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stobs kyis de de bzhin du 'grub par gyur cig / bkra shis dpal 'bar 'dzam gling rgyan/ / mnga' ris rgyal khams bod kyi yul/ / kha ba can gyi byang phyogs su/ / chos sgrub brgyud kyi bstan pa dar ba dang*/ / 'dzam gling bde ba'i bkra shis shog / 'dzam bu gling bde bar mdzad du gsol/ /

He who accomplishes all the activity Of all the buddhas of three times and ten directions Is the Karmapa known as Chödrak Gyatso: May his good fortune, joy, and goodness spring forth here and now! May the essence of the teachings, the teachings of the Karmapa, The activity of the victors, victorious over the four maras In uninterrupted fullness fill all directions to their ends, And may this always flourish—may this flourishing be auspicious! By the truth of the Three Jewels, the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the great might of the perfect completion of the two accumulations, and the utterly pure and inconceivable power of the dharma expanse, may it be so accomplished! A blaze of good fortune, the ornament of the world! In the realm and the kingdom of the land of Tibet, To the north of the Land of Snows, May the teachings of the Practice Lineage flourish! May the world have the good fortune of happiness! We ask that the world be made happy!
sangs rgyas byang sems kyi bstod tshogs
A Collection of Praises of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas
'jam dbyangs bstod pa/
A Praise of Manjushri
bcom ldan 'das mgon po 'jam pa'i rdo rje la mchod par brjod pa'i tshul gyis bstod pa bzhugs/
A praise of the bhagavan protector Manjuvajra in the form of a declaration of veneration:

oM swasti sid+d+haM/ bla ma dang rje btsun 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dpal ldan blo gros d+hIlas byung ba gzhon nu'i tshul 'chang mdzes pa'i sku/ / chu skyes bsil zer can dbus skyil mo krung bcas rol pa'i 'gying bag can/ / gur gum mdog can zur phud lnga pa snyan gong ut+pal gyis mdzes shing*/ / sna tshogs rin chen rab spras lha yi na bza'i smad g.yogs legs par bgos/ / phyag g.yas mkha' ltar sngo ba'i ral gri tsha zer can 'od rab 'phros pas/ / mun pa'i 'thibs po dral zhing bdud bcom de bzhin nyid don thugs chud cing*/ / g.yon gyi ut+pal 'dab brgyad rnam rgyas mgul pa'i ngos su rab rgyas pa/ / ge sar snying po dri med steng na rgyal ba'i gsung rab glegs bam bsnams/ / khyod gtsug mi bskyod skyob pas rab mtshan rdo rje rnon po yi ge drug / bzhad pa'i gad rgyangs can gyi zhabs rdul yid 'ong kho bo'i spyi bor zhog / khyod sku bdag lus snying gi 'khor lor rnam bsam gang gis chags sdang sogs/ / ngan sems tha chad dam pas smad pa de kun mgon pos bzod mdzod cig / rgyal sras thu bo'i rnam thar zab cing rgya che bdag la nyer stsol mdzod/ / yab gcig nyid las lha gzhan bdag la re ba ma mchis skal ngan bdag / nyin mtshan kun tu 'jam dbyangs gus pas bsams kyang khyed kyi thugs rje'i shugs/ / cung zad med snyam 'on kyang byur ngan rang gi nyes pas bslad par zad/ / da dung khyod mnyes ma gyur bar du skyabs gzhan 'tshol bar ma gyur cig / ces pa 'di sa skya paN+Di tas sbyar ba'o/

oṃ svasti siddhaṃ I prostrate to the guru and the noble lord Manjughosha. Glorious intelligence arisen from dhīḥ with youth and beauty, You are graceful with crossed legs on the water-bloomed and the cool-rayed, The color of saffron, with five topknots, your ears beautified by utpalas. You are well adorned by diverse jewels and a skirt of divine cloth. Your right hand holds a sky-blue sword, radiant with light and heat. You have sliced through thick darkness and conquered maras; your mind contains the meaning of suchness. Your left hand holds an eight-petaled utpala that blooms beside your throat. Atop its stainless heart is a volume of the Buddha’s words. The top of your head is well marked by the protector Akshobhya. Joyous singer of The six syllables of Vajratikshna, place the pleasing dust of your feet atop my head. I imagine you in the chakra of my heart. Protector, please bear with My passion, aversion, terrible malice, and all that the sublime scorn. First among bodhisattvas, bestow upon me your profound and vast abilities. Only father, in my ill fortune, I place no hope in anyone other than you. All day and night I think of you with devotion, Manjughosha, yet I wonder, “Has your compassion no power at all?” But it is just my own disastrous fault. Yet, until I please you, may I never seek any other refuge. This was composed by Sakya Pandita.
dpal mo'i 'phags bstod/
Bhikshuni Lakshmi's Praise of Noble Avalokiteshvara

oM 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo/ / 'jig rten bla ma srid pa gsum gyis bstod pa po/ / lha yi gtso bo bdud dang tshangs pas bstod pa po/ / thub pa'i rgyal mchog bstod pas grub par mdzad pa po/ / 'jig rten gsum gyi mgon po mchog la phyag 'tshal lo/ / bde gshegs dpag med sku ste sku bzang 'dzin pa po/ / bde gshegs snang ba mtha' yas dbu rgyan 'dzin pa po/ / phyag g.yas mchog sbyin yi dwags bkres skom sel ba po/ / phyag g.yon gser gyi pad mas rnam par brgyan pa po/ / dri zhim ral pa'i 'phreng ba dmar ser 'khyug pa po/ / zhal ras rgyas pa zla ba lta bur mdzes pa po/ / spyan gyi pad ma mchog tu bzang zhing yangs pa po/ / kha ba dung ltar rnam dkar dri ngad ldan pa po/ / dri med 'od chags mu tig tshom bu 'dzin pa po/ / mdzes pa'i 'od zer skya rengs dmar pos brgyan pa po/ / pad ma'i mtsho ltar phyag ni dngar bar byas pa po/ / ston ka'i sprin gyi mdog dang ldan zhing gzhon pa po/ / rin chen mang pos dpung pa gnyis ni brgyan pa po/ / lo ma'i mchog ltar phyag mthil 'jam zhing gzhon pa po/ / ri dwags pags pas nu ma g.yon pa bkab pa po/ / snyan cha gdu bus sgeg cing rgyan rnams 'chang ba po/ / dri ma med pa pad+ma'i mchog la gnas pa po/ / lte ba'i ngos ni pad+ma'i 'dab ltar 'jam pa po/ / gser gyi ska rags mchog la nor bus spras pa po/ / sta zur dkris pa'i ras bzang sham thabs 'dzin pa po/ / thub pa'i mkhyen mchog mtsho chen pha rol phyin pa po/ / mchog brnyes bsod nams mang po nye bar bsags pa po/ / rtag tu bde ba'i 'byung gnas rga nad sel ba po/ / gsum mthar mdzad cing mkha' spyod spyod pa ston pa po/ / lus can mchog ni bdud dpung 'khrug las rgyal ba po/ / gser gyi rkang gdub sgra yis zhabs yid 'ong ba po/ / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi yis dpen par mdzad pa po/ / ngang pa'i 'gros 'dra glang chen dregs ltar gshegs pa po/ / yongs rdzogs nye bar bsags shing bstan pa gnyer ba po/ / 'o ma'i mtsho dang chu yi mtsho las sgrol ba po/ / gang zhig rtag tu tho rangs langs nas gus pa yis/ / spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po yid la sems byed cing*/ / bstod pa'i mchog 'di dag cing gsal bar 'don byed na/ / de ni skyes pa 'am ni bud med yin yang rung*/ / skye ba 'di 'am ma 'ongs skye ba thams cad du/ / 'jig rten 'jig rten las 'das dgos pa kun 'grub 'gyur/ / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dge slong ma dpal mos li khar shing 'phel du bstod pa mdzad pa rdzogs so/

oṃ I prostrate to the world’s protector. Guru of the world, you are praised by the three worlds. Lord of gods, you are praised by Mara and Brahma. Best of buddhas, you are accomplished through praise. I prostrate to the supreme protector of the three worlds. Body of countless sugatas, your body is excellent. Your head is adorned by Amitabha. Your right hand, with the mudra of generosity, dispels the hunger and thirst of hungry ghosts. Your left hand is adorned by a golden lotus. Your fragrant locks flash with orange light. Your face, as full as the moon, is handsome. The lotuses of your eyes are wide and beautiful. You are as white as snow or a conch, and fragrant. You wear clusters of pearls that gleam with stainless light. You are adorned by beautiful light-rays as red as dawn. Your hands are like lotuses on a lake. You are youthful, the color of autumn clouds. Your two upper arms are adorned by many jewels. The palms of your hands are as smooth and youthful as the finest of leaves. Your left breast is covered by a deerskin. You gracefully wear earrings and other jewelry. You are on a supreme and stainless lotus. Your navel is as smooth as a lotus petal. Your golden belt is decorated by many jewels. Your hips are enveloped by a skirt of fine cotton. You have crossed the ocean and reached the buddhas’ wisdom. You have achieved the supreme and accumulated much merit. Source of lasting happiness, you dispel aging and sickness. You free from the three, and show the way to the celestial realm. Great being, you are victorious over the attacks of Mara’s forces. Your feet ring pleasantly with golden bangles. You are adorned by the four brahmaviharas. You advance like a swan or a proud elephant. You have gathered and keep custody of all Dharma. You free others from the lakes of milk and water. Anyone who always rises at dawn and, respectfully Bringing Avalokiteshvara to mind, Clearly recites these praises, Whether they are male or female, Will accomplish all mundane and supramundane needs In this and all future lives. This is the praise to Arya Avalokiteshvara composed by the Bhikshuni Lakshmi at Likar Shingpel.
byams bstod tshangs pa'i cod pan/
Brahma's Crown: A Praise of Maitreya
rgyal ba byams pa mgon po la smre sngags kyi sgo nas bstod pa tshangs pa'i cod pan zhes bya ba/
Brahma’s Crown, praise of Buddha Maitreyanatha through lamentation:

na maHshrI gu ru many+dzu g+ho ShA ya/ mnyes gshin byams pas rtag tu brlan yang nag po'i rtsa lag sreg / shin tu bcad dka'i 'ching ba bcad kyang snying rjes dam du bcings/ / zhi ba'i btang snyoms rgyun du ldan yang bdag pas gzhan la gces/ / 'jam dbyangs zhabs la gus pas btud nas mi pham mgon la bstod/ / gdong bzhi mes po'i zhal nas rab tu bsngags/ / spyan stong ldan pas dang bas rgyun du blta/ / dga' ma'i bdag pos dregs pa btang nas btud/ / rgyal tshab zhabs la gus pas phyag bgyi 'o/ /

namaḥ śhrī guru mañjughoshāya Although you are always moistened by loving affection, you burn the branches of evil. Although you have severed the bonds that are hardest to sever, you remain tightly bound by compassion. Although you always have the equanimity of peace, you cherish others before yourself. Having respectfully bowed to Manjughosha’s feet, I will now praise Maitreyanatha. You are greatly praised by our forefather with four faces And always gazed upon with awe by the one with a thousand eyes. Rati’s lord surrenders his arrogance and bows to you. I respectfully prostrate to your feet, regent of the Buddha.

dwangs pa'i mtsho la 'dab brgya pa ste de nyid la yang nyin byed 'od/ / dag pa'i mkha' la rgyu skar mgon te des kyang kun da'i tshal la bzhin/ / mtshan dpe'i phreng bas gang sku mthong ma thag tu 'gro ba'i yid 'phrog pa/ / byams mgon zhabs pad skye zhing skye bar bdag gi gtsug na mdzes gyur cig / bdud 'joms 'khor du 'jigs pa kun dang bral/ / mtshungs med dpa' bo srid gsum ston pa mchog / nyam ngar lhung ba'i 'gro la rtag tu gzigs/ / rnam 'dren khyod kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

You are a hundred-petaled lotus in a pure lake resplendent with sunlight. You are a lily grove on which shines the ruler of stars and planets. Anyone who sees your body, garlanded by marks and signs, is captivated. May my crown be beautified, Maitreyanatha, by your feet in every birth. As you have conquered Mara, your entourage is free from all fear. Peerless brave one, you are the best teacher of the three worlds. You always look after beings fallen into terror. I prostrate to your feet, our guide.

mtha' yas shes byar thogs pa med 'jug pa'i/ / mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ma rungs bdud kyi sde/ / gnam lcags babs pa'i me tog gzhon nu bzhin/ / pham mdzad stobs bcu'i dpal gyis brjid pa khyod/ / phas rgol glang po dregs pa'i klad 'gems shing*/ / legs bshad sgra chen 'khor dbus bsgrags pa yis/ / smra ba ngan pa'i wa skyes mthar mdzad pa'i/ / mi 'jigs bzhi ldan mi yi seng ge khyod/ / khengs pas mtho ba'i 'jig rten mes po dang*/ / nyag phran bdag po dge sbyong bram ze sogs/ / gang gis smra bar ma nus 'khor lo mchog / bskor bas 'gro la byams pa'i mgon po khyod/ / sku dang gsung la 'khrul pa'i ming yang med/ / dran pa ma nyams rtag tu mnyam par bzhag / tha dad 'dzin pa ma brtags btang snyoms kyis/ / dben phyir khyod kyi spyod pa yongs su dag / 'dun pa dang ni brtson 'grus dran pa dang*/ / ting 'dzin shes rab rnam par grol ba la/ / nyams pa'i go skabs ma lus ring du mdzad/ / de phyir khyod kyi rtogs pa bla na med/ / dus gsum thams cad chags thogs med par mkhyen/ / sku gsung thugs kyi 'phrin las rnam par dag / srid pa'i phyi mtha' ji srid 'gro ba'i don/ / mdzad pa'i khur gyis dgyes bzhin 'jug pa khyod/ / rgya che'i yon tan phung po rab rdzogs pas/ / phra mo'i skyon yang 'jug pa'i skabs bcom pa/ / khyod kyi brtse ba'i yul du gyur pa bdag / smre sngags sgo nas smra la yud tsam dgongs/ / sdug bsngal rgya mtsho che las sgrol ba'i gru/ / dal 'byor tshang ba'i rten 'di yin na yang*/ / bag med le lo gnyid dang bre mo'i gtam/ / rnyed bkur 'dod pa'i skyon gyis sbags pa yis/ / don med phyogs su bkol bas don chen po/ / bde blag bsgrub pa'i lus bzang chud gson pa/ / mi yi sha tshugs phyugs kyi 'du shes can/ / bdag la khyod kyi thugs rjes gzigs su gsol/ / rnyed dka' don che'i dal 'byor thob pa yang*/ / stobs kyis mi bzlog 'bros par mi nus pa'i/ / stobs ldan 'chi bdag pho nya bkye ba dang*/ / na dang rga bas zin par mthong na yang*/ / nam 'chi nges med 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe/ / thams cad bor nas 'gro ba ma dran par/ / lo zla zhag rnams don med 'da' byed pa'i/ / rab rmongs bdag la brtse ba'i dus la bab/ / nges par legs pa'i go 'phang smos ci dgos/ / lam gyi rten du thub pas bsngags pa yi/ / mtho ris tsam yang thob pa'i gdeng med pa/ / bdag la khyed kyis btang snyoms mdzad lags sam/ / mtho ris dpal dang ldan pa'i lus thob kyang*/ / gsung rab tshul bzhin 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis/ / ma nor lam bzang rnyed par ma gyur na/ / slar yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho nyid du ltung*/ / de phyir gti mug mun pa'i smag chen gyis/ / yun ring dus su bsgribs pas blang dor gnas/ / ji bzhin 'byed la kun nas 'thoms gyur pa/ / bdag la shes rab sgron me stsal tu gsol/ /

Your wisdom penetrates unimpeded all objects of knowledge. The strength of your wisdom crushes vicious maras Like a meteor falling on a young flower. You are magnificent with the splendor of the ten strengths. You crush the brain of the mad elephant of aggression. Through the great sound of your eloquent teaching in assembly, You exterminate the foxes of evil speech. You, lion of humanity, have fourfold fearlessness. The forefather of the world, exalted with arrogance; Kamadeva; sages; brahmins; and others Are unable to utter the Wheel of Dharma That you, Maitreyanatha, turn for beings. Your body and speech are without even the word “delusion.” With unimpaired recollection, you are always in meditation. Because you are devoid of both fixation on distinctions And unexamined neutrality, your conduct is utterly pure. You have cast far behind you all chance of impairment Of intention, diligence, mindfulness, Samadhi, wisdom, and liberation. Therefore, your realization is unsurpassable. You know the three times without any limitation or impediment. The activity of your body, speech, and mind is completely pure. Until the end of samsara you will benefit beings. You took on this burden with joy. The mass of your vast qualities is complete. You have destroyed even the smallest avenue for the entrance of faults. I, the object of your kindness, shall address you in lamentation. Consider me for a moment. This support with complete leisure and resources Is the boat of liberation from the vast ocean of suffering. Yet it is rotted by carelessness, laziness, sleep, Foolish talk, and the desire for gain and respect. Through my employing it in meaningless endeavors, this good body, Which could have easily accomplished great things, has been wasted. I have a human appearance but the attitudes of an animal. I pray that you regard me with compassion. Although I have acquired leisure and resources, Hard to find and of great meaning, the messengers of powerful death Cannot be escaped or repelled by strength. I see that I have been caught by sickness and aging, But I forget that the time of my death is unknown, That when I die I will depart leaving everything behind. I let years, months, and days pass meaninglessly. The time has come for you to be kind to me in my stupidity. What need is there to mention the achievement of liberation? I lack the assurance that I shall acquire even the higher birth Praised by Shakyamuni as the path’s support. Are you going to remain indifferent to me? Although I have acquired a body with the attributes of higher realms, If I do not find the unmistaken good path through the wisdom That correctly discerns the meaning of the Buddha’s words, I will once again fall into the ocean of samsara. I have long been obscured by the great darkness of ignorance, And am utterly bewildered as to what to accept and reject. Therefore, I pray that you bestow on me the torch of wisdom So that I may properly distinguish them.

rab 'bar lcags kyi sa gzhir me lces sreg cing lus la mtshon cha'i char pa 'bab/ / gshin rje'i skyes bus gsal shing la bskyon zangs zhun ldud cing phur bus lce la 'debs/ / gangs ris bskor ba'i 'khyag pa'i sbubs chud bu yug 'tshubs pa'i rlung gis btab pa yis/ / la lar chu bur brgya byung la lar rdol zhing lus ni tshal pa du mar gas/ / gdong ni skras khebs kha ni skam zhing chu klung mthong ste btung phyir rgyugs pa na/ / ral gri mdung rnams thogs pa'i skyes bus 'gegs shing chu yang rnag khrag nyid du mthong*/ / kha ni khab kyi mig tsam lba bas mgrin 'gags zas skom rnyed kyang spyod mi nus/ / zos shing 'thung rnams 'bar nas tshig cing bshang gcis 'tsho la rang sha bcad de za/ / rmongs pa'i mun chen 'thibs pas lam dang lam min 'byed la blo yi nus pa bral/ / gcig la gcig gsod lha mi'i gzhan dbang gyur pas brdeg dang bkol ba'i sdug bsngal 'bab/ / lha rnams dpal la 'khrug pa'i phrag dog me chen 'bar bas yid bde'i go skabs bcom/ / 'thab rtsod las byung lus bcad dral zhing g.yo sgyus bslad pas bden mthong skal ba med/ /

The blazing iron ground burns with tongues of flame. A rain of weapons falls on their bodies. Yama’s henchmen impale them on stakes, pour molten copper into their mouths, and pierce their tongues with spikes. Trapped in ice, surrounded by mountains of snow, and struck by fierce blizzards, some break out in hundreds of blisters. For some, they burst, and their bodies crack into many pieces. Their faces are covered by hair, their mouths are dry. They see rivers and rush toward them in order to drink. They are stopped by people holding swords and spears. They see water as pus and blood. Their mouths are as small as the eye of a needle. Their throats are blocked by goiters. Even if they acquire food and drink, they cannot partake of it. Whatever they eat or drink blazes, burning them. They live on excrement and urine. They cut off their own flesh and eat it. Through the thick darkness of their bewilderment, they lack the intelligence to distinguish between the path and what is not the path. They kill one another. They come under the power of gods and humans, and the suffering of being beaten and enslaved falls upon them. Their jealousy of the gods’ splendor blazes like a great fire, destroying any chance of happiness. Their bodies are dismembered in warfare. Polluted by deceptiveness, they have no chance to see the truth.

Even hearing such things, let alone seeing them, Generates terror in the heart. Falling into the great abysses of hell, hungry ghosts, animals, and demigods Is the result of actions disparaged by the sublime. I am desperate because of all the unbearable wrongdoing That I have accumulated throughout beginningless time and all that I shall. I am headed toward those abysses. The time has come for you to liberate me from the danger of lower births. Even in the human realm, those highly placed Through wealth and power fear their loss. Those who lack the qualities and affluence of higher realms Exhaust themselves in the search for the pleasures they desire. Far greater than the pleasure gained by those who, Desiring pleasure, attempt to gain it, Are the many types of physical suffering And mental misery by which they are tormented. Those gods who revel amid the splendor of higher realms Have beautiful bodies well adorned by precious jewelry. They live in mansions and delightful groves. They enjoy, for a long time, the pleasures of desire. Yet, when they are caught by the unpleasant signs of death, They think, “I shall soon and unwillingly be parted From these captivating, beautiful devis, so dear to me; These delightful groves; this food of amrita; these fine clothes; This beautiful jewelry; and these youthful gods.” When they see that, they suffer mentally With an intensity far greater than that Of the physical pleasure of being born in that place. They are burnt by the tongues of flame of their misery. They have used up the results of all the good they did Through great effort in many lives. As through carelessness they have created the causes of lower births, They will again fall into lower realms. They are without thoughts of desire for pleasure. They bear no malice. They have abandoned sleep and affliction of mind. They are without suffering of body or mind. Through the strength of their samadhi, they dwell long in bliss. Even if one achieves the abodes of the form and formless gods, Since one is not liberated from the fetters of formation and suffering, Once the momentum of one’s past samadhi is exhausted, One will fall down again and circle continuously. In that way, even the foremost in samsara—gods and humans— Are swept along to the ocean of becoming by the rivers of suffering, Such as birth, aging, sickness, and death. It is inappropriate to be attached to the pleasures we crave. Nevertheless, because the eye of my intellect is obscured by craving, I misapprehend suffering as pleasure. I am obscured by incorrect thoughts. I pray that you liberate me from the great river of becoming. Drowning in the swamp of desire, I have strayed from the path of liberation. Enveloped in thick ignorance, I lack the eye of wisdom. Caught in the cage of complexity, I am shackled in the prison of samsara. I, tormented by karma, am a fit object of your compassion. In order to block the terrifying precipice of samsara, One must hear much of the stainless teachings. Relying on that, Through the strength of pure reason that examines correctly, One must correctly distinguish between the indicative and definitive Within the infinite Dharma, without depending on others. It is definitely necessary to achieve learning. However, what need is there to mention the subtle intentions of the Buddha? The eye of my intellect has not become clear even about the coarsest Points concerning what is appropriate and inappropriate. If this enemy, utter bewilderment, long obscures my heart, I will have no chance of liberation. Considering this, dispel my heart’s darkness. Ocean of learning, you heard much about all areas of knowledge In the presence of buddhas and bodhisattvas. The habit of your training throughout many lives was awakened. You are the only eye showing beings the good path. The sublime beings of the past have abandoned me. I am therefore desperate, without a protector. I am like a traveler who has lost his way. It is time, loving one, for you to take care of me. Refuge on whom I rely repeatedly with respect, Maitreya, you who liberate beings through maitri, Come quickly and be my spiritual friend Of the supreme vehicle in my every birth. You ceaselessly regard all beings with constant kindness. My mind, awed by the recollection of your qualities, Enters your presence every day. However, because of the distance, And because I enjoy the taste of solitude, Although I wish it, My body is unable to reach your abode. Therefore, sublime field of merit, In order to please you, and with pure benevolence, I offer you the finest jewels, divine fabric, And the things that Shakyamuni commended to bhikshus: The three robes of Dharma, the ringing staff, and the alms bowl. I also present well-arrayed, captivating offerings, Emanated through samadhi and aspiration. Filling all space with them, I offer them to the leader Of all human beings, with a mind free from craving and attachment. Through the pure virtue arising from that, May I become the refuge of all beings Who have wandered through samsara for so long, Who are tormented by millions of sufferings and lack happiness. Until I reach the sublime state of a guide of the world, In every birth may I acquire the support of full renunciation, A life of utterly pure brahmacharya. May my disposition for the supreme vehicle be awakened. May I be patient, honest, free from deception, And acquire fierce courage free from timidity, The diligences of devoted and constant effort, Faith, discernment, and excellent wisdom. May I encounter a spiritual friend Who has achieved perfect learning, Who has correctly apprehended the Buddha’s wisdom through pure reasoning, And is skilled in kindly teaching it to others. May I train for a long time, acquiring an ocean of learning. Having severed all doubts Through properly practicing the meaning Of what I have heard, may I please the sugatas. Not transgressing the limits placed by Shakyamuni, May they be respectful of the Buddha’s scion, the spiritual friend. May their faculties be most acute. May they be free from the fault of disloyalty. May I have an utterly pure retinue. Because their minds are disturbed by malevolent beings, They obstruct the feast of communal Dharma practice. May I not encounter, for even an instant, Malevolent companions who are Mara’s friends. When respectfully emulating Shakyamuni, The completion of vast deeds is obstructed By the disastrous actions of Mara. May there not even be the word “obstacle.” Conditions favorable to the pursuit of awakening Delight the sublime and were extolled By our guide as the ornaments of renunciates. May they be accomplished without hindrance. When I engage in the conduct of awakening, may I establish All disciples in full renunciation bound by pure training. May I bestow upon them all appropriate necessities Upon merely thinking of doing so. From now on in all my lives May whatever I do with body, speech, or mind Become a cause of benefit under all circumstances To all innumerable beings. Like a mother whose child has died, All beings are tormented by all sorts of suffering. May I always hold them affectionately in mind And give them all they desire. When the stains of the stage of devoted endeavor Have been purified, may I become like Mount Meru in the center of the golden ground, Prominent among all bodhisattvas Of the past, future, or present. In eyes, clairvoyance, Learning, and so forth, may I be supreme. May I transcend all childish faults And attain the confidence of independence from others. When I am training on the levels of an arya bodhisattva, Among all the brave ones abiding on the levels Who have appeared, appear, or will appear in the three times, May I be like the king of birds amid a flying flock. May I have unimpeded, stainless knowledge Of all the extremely vast areas of knowledge That are difficult for other bodhisattvas to fathom. May I become a treasury of vast deeds. When the result of that conduct is accomplished, May I achieve the sum of all the kayas, realms, Retinues, deeds, lifespans, and aspirations Of all buddhas of the three times. Having perfected all of this through skillful conduct, May I send down a great rain of the amrita of Dharma Upon all beings, whom I have kept in mind for so long a time, And liberate them all in one instant.

lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten kun gyi skyabs gcig pu rgyal ba byams pa mgon po la smre sngags kyi sgo nas bstod pa tshangs pa'i cod pan zhes bya ba 'di ni/ mang du thos pa'i rgyal khams pa blo bzang grags pa'i dpal gyis lho brag stod ri nyi shar gyi dben gnas su sbyar ba dge legs su gyur cig

This praise through lamentation of the Buddha Maitreyanatha, the single refuge of all in the world including the gods, entitled Brahma’s Crown, was composed by the learned wanderer Lozang Drakpa’i Pal, at the isolated place of Tori Nyishar in Lhodrak. May it bring virtue and goodness!
sa snying bstod pa sa gzhi'i mdzes rgyan bzhugs/
The Praise "Beautiful Ornament of the Earth"

swa/ sa yi snying pos 'gro kun rjes su 'dzin/ / sa gzhi bzhin du rnam mang yon tan rten/ / sa gsum re skong yid bzhin nor bu'i tshul/ / sa bcu'i dbang phyug khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / sa nas sar 'dren rgyal ba'i sa la 'god/ / sa bcud rtsi sman lo tog rgyun spel zhing*/ / sa 'di rnam mang 'byor pas yongs bkang ba'i/ / sa yi lha mchog khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / bum bzang dpag bsam shing dang rdzogs ldan sprin/ / bdud rtsi'i chu mtsho ji bzhin gang gis khyod/ / dran pa de la dpal du legs gnas pa/ / thugs rje'i bdag nyid khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / rab 'byams sras bcas rgyal ba'i yon tan mchog / nam mkha' mdzod kyi mnga' bdag khyod gcig pu/ / rgyal sras tshul gyi mtha' yas zhing rnams su/ / rgyal ba'i mdzad pa mtha' dag skyong la 'dud/ / dpag med yon tan nor bu'i 'od zer gyis/ / snyigs ma'i rgud pa mtha' dag gtan du bsnyil/ / phun tshogs sde bzhi'i dpal gyis mngon mtho ba'i/ / rlabs chen phrin las mdzad la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / 'jam dbyangs 'jig rten dbang phyug kun tu bzang*/ / mi pham pa sogs rgyal sras sems dpa' mchog / rnam mang bskal par mchod cing gsol btab las/ / khyod gcig yud tsam dran pas re 'dod rnams/ / yid bzhin stsol la khyad par 'phags zhes su/ / rgyal bas bsngags pa rgyal sras thu bo mchog / rgyal ba rnams dang dbyer med khyod bstod pas/ / bdag la ji 'dod dpal rnams legs stsol mdzad/ / sa gsum 'gro 'dis dad pa'i stobs rnyed cing*/ / sa yi dbang phyug khyed kyis rjes su 'dzin/ / sa bcud dpal 'phel sa steng bde bas khyab/ / sa nas sar bgrod sa mchog 'grub par shog /

SVA! Kshitigarbha, you care for all beings. Like the ground, you support many qualities. Like a wish-fulfilling jewel, you fulfill the hopes of the three levels. I prostrate to and praise you, the lord of the ten levels. Leading beings from level to level, you establish them in buddhahood. You increase the earth’s fruit, its herbs and crops. You are the lord of this earth filled with diverse riches. I prostrate to and praise you. You are like an excellent vase, a wish-fulfilling tree, A cloud of the age of perfection, and a lake of amrita. The thought of you brings prosperity. I prostrate to and praise you who embody compassion. You alone have the treasury of space, Supreme among the qualities of innumerable buddhas and bodhisattvas. In the guise of a bodhisattva, you do the deeds Of a buddha in realms without limit. I bow to you. Your limitless qualities are like the light-rays of a jewel. They end forever all degenerate decline. Your vast activity brings the splendor of fourfold abundance. I prostrate to and praise you. The Buddha praised you, supreme and foremost bodhisattva, Saying that the brief recollection of you is more effective For the fulfillment of wishes than to worship and supplicate Manjughosha, Lokeshvara, Samantabhadra, Ajita, And the other great bodhisattvas, The buddhas’ disciples, for many kalpas. Through my praising you who are inseparable from the buddhas, Please bestow all the splendors that I desire. May all beings of the three levels gain faith. May they be cared for by you, lord of the earth. May the earth’s richness increase. May all on the earth be filled with joy. Passing from level to level, may they accomplish the supreme level.
ces tshigs su bcad pa bkra shis rdzas brgyad kyi grangs su son pa 'di ni mi pham 'jam dpal dgyes pas me rta khrums zla 'khor lo'i tshes nyer bdun la bkod pa dge legs 'phel/

These stanzas, equal in number to the eight auspicious substances, were composed by Mipam Jampal Gyepa on the twenty-seventh day of the month Trum in the fire horse year. May virtue and goodness increase!

Praise of Shri Samantabhandra with Aspirations
de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i mnga' bdag byang chub sems dpa' chen po dpal kun tu bzang po la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
I prostrate to the master of the secrets of all tathagatas, the great bodhisattva Shri Samantabhandra.

grangs med rgya mtshor sangs rgyas rgya mtsho bsten gyur kyang*/ / phyi ma'i mthar thug rgya mtshor 'byung ba'i rgyal ba rgya mtsho kun mchod cing*/ / thub pa'i gsang 'dzin rgya mtsho ltar zab phyogs bcu rgya mtsho'i mthar thug bar/ / rgyal ba kun gyi drung na khyod snang khyod ni gar yang 'gro 'ong bral/ / dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba kun dang thugs kyi dgongs pa rab mnyam zhing*/ / rgyal ba kun gyi gsung dbyangs ji snyed khyod kyi gsung dang dbyer med 'dres/ / de rnams sku yi sprul pa ji snyed khyod kyi sprul pa'ang de snyed de/ / 'on kyang bdag ni lam la slob ces rgyal sras 'dus pa kun la ston/ / khyod kyi sgyu ma rab tu 'jig med nam mkha'i dbyings bas sra ba 'di/ / rdo rje rin chen dpal ldan dbang po'i spyod yul kun las 'das/ / skad cig dbang bskur 'od zer chen po dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyis mdzad/ / sems can khams kun mthun par 'jug cing rgyal ba rnams dang gcig pa'i 'phrul/ / de yis tshur mthong sems 'di skrag nas zhig par ma gyur khyod kyi mthu/ / khyod kyi mdzad pa 'di shong gyur pa'i nam mkha' 'di ma ral ba 'jigs/ / nyan rang rgyal sras dpa' bo stobs ldan kun kyang 'di yis skrag min nam/ /

Glorious lord of all secrets, You know everything in an instant. Your mind contains boundless pristine wisdom. I bow to you, great vajra who bestows the supreme. Your nature is peace, your appearance variety. You know everything, but see it as nothing. Youthful bodhisattva, you are the elder of all buddhas. I prostrate to you, Samantabhadra, who are unlike anyone else. As with the extremes of the past, you have passed beyond the misery of thought. As with the extreme of the future, you are the mother of all bodhisattvas. As with the extremes of the present, you dwell in all realms of space. You who are wondrous, your life is an ocean of wonders. The ends of space are solely infinite, empty of all. The ends of dharmadhatu are solely infinite, utterly pure. The realms of sentient beings, infinite, are solely illusory. Your deeds are infinite, solely unknown. The wondrous great sage defeated the powers of Mara And awoke to wondrous buddhahood under the bodhi tree. When infinite wondrous bodhisattvas gathered, Your inconceivable, wondrous life was clearly heard. Yet later I developed doubts about you, And so I shall praise your liberation with a sincere mind. Self-arisen hero, sole foe of the Maras, Most glorious of all the bodhisattvas, You have served oceans of buddhas For uncountable oceans of aeons in the past. You make offerings to the oceans of buddhas Appearing in the oceans that stretch to the ends. Holding the sages’ secrets, you appear in the presence Of all the buddhas through the reaches, deep as an ocean, Of the oceans of the ten directions, Yet you are free of coming and going. You are the equal in your wisdom mind Of all the buddhas who have appeared in the three times, And your speech mixes inseparably With the melodious voices of all the victors. You have as many emanations As there are emanations of their bodies. And yet, saying that you are training on the path, You teach the assemblies of the bodhisattvas. Your illusion, utterly fearless And harder than the expanse of space, A glorious jewel vajra, Transcends all the spheres of the senses. All the buddhas of the three times Empower you in an instant with great light rays. You engage the realms of all sentient beings equally With emanations that are the same as the buddhas’. It is your power that this ordinary person’s mind Is not destroyed from the terror of this. We fear that these deeds of yours Will rend the sky in which they must fit— Does this not frighten the listeners and self-buddhas And even all the powerful heroes?

e ma ngo mtshar ba spu'i khung bu gcig nas sems kyi skad cig gcig la nam mkha'i khyon/ / me tog bdug pa sgron me'i tshogs dang dri chab zhal zas ro mchog sil snyan dpag med sprin/ / gdugs dang bla re na bza' lda ldi rab bkra dri med rin chen sna tshogs dpag med sprin/ / rin chen rgyan mchog dbu rgyan dpung rgyan snang byed do shal yan lag spras pa'i sprin/ / lha dang lha mos mdzes pa'i gar byed dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho bstod pa'i sgra dbyangs sprin/ / rab tu spro byed rgyal ba gcig la mchod par byed ltar dus gsum rgyal ba thams cad mchod/ / sems can khams dang mnyam pa'i sprul pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa'i sprin/ / lha dbang tshangs pa 'phrog byed zhi ba lus ngan 'jig rten skyong ba dang*/ / nyi ma zla ba dbang phyug chen po lha min dbang po nam mkha' lding*/ / 'khor los bsgyur dang mdzes pa'i mi mo sna tshogs tshul ldan yid g.yo dang*/ / la lar gshin rje mthar byed khro tshogs rab 'bar bzod par dka' ba'i sprin/ / la lar nyan thos rnam thar zhi ba rang rgyal lta bu dang*/ / la lar sa bcu'i dbang phyug sna tshogs phyin bcu spyod mdzad cing*/ / la lar mchog gi sprul pa chen po mdzad pa bcu gnyis mdzad pa'i sprin/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la yang chos dbyings nam mkha'i mthar khyab ston/ / dus gsum gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad zhing dang 'khor du bcas pa yang*/ / rang gi ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu ston pa'i rdzu 'phrul stobs mnga' ba/ / gsung gcig la yang de snyed chos kun tshig gcig ma lus sgra dbyangs ston/ / ting 'dzin gcig gis shes bya'i gnas rnams kun dang mnyam pa'i ting 'dzin 'jug / rtog pa mi mnga' sems can khams kyi rnam rtog kun dang dus gcig mkhyen/ / smon lam rnam thar tshul 'di mthong ba'i rgyal sras dpa' bo ma lus pa/ / kun bzang spyod la gnas par shog ces dus gsum kun tu dar dir sgrogs/ / khyod kyi mtshan thos skad cig zhag dang zla ba lo dang bskal pa dang*/ / bskal pa brgya stong grangs med dpag med yongs su smin pa'i sems can khams/ / skad cig re rer stong gsum rdul phran grangs bas mang ba rnam par grol/ / mchog gi sprul pa rgyal ba kun gyi mdzad mi spyod pa skad cig mdzad/ / 'on kyang mos dang chog shes mi mnga' 'dod chags 'di 'dra kye ma mtshar/ / bdud dang log 'dren mthu chen 'joms pa'i zhe sdang 'di 'dra kye ma 'jigs/ / rtog pa'i mtshan ma rdul tsam mi g.yo gti mug chen por zhugs pa dmad/ / dus gsum rgyal dang 'phrin las mnyam zhes nga rgyal 'di 'dra gsungs pa thos/ / rnam thar 'di 'dra bdag gis ston ces phrag dog chen po byed pa srid/ / 'di 'dra'i ye shes nyon mongs ming can mnyam par 'dzin pa gsang bdag ces/ / rdo rje theg pa bsdus par byed pa rdo rje zla ba dri med can/ / rgyal ba kun gyi snyan du gyur pa gsung gi dbang phyug rdo rje chos/ / drug pa yid rnam kun dang 'dres gyur kun tu bzang po rgyal ba'i thugs/ / de la sogs pa'i mtshan gyi rnam grangs sems can kun gyi ming bas mang*/ / rnam thar tshul 'di thub pa'i dbang pos shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las gsungs/ / de yi slad du mos pa'i rdul phran 'thor ba'i tshig 'di cha shas tsam/ /

Ema! So wondrous! In a single instant of mind, From a single pore there come out, filling the reaches of the sky, Infinite clouds of flowers, incense, masses of lamps, And scented water, food with sublime flavor, and music; Infinite clouds of lustrous parasols, Canopies, robes, banners, and jewels; Clouds decorated by the precious supreme jewels And tiaras, lustrous shoulder ornaments, and strings of necklaces; Melodious clouds of praise with the ocean of aspects Of melodies and the dance of beautiful gods and goddesses— Just as Raptu Troche offered these to one buddha, You offer them to all the buddhas of the three times. Infinite are the clouds of your various emanations Equal to the realms of sentient beings— The lord of gods Brahma, peaceful Hariḥ, Kubera, protector of the world, The sun and moon, Maheshvara, The lords of asuras, and garudas Universal emperors and beautiful women Who captivate the mind in various ways. To some, you appear as Yamantaka and the clouds Of wrathful beings who are difficult to forbear. To some, as the listeners with peaceful liberation And the self-awakened. To some, as the various lords of the tenth level Who perform the conduct of ten paramitas. To some as clouds of great supreme emanations Who display the twelve deeds. In each instant of mind as well, your displays Reach to the ends of the space of the dharma expanse. You have the strength of miracles to display In a single pore on your body All the buddhas who have appeared in the three times Along with their realms and retinues, And in a single utterance you teach That many melodies of all dharmas without a single word left out. With a single samadhi, you enter an absorption Equal to everything that can be known. Though you have no thoughts, you know the thoughts Of all realms of sentient beings in a single instant. All of the bodhisattva heroes who see These manners of aspiration and liberation Proclaim “May I dwell in the all good conduct!”—their whir Resounds everywhere in the three times. In each instant hearing your name Completely liberates realms of sentient beings That ripen in a moment, day, month, or year, Or aeon or hundreds of aeons Or uncountable infinite aeons more numerous Than atoms in the billionfold universe. In a single instant you perform deeds That the supreme nirmanakaya victors do not. And yet such desire as this is wondrous, Such longing and never being contented; Amazing such hatred as this that conquers The maras, false guides and sorcerers. Unmoved even a speck by the attributes of thoughts, Dwelling in great delusion is a marvel. I have heard you say such prideful things As that your activity equals that of the buddhas of the three times. Saying that you shall also display such liberation Can also be taken as great jealousy, But those who uphold such wisdom called by the names Of the afflictions are called the Masters of the Secrets. The Compiler of the Vajrayana, Stainless Vajrachandra, He Who is the Ear of All the Victors, The Master of Speech, Vajra Dharma, The Mind of the Victors, Samantabhadra Who is mixed with all aspects of the sixth mind— These and other epithets for your name Are more numerous than the names of sentient beings. The Mighty Sage told of the manner Of your liberation at length in the sutras, But these words are just a portion of that Tossed as atoms of longing for that purpose.

e ma'o rgyal sras kun tu bzang*/ / sngon gyi bskal pa rgya mtsho nas/ / dus ring rjes su bskyangs gyur kyang*/ / da dung khyod rjes mi 'jug pa'i/ / 'gro ba'i kun rtog mthu dang ldan/ / sangs rgyas kun shes rab thabs mkhas rmad byung dang*/ / smon lam stobs dang ye shes rgya mtsho yi/ / spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs gyur cig / byang chub sems ni nam yang brjed ma gyur/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho reg bya kun myong nas/ / ye shes rgya mtsho'i rtogs pa thob gyur cig / zhing khams rgya mtsho rtag tu sbyong ba dang*/ / rgyal ba rgya mtsho thams cad mnyes bgyid cing*/ / sems can rgya mtsho'i sdug bsngal sel ba dang*/ / bde mchog rgya mtsho rtag tu sbyin gyur cig / rgyal sras rgya mtsho kun dang 'grogs pa dang*/ / theg mchog rgya mtsho'i thabs rnams kun bzung nas/ / nyon mongs rgya mtsho shin tu dag byed cing*/ / rnam thar rgya mtsho sgyu ma ltar sbyong shog / tshe rabs rgya mtsho skye ba thams cad du/ / mi khom rgya mtsho thams cad rab spangs nas/ / dal 'byor rgya mtsho'i yon tan ma lus
