tshul la mnyam par 'jug par shog / bdag gis cung zad dwang bas gsol ba yis/ / smon lam 'di la dge ba ci yod pas/ / rgyal ba kun gyis spangs pa'i sems can rnams/ / bdag gis lam la 'god pa'i rgyur gyur cig / sems can gang dag bdag la sdang ba dang*/ / chags pa'i rnam rtog tshul min skyes pa dang*/ / mthong dang thos dang reg dang dran rnams kyang*/ / myur du phyir mi ldog pa thob gyur cig / bdag gi smon lam shin tu 'grub par shog /

EMA O! Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, Though you have long nurtured them Through oceans of aeons in the past, Wanderers still do not follow you— Their misconceptions still have power. Though all the buddhas have praised you, We beings who have not uttered a single word In praise of you are extremely deluded. If Manjushri, Avalokita, and so forth Follow your example in liberation, What of these beings of the three worlds Who do not follow you even a little bit? Shakyamuni said, “Foremost among all bodhisattvas Is the one named Samantabhadra. His wisdom has no equal.” My rejoicing awakened by that, I present offering clouds filling all realms, And I also offer you my body and all my possessions. I confess before you, with extreme regret, All my past wrongdoing, unvirtuous actions, And downfalls—all my karmic obscurations. May I never repeat them from now on. I implore the buddhas who abide in the oceans of directions and times To turn the ocean-like Wheel of Dharma in order to Dispel the darkness of beings’ minds. I pray that for immeasurable oceans of kalpas You remain without passing into nirvana. May all the conduct of generosity, morality, Patience, diligence, meditation, wisdom, Excellent means, aspiration, strength, And the ocean of pristine wisdom become perfectly complete. May I never forget bodhichitta. May I always see the ocean of buddhas, Always hear the ocean of dharma, And smell the fragrance of the ocean of morality. May I taste the flavors of the ocean of the mahayana, Experience the touch of the ocean of samadhi, And attain the realization of the ocean of pristine wisdom. May I always purify an ocean of realms, Please the ocean of buddhas, Dispel the suffering of the ocean of beings, And always give them an ocean of supreme bliss. May I be accompanied by the ocean of bodhisattvas, Hold all the means of the ocean of the supreme vehicle, Utterly purify the ocean of kleshas, And cultivate an illusory ocean of feats. In all their births, throughout the ocean of their lives, May the ocean of beings always Fully abandon the ocean of unleisured states And attain the qualities of the ocean of leisure and resources. May I never be separated from the bodhisattva Ajita, Avalokiteshvara, the protector Manjushrighosha, And you, Samantabhadra. May I engage in deeds equal to yours. Through my praying to you with some devotion, And through whatever virtue is in these aspirations, May I place on the path all the beings Who have been abandoned by all buddhas. May all beings who give rise to inappropriate thoughts Of hatred for me or attachment to me; And all who see, hear, touch, or think of me Quickly attain irreversibility. May my aspirations be perfectly fulfilled.

bcom ldan 'das kun tu bzang po la bstod cing smon lam btab pa zhes bya ba/ kun tu bzang po'i rnam par thar pa la mos pa lam du byed pa'i rang byung rdo rjes/ snyan ngag gi sdeb sbyor med par go bde ba'i ngag tu/ nags phu dpal gyi ri khrod du sbyar ba'o/ /rjes 'jug kun gyis 'don pa la brtson par mdzad par zhu/

This praise of the bhagavan Samantabhadra, with aspirations, was composed at the glorious retreat of Nakphu in easily understandable words without poetic language by Rangjung Dorje, who takes devoted consideration of Samantabhadra’s feats as a path. I request that all my followers recite it with diligence.

f.d: Praise of the Six Ornaments and Two Great Beings

OṂ May this bring joy and goodness!

tshogs gnyis chu gter gting mtha' yas/ / rnam dag yon tan nor bus gang*/ / rmad byung 'phrin las phyogs bcur 'phro/ / kun mkhyen thub pa'i zhabs la 'dud/ / mtha' bral zab mo'i mtsho la gnas/ / gzhan sde 'dab bzang bye ba yis/ / lta zer 'gog par ma nus pa'i/ / 'phags mchog klu sgrub zhabs la 'dud/ / mngal gyi dri ma ring du spangs/ / mdo rgyud kun gyi pha rol son/ / mu stegs rgol ba bzlog mdzad pa/ / Ar+Ya de ba'i zhabs la 'dud/ / rgyal ba nyid las gsung rab kun/ / gsan nas rgyal ba ji bzhin du/ / rgyal ba'i bstan pa rgyas mdzad pa'i/ / 'phags pa thogs med zhabs la 'dud/ / so so skye bo'i tshul bzung nas/ / dgu bcu go dgu 'bum sde yi/ / gsung rab rnams la gzungs spobs can/ / mkhas mchog dbyig gnyen zhabs la 'dud/ / rmad byung spobs pa'i tshig gcig gis/ / sa chen rnam pa drug g.yos nas/ / rgol ngan spobs pa rgyun gcod pa/ / phyogs kyi glang po'i zhabs la 'dud/ / phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba yi/ / 'od kyis 'dzam gling gang ba dang*/ / mnyam du grags pa'i pad dkar bye/ / chos kyi grags pa'i zhabs la 'dud/ / lugs bzang gser gyi ri bo la/ / thub pa'i brtul zhugs nyi ma shar/ / ngur smrig 'dzin pa'i pad tshal rgyas/ / yon tan 'od kyi zhabs la 'dud/ / legs par gsung ba'i nam mkha' la/ / blo gros zla ba shar ba yis/ / gdul bya'i ku mud 'dzum byed pa/ / shAkya 'od kyi zhabs la 'dud/ / bdag ni skye ba thams cad du/ / thub bstan mdzes pa'i rgyan gyur te/ / bslab sbyangs yon tan kun ldan pa'i/ / mchog tu gyur pa thob par shog /

The ocean of your two accumulations is immeasurably deep. It is filled with the jewels of your pure qualities. Your wondrous activity radiates in the ten directions. I bow to the feet of the omniscient Shakyamuni. You abide in the ocean of limitless profundity. The millions of birds of those who hold other views Are unable to block the light of your view. I bow to the feet of Nagarjuna, the supreme arya. You cast far away the stains of the womb. You perfectly mastered all sutras and tantras. You defeated the tirthikas in debate. I bow to the feet of Aryadeva. You heard all his words from the Buddha himself. You spread the Buddhadharma Like the Buddha himself. I bow to the feet of Arya Asanga. Adopting the manner of an ordinary person, You achieved the confident retention Of ninety-nine lakhs of the Buddha’s words. I bow to the feet of the most learned Vasubhandu. Through your wondrous eloquence, You made the earth shake six times with a single word, Destroying the confidence of adversaries. I bow to the feet of Dignaga. The light of your victory over all directions Filled Jambudvipa, causing the white lotus Of your renown to bloom. I bow to the feet of Dharmakirti. On the golden mountain of good tradition Shone the sun of Shakyamuni’s discipline. The lotus garden of those who wear saffron bloomed. I bow to the feet of Gunaprabha. In the sky of the Buddha’s words Shone the moon of wisdom, Making the night lilies of disciples smile. I bow to the feet of Shakyaprabha. In every birth may I become A beautiful ornament of the buddhadharma. May I become supreme among those Who have all the qualities of training.
ces 'di rgyan drug mchog gnyis la/ /bka' drin dran pa'i sgo nas ni/ /dge slong spong ba lhur len pas/ /yud tsam zhig gis bstod pa yin/
In recollection of the kindness of the six ornaments and the two supreme ones, this praise was composed in a moment by a bhikshu earnest in renunciation.

'dzam gling gsal byed rgyan du yongs grags drug / khyad par rgyal bas yang yang lung bstan pa/ / shing rta chen po klu sgrub thogs med nas/ / brgyud pa'i gsung rab chu bo kun 'dus te/ / gcig tu 'bab pa bka' brgyud ces grags pa/ / skye dgu'i mgon du gyur pa thams cad la/ / lus ngag yid kyis rtag tu phyag 'tshal 'dud/ / tshe rabs kun tu rjes su 'dzin gyur cig /

Renowned as ornaments who illuminated the world, The great chariots, Nagarjuna and Asanga, Were repeatedly prophesied by the Buddha. The confluence of their lineages Is renowned as the Kagyu, Who are the protectors of all beings. I continuously prostrate and bow to you all with body, speech, and mind. May you care for me in all my lives.
ces pa 'di yang*/ chos khri thang du/ grwa tshang gi dge 'dun pa rnams kyis dgos zhes bris pa'o/ /'di gnyis ka rje bdun pa'i gsung yin no/
This was written at Chötri Plain, where the Sangha in the monastery said it was needed. Both of these were composed by the seventh Karmapa.

In reliance upon some appearances in dreams, this was written by the actionless Manjughosha, who has respect for all traditions of Shakyamuni’s Dharma.
gsol 'debs rdo rje 'chang thung ma/
The Short Vajradhara Lineage Prayer

rdo rje 'chang chen tai lo nA ro dang*/ / mar pa mi la chos rje sgam po pa/ / dus gsum shes bya kun mkhyen karma pa/ / che bzhi chung brgyad brgyud par 'dzin rnams dang*/ / 'bri stag tshal gsum dpal ldan 'brug pa sogs/ / zab lam phyag rgya che la mnga' brnyes pa'i/ / mnyam med 'gro mgon dwags po bka' brgyud la/ / gsol ba 'debs so bka' brgyud bla ma rnams/ / brgyud pa 'dzin no rnam thar byin gyis rlobs/ / zhen log sgom gyi rkang par gsungs pa bzhin/ / zas nor kun la chags zhen med pa dang*/ / tshe 'di'i gdos thag chod pa'i sgom chen la/ / rnyed bkur zhen pa med par byin gyis rlobs/ / mos gus sgom gyi mgo bor gsungs pa bzhin/ / man ngag gter sgo 'byed pa'i bla ma la/ / rgyun du gsol ba 'debs pa'i sgom chen la/ / bcos min mos gus skye bar byin gyis rlobs/ / yengs med sgom gyi dngos gzhir gsungs pa bzhin/ / gang shar rtog pa'i ngo bo so ma de/ / ma bcos de kar 'jog pa'i sgom chen la/ / bsgom bya blo dang bral bar byin gyis rlobs/ / rnam rtog ngo bo chos skur gsungs pa bzhin/ / ci yang ma yin cir yang 'char ba la/ / ma 'gags rol par 'char ba'i sgom chen la/ / 'khor 'das dbyer med rtogs par byin gyis rlobs/ / skye ba kun tu yang dag bla ma dang*/ / 'bral med chos kyi dpal la longs spyod cing*/ / sa dang lam gyi yon tan rab rdzogs nas/ / rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang myur thob shog /

Great Vajradhara, Telo, Naropa, Marpa, Mila, Dharma lord Gampopa, The knower of three times, omniscient Karmapa, Those who hold the four elder and eight younger lineages, The Drikung and Taklung and Tsalpa, great Drukpa, And others who’ve mastered mahamudra’s profound path, Unequaled protectors of beings, Dakpo Kagyu, We supplicate you. Kagyu gurus, we uphold Your lineage: Please bless us to follow your example. Revulsion’s the foot of meditation, as it’s taught. As ones with no craving for food or for wealth, Who cut all the ties to this life: Please bless us To have no attachment to honor or to gain. Devotion’s the head of meditation, as it’s taught. As ones who pray always to the lama who opens The gate to the treasury of oral instructions: Please bless us to develop genuine devotion. The main practice is being undistracted, as it’s taught. As ones who whatever arises, rest simply, Not altering, in just that fresh essence of thought: Please bless us with practice that’s free of conception. The essence of thought’s the dharmakaya, as it’s taught. Not anything at all, yet arising as anything, In unceasing play we arise: Please bless us To realize samsara and nirvana inseparable. In all of our births may we never be separate From the perfect guru, enjoying Dharma’s splendor. Perfecting the qualities of the paths and levels, May quickly we reach the state of Vajradhara.
ces pa'ang ban sgar ba 'jam dpal bzang pos mdzad pa'o/
Composed by Pengar Jampel Sangpo.
byang sdom brgyud 'debs/
A Supplication to the Lineage of the Bodhisattva Vow

rgyal ba'i gsung rab mngon mtho dang nges legs theg pa gsum gyis lam/ rgyu'i theg pa gtso bor gyur pa'i brgyud pa'i rim pa rnams la mdor bsdus te gsol ba 'debs pa ni/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo/

A brief supplication to those in the lineage of the paths of the three vehicles of the Buddha’s scriptures to higher states and true excellence, primarily those of the causal vehicle. I prostrate to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

ston pa mtshungs med bcom ldan shAkya thub/ / rgyal tshab dam pa 'phags pa thogs med skyob/ / mkhas pa'i gtsug rgyan dbyig gnyen rnam grol sde/ / dad pa'i sar gnas grol sde mchog gi sde/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / mkhas mchog 'dul ba'i sde dang rnam snang mdzad/ / byams pa mgon pos rjes bzung seng ge bzang*/ / ku su lu gnyis byang sems gser gling pa/ / rgya chen spyod pa'i shing rta che rnams la/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / rgyal sras thu bo 'jam dbyangs dpal ldan mtshan/ / 'phags pa lha dang dpal ldan zla ba grags/ / rig pa'i khu byug gnyis la sogs pa yi/ / theg chen lam srol gnyis 'dzin mar me mdzad/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / bshes gnyen chen po ston pa tshul khrims 'bar/ / de sras bya yul ba dang ye shes 'bar/ / lcags ri ba dang sne zur pa la sogs/ / dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po du ma la/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / shing rta gnyis kyi lam srol las byung ba'i/ / gsung rab chu bo kun gyi 'jug pa'i ngogs/ / bdag nyid chen po zla 'od gzhon nu dang*/ / rgyal ba'i phrin las mnga' bdag dus gsum mkhyen/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / grangs med gong nas mngon par sangs rgyas kyang*/ / ma dag gdul bya'i snang ngor sprul pa'i sku/ / gang la gang 'dul tshul gyis ston mdzad pa/ / yab sras brgyud par bcas pa thams cad la/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ /

I supplicate the incomparable Teacher Shakyamuni, His exalted regent, Noble Asanga, Crown jewel of scholars Vasubandhu, Vimuktisena, Bhaṭṭāraka Vimuktisena who resides on the level of faith, and Chokgi De: I pray you grant your blessings. I supplicate the great scholars Vinitadeva and Vairochana, Haribhadra who was accepted by Maitreya, The two yogis, and bodhisattva Suvarnadvipa— Great masters of the lineage of vast action. I pray you grant your blessings. I supplicate Manjushri, foremost son of the Buddha; Nagarjuna; Aryadeva; glorious Chandrakirti; The two Rigpay Khujug and so forth; And Atisha who upholds their two traditions of the Mahayana. I pray you grant your blessings. I supplicate the great spiritual friend, master Tsultrim Bar; His disciples Ja Yülwa and Yeshe Bar; Chakriwa; Nesurpa; and so forth— A multitude of great spiritual friends. I pray you grant your blessings. I supplicate the great being Youthful Moonlight— The ford leading into all the rivers of scriptures That spring from the traditions of the two chariots— And Dusum Khyenpa, master of the activity of all the victors. I pray you grant your blessings. I supplicate all the masters and disciples of the lineage Who awoke to buddhahood countless aeons ago And yet appear to impure beings as nirmanakayas In whatever manner will tame them. I pray you grant your blessings.
sho lo ka 'di brgyud 'debs dngos la med mod 'dir spros pa bsdus pa'i dbang gis bcug pa yin no/
Though this stanza does not appear in the actual lineage prayer, it has been inserted to abbreviate a longer passage.

thub dbang ma dros las byung gsung rab kyi/ / chu bo dge legs pad tshal skyed byed pa/ / gang la brgyud pa'i rim pa thams cad la/ / gsol ba 'debs so byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / de ltar gsol ba btab pa'i byin brlabs kyi/ / mi bzad ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal 'jigs rung gis/ / shin tu sngangs te mtho ris bsten slad du/ / srog la bab kyang nyes pa mi spyod cing*/ / sngar bsags las rnams byang bar byin gyis rlobs/ / rab dkar dge ba'i tshogs rnams bsgrub brtson te/ / dal ba brgyad dang 'byor pa bcu ldan pa'i/ / mi yi rten mchog tshe rabs kun tu yang*/ / yang nas yang du thob par byin gyis rlobs/ / sdug bsngal me lce'i phreng bas bskor ba'i 'obs/ / srid pa'i btson ra thar bar dka' ba las/ / thar bar 'dod pa'i dri med bslab pa gsum/ / don gnyer chen po skye bar byin gyis rlobs/ / gang zhig zhi ba dman pa don gnyer ba/ / de dag nyer zhi gnyis la ngal bsos nas/ / rim gyis byang chub mchog la 'jug pa yi/ / snying stobs chen po skye bar byin gyis rlobs/ / theg mchog rigs kyi nus pa mi dman pas/ / de dag rnams kyi sdug bsngal me 'bar ba'i/ / 'gro la snying brtses byang chub sems bskyed nas/ / gang de nyams pa med par byin gyis rlobs/ / byang chub sems bskyed gyur nas 'gro rnams kyi/ / don rnams bsgrub slad rmad byung byang chub spyod/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing du dus rnams kun tu yang*/ / sems can rnams la rgya cher ston gyur cig / zab dang rgya che'i lam gnyis rab bgrod nas/ / sgrib gnyis bral ba'i ye shes bla med kyis/ / gang la gang 'dul de la ma nor lam/ / gsal byed 'jig rten sgron ma nyid gyur cig /

The rivers of scriptures sprung from Shakyamuni— Lake Anavatapta,—grow lotus ponds of virtue and excellence. I supplicate all those to whom these lineages have been passed. I pray you grant your blessings. Due to the power of supplicating thus, Bless me to be terrified of the frightening sufferings Of the dreadful lower realms. For the sake of the higher realms, Bless me to never commit any wrong even at the cost of my life. Bless me to purify the acts I accumulated in the past. Bless me to strive to accomplish the pure virtues And to achieve repeatedly in all my lifetimes The supreme support, a human body With the eight leisures and ten resources. Bless me to develop fervent longing For the stainless three trainings of those who wish for liberation From the pit of fire surrounded by rings of flame— The prison of existence so hard to escape. Bless those who seek the lesser peace To rest in the two types of pacification And then develop the great courage To enter supreme enlightenment step by step. The power of the family of the supreme vehicle is not lesser. Through it may they develop the bodhichitta of heartfelt compassion For those beings burning in the fires of suffering, And bless them that it never wane. After generating bodhichitta, may they display widely To sentient beings at all times In the realms of the ten directions The wondrous conduct of enlightenment for the sake of wanderers. May they progress through the two vast and profound paths, And through the unexcelled wisdom free of the two obscurations May they become lamps of the world who illuminate The unmistaken path to whomever there is to tame.

ces mngon mtho dang nges legs theg pa gsum gyis lam ston pa'i gsung rab ma lus pa'i lam gyis rim pa rnams gang las brgyud pa rnams la gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa don gnyer mang pos bskul te/ chos grags rgya mtshos gus pa'i yid kyis mgyogs par sbyar ba'o// //

Chödrak Gyatso wrote this quickly and with great respect at the request of many people who sought verses of supplication to the lineage from which the stages of the path of all the scriptures that teach the paths of the three vehicles to the higher states and true excellence were passed down.
bstan 'gro'i rkyen bzlog gi rim pa
Averting Negative Circumstances for Beings And The Teachings
sgrol ma nyer gcig la bstod pa/
Praises of the Twenty-One Taras

po Ta la yi gnas mchog nas/ / tAM yig ljang gu las 'khrungs shing*/ / tAM yig 'od kyis 'gro ba sgrol/ / sgrol ma 'khor bcas gshegs su gsol/ / lha dang lha min cod pan gyis/ / zhabs kyi pad+mo la btud de/ / phongs pa kun las sgrol mdzad ma/ / sgrol ma yum la phyag 'tshal lo/ / rje btsun 'phags ma sgrol ma dang*/ / phyogs bcu dus gsum bzhugs pa yi/ / rgyal ba sras bcas thams cad la/ / kun nas dwang bas phyag 'tshal lo/ / me tog bdug spos mar me dri/ / zhal zas rol mo la sogs pa/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul nas 'bul/ / 'phags ma'i tshogs kyis bzhes su gsol/ / thog ma med nas da lta'i bar/ / mi dge bcu dang mtshams med lnga/ / sems ni nyon mongs dbang gyur pa'i/ / sdig pa thams cad bshags par bgyi/ / nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems/ / so so skye bo la sogs pas/ / dus gsum dge ba ci bsags pa'i/ / bsod nams la ni bdag yi rang*/ / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang*/ / blo yi bye brag ji lta bar/ / che chung thun mong theg pa yi/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du gsol/ / 'khor ba ji srid ma stong bar/ / mya ngan mi 'da' thugs rje yis/ / sdug bsngal rgya mtshor bying ba yi/ / sems can rnams la gzigs su gsol/ / bdag gis bsod nams ci bsags pa/ / thams cad byang chub rgyur gyur nas/ / ring por mi thogs 'gro ba yi/ / 'dren pa'i dpal du bdag gyur cig /

From the supreme place of the Potala, You who are born from a green TAṂ And liberate beings with the light of TAṂ, Tara, I pray that you come with your retinue. Gods and demigods bow their crowns To your lotus feet. You liberate from all deprivation. I prostrate to Tara, the mother. Noble lady, Arya Tara, And all buddhas and bodhisattvas Who abide in the ten directions and the three times: I prostrate to you with utter admiration. I present flowers, incense, butter lamps, Scent, food, music, and other offerings, Actually present and mentally emanated. I pray that the Arya’s assembly accept them. I confess all the wrongdoing I have committed Throughout beginningless time up to now, Such as the ten wrongdoings and the five worst, With a mind overpowered by kleshas. I rejoice in all the merit accumulated Through the virtuous actions in the three times Of shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, Bodhisattvas, ordinary beings, and others. I pray that you turn the Wheels of Dharma Of the lesser, greater, and common vehicles In accordance with the thoughts And various intellects of beings. I pray that until samsara is empty You not pass into nirvana, But compassionately care for beings Who are drowning in the ocean of suffering. May whatever merit I have accumulated Become a cause of awakening. May I soon become A splendid guide of beings.

sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bstod pa phan yon dang bcas pa/ oM/ rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyag 'tshal sgrol ma myur ma dpa' mo/ / spyan ni skad cig glog dang 'dra ma/ / 'jig rten gsum mgon chu skyes zhal gyi/ / ge sar bye ba las ni byung ma/ / phyag 'tshal ston ka'i zla ba kun tu/ / gang ba brgya ni brtsegs pa'i zhal ma/ / skar ma stong phrag tshogs pa rnams kyis/ / rab tu phye ba'i 'od rab 'bar ma/ / phyag 'tshal gser sngo chu nas skyes kyi/ / pad+mas phyag ni rnam par brgyan ma/ / sbyin pa brtson 'grus dka' thub zhi ba/ / bzod pa bsam gtan spyod yul nyid ma/ / phyag 'tshal de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor/ / mtha' yas rnam par rgyal bar spyod ma/ / ma lus pha rol phyin pa thob pa'i/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis shin tu bsten ma/ / phyag 'tshal tut+tA ra hU~M yi ges/ / 'dod dang phyogs dang nam mkha' gang ma/ / 'jig rten bdun po zhabs kyis mnan te/ / lus pa med par 'gugs par nus ma/ / phyag 'tshal brgya byin me lha tshangs pa/ / rlung lha sna tshogs dbang phyug mchod ma/ / 'byung po ro langs dri za rnams dang*/ / gnod sbyin tshogs kyis mdun nas bstod ma/ / phyag 'tshal traDa ces bya dang phaT kyis/ / pha rol 'khrul 'khor rab tu 'joms ma/ / g.yas bskum g.yon brkyangs zhabs kyis mnan te/ / me 'bar 'khrugs pa shin tu 'bar ma/ / phyag 'tshal tu re 'jigs pa chen mos/ / bdud kyi dpa' bo rnam par 'joms ma/ / chu skyes zhal ni khro gnyer ldan mdzad/ / dgra bo thams cad ma lus gsod ma/ / phyag 'tshal dkon mchog gsum mtshon phyag rgya'i/ / sor mos thugs kar rnam par brgyan ma/ / ma lus phyogs kyi 'khor los brgyan pa'i/ / rang gi 'od kyis tshogs rnams 'khrugs ma/ / phyag 'tshal rab tu dga' bas brjid pa'i/ / dbu rgyan 'od kyi phreng ba spel ma/ / bzhad pa rab bzhad tut+tA ra yis/ / bdud dang 'jig rten dbang du mdzad ma/ / phyag 'tshal sa gzhi skyong ba'i tshogs rnams/ / thams cad 'gugs par nus pa nyid ma/ / khro gnyer g.yo ba'i yi ge hU~M gis/ / phongs pa thams cad rnam par sgrol ma/ / phyag 'tshal zla ba'i dum bus dbu brgyan/ / brgyan pa thams cad shin tu 'bar ma/ / ral pa'i khrod na 'od dpag med las/ / rtag par shin tu 'od ni mdzad ma/ / phyag 'tshal bskal pa mtha' ma'i me ltar/ / 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i dbus na gnas ma/ / g.yas brkyangs g.yon bskum kun nas bskor dga'/ / dgra yi dpung ni rnam par 'joms ma/ / phyag 'tshal sa gzhi'i ngos la phyag gi / mthil gyis bsnun cing zhabs kyis brdung ma/ / khro gnyer can mdzad yi ge hU~M gis/ / rim pa bdun po rnams ni 'gems ma/ / phyag 'tshal bde ma dge ma zhi ma/ / mya ngan 'das zhi spyod yul nyid ma/ / swA hA oM dang yang dag ldan pas/ / sdig pa chen po 'joms pa nyid ma/ / phyag 'tshal kun nas bskor rab dga' ba'i/ / dgra yi lus ni rab tu 'gems ma/ / yi ge bcu pa'i ngag ni bkod pa'i/ / rig pa hU~M las sgrol ma nyid ma/ / phyag 'tshal tu re'i zhabs ni brdabs pas/ / hU~M gi rnam pa'i sa bon nyid ma/ / ri rab man+da ra dang 'bigs byed/ / 'jig rten gsum rnams g.yo ba nyid ma/ / phyag 'tshal lha yi mtsho yi rnam pa'i/ / ri dwags rtags can phyag na bsnams ma/ / tA ra gnyis brjod phaT kyi yi ges/ / dug rnams ma lus pa ni sel ma/ / phyag 'tshal lha yi tshogs rnams rgyal po/ / lha dang mi 'am ci yis bsten ma/ / kun nas go cha dga' ba'i brjid kyis/ / rtsod dang rmi lam ngan pa sel ma/ / phyag 'tshal nyi ma zla ba rgyas pa'i/ / spyan gnyis po la 'od rab gsal ma/ / ha ra gnyis brjod tut+tA ra yis/ / shin tu drag po'i rims nad sel ma/ / phyag 'tshal de nyid gsum rnams bkod pa'i/ / zhi ba'i mthu dang yang dag ldan ma/ / gdon dang ro langs gnod sbyin tshogs rnams/ / 'joms pa tu re rab mchog nyid ma/ / rtsa ba'i sngags kyi bstod pa 'di dang*/ / phyag 'tshal ba ni nyi shu rtsa gcig /

Praises to the twenty-one Taras, along with their benefits: OṂ I prostrate to the noble lady, Arya Tara. I prostrate to Tara, the quick and heroic, Whose eyes flash instantly, like lightning, Who arose from the open heart on the lotus face Of the three worlds’ protector. I prostrate to you whose face Is like a hundred full autumn moons, Who blazes with the light Of thousands of stars. I prostrate to you whose hands are adorned By lotuses born from water blue and gold, Whose conduct is generosity, diligence, Discipline, peace, patience, and meditation. I prostrate to you, the ushnisha of the tathagatas, Whose deeds are boundless, utter victory, Who have achieved all transcendences, On whom the bodhisattvas fully rely. I prostrate to you who fill the desire realm, all directions, And all space with the syllables TUTTĀRA HŪṂ, Who trample on the seven worlds, And are able to summon all without exception. I prostrate to you whom Indra, Agni, Brahma, Vayudeva, Ishvara, and other gods worship, Who are praised in your presence by bhutas, Vetalas, gandharvas, and hosts of yakshas. I prostrate to you who totally conquer, with TRAṬ and PHAṬ, All the devices of adversaries, Who trample with right leg contracted and left extended, Who blaze amid wild, burning flames. I prostrate to you who totally conquer, with terrifying TURE, The warriors of Mara, Whose lotus face frowns, Who kill all enemies without exception. I prostrate to you whose fingers adorn your heart With the mudra of the Three Jewels, Who is adorned by a turbulent wheel of light, Blazing in all directions. I prostrate to you whose crown, heavy with great joy, Radiates garlands of light, Whose fierce laugh of TUTTĀRA Enthralls maras and all the world. I prostrate to you who are able to summon All the guardians of the ground, Who, with a frown and the syllable HŪṂ, Liberate from all deprivation. I prostrate to you whose head is adorned by a sliver of the moon, Who blaze brilliantly with all adornment, Whose hair is always beautiful With Amitabha’s brilliant light. I prostrate to you who dwell amid garlands of flame Like the fire at a kalpa’s end, Who are delighted, with right leg extended and left bent, Who totally conquer enemies’ forces. I prostrate to you who pierce the ground with the palm of your hand And trample it with your feet, Who, frowning, with the syllable HŪṂ Conquer the seven levels. I prostrate to you whose conduct is blissful, Virtuous, tranquil, the peace of nirvana, Whose SVĀHĀ and OṂ Conquer great wrongdoing. I prostrate to you who amid utter joy Totally defeat enemies, Tara who arises from the awareness HŪṂ Surrounded by the ten syllables. I prostrate to TURE who stamps her feet, Whose seed has the form of HŪṂ, Who shakes Mount Meru, Mandara, Vindhya, and the three worlds. I prostrate to you whose hand holds The gods’ lake marked by a rabbit, Who dispel all poisons when two TĀRA And the syllable PHAṬ are said. I prostrate to you on whom the king of gods And all gods and kinnaras rely, Who dispel dispute and bad dreams With complete armor and joyous splendor. I prostrate to you whose two eyes are as bright As the sun and full moon, Who dispel the fiercest contagion By reciting hara twice and TUTTĀRA. I prostrate to you who pacify Through the placement of threefold suchness, Supreme TURE who conquers the hosts Of spirits, vetalas, and yakshas. This is the praise of the root mantra And the twenty-one prostrations.

phan yon ni/ lha mo la gus yang dag ldan pa'i/ / blo ldan gang gis rab dang brjod pas/ / srod dang tho rangs langs par byas te/ / dran pas mi 'jigs thams cad rab ster/ / sdig pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba/ / ngan 'gro thams cad 'joms pa nyid do/ / rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun rnams kyis/ / myur du dbang ni bskur bar 'gyur la/ / 'di las che ba nyid ni 'thob cing*/ / sangs rgyas go 'phang mthar thug der 'gro/ / de yi dug ni drag po chen po/ / brtan la gnas pa'am gzhan yang 'gro ba/ / zos pa dang ni 'thungs pa nyid kyang*/ / dran pas rab tu sel ba nyid 'thob/ / gdon dang rims dang dug gis gzir ba'i/ / sdug bsngal tshogs ni rnam par spong ste/ / sems can gzhan pa rnams la yang ngo*/ / gnyis gsum bdun du mngon par brjod na/ / bu 'dod pas ni bu thob 'gyur zhing*/ / nor 'dod pas ni nor rnams nyid 'thob/ / 'dod pa thams cad thob par 'gyur te/ / bgegs rnams med cing so sor 'joms 'gyur/ /

The benefits: Intelligent people with true respect for this devi Who arise and recite this with utmost Admiration at both dawn and dusk, Will be freed from all fear by the thought of her. All their wrongdoing will be fully pacified. All lower realms will be conquered. They will quickly receive empowerment From seventy million buddhas. They will attain what is greater than this. They will reach ultimate buddhahood. The thought of her will fully dispel The strongest poison whether from The environment or beings, Whether eaten or drunk. They will escape all suffering Caused by spirits, contagion, or poison, And so will other beings. If this is recited two, three, and seven times, Those who want children will have children, Those who want wealth will gain wealth, All desires will be fulfilled, And all obstructors will be vanquished.
phyag 'tshal nyer gcig gi bstod pa 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad chen pos gsungs pa ste rgyud las byung ba'o/
This praise, the Twenty-One Prostrations, was taught by Mahavairochana. It is extracted from the tantra.
sgrol bstod skyabs bdun ma/
The Seven Protections

ma skye ba med pa'i chos dbyings na/ / yum rje btsun lha mo sgrol ma bzhugs/ / de sems can kun la bde ster ma/ / bdag 'jigs pa kun las bskyab tu gsol/ / rang chos sku yin par ma shes par/ / sems nyon mongs dbang du gyur pa yi/ / ma 'khor bar 'khyams pa'i sems can la/ / yum lha mo khyod kyis bskyab tu gsol/ / chos snying nas rgyud la ma skyes par/ / tha snyad tshig gi rjes 'brangs nas/ / grub mtha' ngan pas bslus pa la/ / yum yang dag gi lha mos bskyab tu gsol/ / rtogs par dka' ba rang gi sems/ / mthong nas goms par mi byed par/ / bya ba ngan pas g.yengs pa la/ / yum dran pa'i lha mos bskyab tu gsol/ / sems rang byung gnyis med ye shes la/ / gnyis su 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis/ / ji ltar byas kyang bcings pa rnams/ / thugs gnyis med kyi lha mos bskyab tu gsol/ / yang dag gi don la gnas byas kyang*/ / rgyu 'bras kyi rten 'brel mi shes pas/ / shes bya'i don la rmongs pa la/ / yum kun mkhyen gyi lha mos bskyab tu gsol/ / spros bral nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can/ / thams cad de dang dbyer med kyis/ / da dung slob ma'i gang zag la/ / yum rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bskyab tu gsol/ /

Mother, in the unborn dharmadhatu you dwell, Mother, noble lady, devi Tara. You bestow bliss on all beings. I pray that you protect me from all danger. Not knowing ourselves to be the dharmakaya, Our minds come under the power of kleshas. Mother, for all beings wandering in samsara, Mother, devi, I pray that you protect us all. Without Dharma in my heart or being, I chase jargon and words And am deceived by bad philosophy. Mother, perfect devi, I pray that you protect me. Although I’ve seen my mind, so hard to realize, I do not accustom myself to it. I am distracted by bad activities. Mother, devi of mindfulness, I pray that you protect me. Although my mind is self-arisen, nondual pristine wisdom, Because of my habit of dualism No matter what I do, I am fettered. Mother, devi of nondual mind, I pray that you protect me. Although I abide in the true meaning, Not knowing cause, result, and interdependence, I am ignorant of what can be known. Mother, devi of omniscience, I pray that you protect me. The absence of complexity has the character of space. Everything is inseparable from it. For individuals still learning, Mother, Buddha, I pray that you protect us all.

zhes pa e chung phug tu khams gsum chos kyi rgyal po rgyal ba 'bri gung pa skyob pa rje 'jig rten gsum gyi mgon pos 'phags ma sgrol ma bdun zhal gzigs dus gsol ba btab pa skyabs bdun mar grags pa byin rlabs shin tu che bar grags so/

In the Echung Cave the Dharma king of the three realms, the Gyalwa Drikungpa, the protector Jikten Sumgön, saw the faces of seven Arya Taras. At that time he made this supplication, which came to be known as the Seven Protections. It is renowned for its extremely great blessing.
sgrol bstod legs bris ma/
The Crown Jewel of the Wise
na mo ar+ya tA ra ye/ rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa mkhas pa'i gtsug rgyan zhes bya ba/
NAMO ĀRYA TĀRAYE The Crown Jewel of the Wise: A Praise of the Bhagavati Lady Tara of the Acacia Tree Forest

/ lta ngan rkun po'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ / mi bzad srid pa'i btson khang rwa ba ru/ / lus can rang dbang med par 'ching byed cing*/ / sred pa'i sgo lcags dbye dkas 'khyud pa yi/ / ser sna'i lcags gsol/ / khyod la bstod cing gsol ba btab pa'i mthus/ / dam chos sgrub pa'i 'gal rkyen zhi ba dang*/ / tshe dang bsod nams dpal dang 'byor pa sogs/ / mthun pa'i rkyen rnams yid bzhin 'grub par mdzod/ / rabs dran pa dang*/ / byang chub sems dang nam yang mi 'bral zhing*/ / rgyal sras spyod pa rlabs chen 'tshol ba la/ / brtson 'grus chu bo'i rgyun bzhin bsten par shog / rang don sgrub la nam yang mi I prostrate to Arya Avalokiteshvara, the treasury of compassion. I bow to the feet of Tara, to whose lotus feet hundreds of well-formed gods, Such as Vishnu, Lakshmi’s lord, Brahma of the golden womb, Brihaspati the guru of gods; The elephant-faced Ganesh, glorious-throated Ishvara, And Surya, the friend of lotuses, offer their crowns. Through the miraculous emanation of Mahakarunika, The wisdom, kindness, and power of all buddhas of the three times Are displayed as a beautiful devi of activity. I bow to the feet of Tara, who protects from all poverty. On a lotus seat—utterly pure expanse-awareness— You have the color of emerald, one face, and two arms. In the full bloom of youth, your right leg is extended and the left contracted. I prostrate to you who unite means and wisdom. Your breasts are full. You are a treasury of undefiled bliss. Your face, like the full moon, has a white smile. Your demeanor is peaceful. Your compassionate eyes are wide. I bow to you, the beautiful one from the sandalwood forest. Like the extended branch of a turquoise tree, Your smooth, soft right hand is in the mudra of supreme generosity, As though you are summoning the learned To the feast of supreme siddhi. I prostrate to you. Your left hand represents the Three Jewels and bestows protection, Clearly indicating, “I, who am fearless, will quickly protect beings, Who see hundreds of dangers.” I prostrate to you. Your two hands are marked by blue utpalas, As though you are spurring all beings on to diligence By saying, “Be not attached to the pleasures of samsara. Enter the city of great liberation.” I prostrate to you. Amitabha, the color of ruby, Holding an alms bowl filled with amrita in meditation, Adorns your head, bestowing the siddhi of immortality. I prostrate to you who conquer the lord of my death. Through your two accumulations, your jewelry is like that made by gods. Priceless, it is composed of the gods’ wish-fulfilling jewels. It is captivating, the sum of all beauty. I prostrate to you who are well adorned. Like a mountain of emeralds adorned by rainbows, On your upper body you wear a band of divine fabric. Your slender, supple, beautiful waist Is swathed by a skirt of panchālika. I prostrate to you. On your right is Marichi, who eliminates misery. Her demeanor is peaceful. She is golden and radiates light like the sun’s. On your left is Ekajati, whose blue color surpasses the beauty of the sky. I prostrate to the beautiful ones who are majestic with wrath and passion. I offer you devis filling all space, Skilled in sixfold song and lovely dance, Holding white parasols, fans, lutes, flutes, And innumerable other offerings. I prostrate to you. Lakshmi, Shachi, Uma, And the thousands of other attractive immortal maidens Are hardly worthy of being your servants. I prostrate to the beautiful, appealing devi. From the vast expanse of your compassion’s clouds Issues your melodic speech, like Brahma’s, the cloud-drum’s beat. Its skillful shower soaks the ground of disciples With rain of eightfold sweetness. I prostrate to you. Seeing all things, you are a treasury, an ocean of qualities. Who could properly describe them all? Your intellect is unimpeded. Your mind has the ten strengths. I prostrate to you who have perfect wisdom. Although you have achieved peace, compelled by compassion You quickly rescue, with the hand of compassion, Beings drowning in the ocean of suffering. I prostrate to you who have perfect kindness. You spontaneously, unceasingly, And without delay, like the ocean’s waves, engage In pacification, increase, captivation, and force. I prostrate to you whose deeds are perfect. Upon recollection, you protect from great danger, The eight sufferings, bhutas, and the dangers of The kleshas and the cognitive obscuration. I prostrate to you who have perfect ability. I pray that you, a true refuge, quickly protect All beings from sickness, contagion, Spirits, obstructors, untimely death, Bad dreams, evil omens, and from all danger. It lives in the mountains of the view of the self. It is inflated, thinking itself superior to others. It has the claws of disparagement of others. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome lion of pride. It cannot be tamed by the sharp hook of mindfulness and alertness. It is maddened by drinking the intoxicating water of pleasure. It runs amok on the wrong path and brandishes its tusks of malevolence. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome elephant of stupidity. It is fanned by the wind of incorrect mental engagement. It burns amid vast clouds of the smoke of wrongdoing. It can burn down the entire forest of virtue. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome fire of anger. It clings to its den, thick ignorance. Unable to bear the prosperity and success of others, It quickly spreads its vicious poison. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome snake of jealousy. It lurks in the terrifying wilderness of inferior discipline And in the desert of permanence and termination. It overthrows the towns and monasteries of benefit and happiness. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome robber, inferior views. They keep beings bound, without freedom, In the unbearable prison of samsara. They are held by the lock of craving, so hard to open. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome chains of greed. It is extremely hard to cross. Its current bears us to samsara. Because it is close to the fierce wind of karma, It roils with the waves of birth, aging, sickness, and death. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome river of desire. It flies through the sky of bewilderment And attacks those who seek the definitive. It is vicious and threatens the life of liberation. I pray that you protect us from the fearsome carnivore of doubt. Through my praising and praying to you, Please pacify what hinders Dharma practice. Please grant what supports it, as we wish, Such as life, merit, wealth, and possessions. May all beings be born in the realm of Sukhavati. May we be cared for there by our guide, Amitabha. Without undergoing hundreds of austerities, May we quickly reach buddhahood. May I always recollect previous lives. May I never be without bodhichitta. In pursuit of the vast conduct of the bodhisattvas May my diligence flow like a river. May I never hope to accomplish my own benefit. May I immerse myself solely in the benefit of others. May I perfect all the conditions for benefiting others, Such as the eyes, clairvoyances, skillful speech, and patience. May I never shy from spreading the sublime Buddhadharma Throughout endless realms. In order to forever accomplish all beings’ benefit, May I easily achieve buddhahood.

rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa mkhas pa'i gtsug rgyan zhes bya ba 'di ni/ shAkya'i dge slong dge 'dun grub pa dpal bzang pos yun ring du gsol ba btab ste/ byang chub chen po'i dben gnas theg chen pho brang du legs par sbyar ba'o/

This praise of the Bhagavati Lady Tara of the Acacia Forest called “The Crown Jewel of the Wise” was composed by the Shakyan Bhikshu Gendun Drup Pal Zangpo at the Hermitage of Mahabodhi, the citadel of the mahayana, after a long period of prayer.
sgrol ma dkar mo'i bstod pa/
Praise of White Tara
rje btsun sgrol ma dkar mo'i bstod pa kun mkhyen pad+ma dkar pos mdzad pa bzhugs/
The praise of the noble lady White Tara composed by the omniscient Padma Karpo:

'jig rten mgon po'i thugs rje'i bdud rtsi yi/ / chu gter gyis spros zla ba rgyal ba'i yum/ / rmongs pa'i mun 'phrog snying stobs ku mu ta/ / ma lus 'byed pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dri med chu shel nor bu'i 'khri shing ni/ / ha ri tsan dan dog pas 'khyud 'dra ba'i/ / rab dkar yid 'phrog sgeg mo'i gzugs 'dzin ma/ / bcu drug lang tsho rgyas par phyag 'tshal lo/ / nu 'bur rgyas pa'i dpal 'bras kyis dud pa'i/ / lus phra mdzes sdug gsar pa'i 'khri shing ni/ / phyag zhabs chu skyes rgod pa'i ge sar la/ / mig gi bung ba g.yo bar phyag 'tshal lo/ / rin chen mthing gi mu tig do shal khongs/ / spras 'dra'i 'od can spyan gsum ri dwags mo/ / 'gying ba'i 'gros kyis glang po dman byed pa/ / yid 'ong mdzes pa'i snying por phyag 'tshal lo/ / rtag par 'dzum pas mchu yi yal 'dab la/ / mu tig 'bras bu chags pa'i byu ru'i 'od/ / mdzes par 'god la shangs rgyud yid ris kyis/ / 'bad pas bzos 'dra gang la phyag 'tshal lo/ / rin chen rnams dang me tog gis brgyan pa'i/ / lan bu gcig pa'i zur phud mthon mthing gis/ / sprin gsar tshogs la gdengs pa rma bya yi/ / mjug ma'i mdzes sdug 'dzin la phyag 'tshal lo/ / nyi ma'i 'od zer ldan pa'i cod pan gyis/ / legs spras snyan gong ut+pal mthing kha'i rgyan/ / chu shel ljon pa'i yal ga khu byug gi / gshog pa brkyangs pas mdzes 'drar phyag 'tshal lo/ / rna rgyan rin chen rab 'bar 'gram pa la/ / ya mtshan 'od ris ci yang bri ba ni/ / mkhur tshos dkar dmar mdangs kyis yid 'ong la/ / ngal bas 'gran par bgyid der phyag 'tshal lo/ / mgul na mu tig chun po'i rgyun dag ni/ / shin tu rags pas mtshan mo'i dpal gyur pa'i/ / zla ba'i dkar ba ma lus 'phrog pa ltas/ / brgyan cing brgyan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dpung rgyan gdu bu ngur ba'i 'phreng rgyu ba/ / do shal gang+gA'i lbu ba rab gsal gyis/ / mdzes shing rgod pa lha yi ri bo ni/ / gzi byin mtshungs med pa der phyag 'tshal lo/ / dzam+bu na dA'i dril chung sgra 'byin pa'i/ / 'od zer rab rgyas nor bu'i ska rags dang*/ / mdzes 'dzum rlabs kyi gzugs brnyan gos bzang gis/ / rnam mdzes sgrol ma de la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyag g.yas mchog sbyin g.yon pa ut+pa la'i/ / sdong bu 'dzin cing skyil krung ngang mo ni/ / pad dkar myu gus mtshan pa'i zla ba mtshor/ / mdzes pas rnam par rol la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dus min 'chi ba nad dang 'jigs pa brgyad/ / dran pas yud tsam nyid la sel bgyid pa'i/ / yid bzhin 'khor los thugs ka rnam mdzes pa'i/ / dus gsum rgyal ba'i yum la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyogs kyi khongs rnams dri med 'od zer gyi/ / bdud rtsi'i rba rlabs kyis 'gengs bcom ldan ma/ / khyod kyi bka' drin dag gis bdag cag gi / yid la 'dod pa thams cad 'grub par mdzod/ / dad pa'i thal sbyar mchi mas mig brlan cing*/ / gdung bas yid bskul gsol 'debs nga ro ni/ / ku ra ri bzhin sgrog la thugs rje'i spyan/ / gzigs la le lo ma mdzad bcom ldan ma/ /

Mother of buddhas, you are the moon arisen from the ocean Of the amrita of the world-protector’s compassion. You steal the darkness of our bewilderment And open the night lilies of our courage. I prostrate to you. Like a vine of stainless water-crystal Embraced by white sandalwood, Your form is utterly white, captivating, and graceful. I prostrate to you who bloom with the youth of sixteen years. Bowed by the splendid fruit of your full breasts, Your body is slim, beautiful, winsome, like a young vine. Bee-like eyes move within the smiling hearts Of your lotus hands and feet. I prostrate to you. Like blue jewels set within pearls Are your three luminous eyes. Your gait, deerlike in its grace, surpasses even that Of an elephant in majesty. I prostrate to you, the essence of beauty. Always smiling, the petals of your lips are like beautiful, Luminous coral surrounding pearls. Your nose is so finely formed that it is as though It was created by the mind. I prostrate to you. Your single braided topknot, Adorned by jewels and flowers, Is like a peacock’s beautiful tail displayed When fresh clouds gather. I prostrate to you. You are adorned by a crown with the light-rays of the sun. Your ears are ornamented by blue utpalas. You are as beautiful as the spread wings of a cuckoo On a tree-branch of crystal. I prostrate to you. Your earrings blaze with jewels. The light they cast upon your cheeks Competes fiercely with the beauty Of your pink complexion. I prostrate to you. Strings of great clusters of pearls adorn your throat, Stealing the glory of the night, All the moon’s whiteness. I prostrate to you who are adorned by them. Your bangles and bracelets are like flocks of golden geese. Your necklaces smile beautifully like the luminous foam on the Ganges. Their beauty surpasses the splendor Of even the mountains of the gods. I prostrate to you. Your belt is of radiant jewels and little bells Of Jambu gold that jingle. You are beautified also by fine silk with waves of smiling designs. I prostrate to you, Tara. Your right hand bestows. Your left holds an utpala by its stem. With crossed legs, like a swan on a lake, You sit on a moon resting on a white lotus with its stem. I prostrate to you who revel with beauty. The thought of you dispels Untimely death, sickness, and the eight dangers. Your heart is beautified by a wish-fulfilling wheel. I prostrate to you, mother of all buddhas of the three times. Bhagavati, you fill all directions With stainless light-rays, waves of amrita. Through your kindness, May all our wishes be fulfilled. Through faith, my palms are joined and my eyes wet with tears. I implore you with yearning. My prayer is a roar like a kurari’s call. Regard me with compassionate eyes. Bhagavati, do not be idle.
zhes cho 'phrul gyi dus chen la dad pa'i blos sbyar ba'o/
This was composed with faith on the festival of the Buddha’s miracles.
dbyangs can lha mo'i bstod pa byin rlabs kyi snang ba zhes bya ba/
The Light of Blessing: A Praise of the Goddess Sarasvati

bus mtshan pa'i sham thabs ni/ / dal bar 'dzin mdzad mdzes ma khyod la 'dud/ / 'og nas klu mos chab kyi rgya mtshos mchod/ / ngos nas grub pas mdzes pa'i rnga yab g.yob/ / mdun nas rig 'dzin bu mos sil snyan 'khrol/ / smin legs kun gyi gtso mo khyod la bstod/ / g.yas nas mi 'am ci yis glu dbyangs len/ / g.yon nas dri za'i dga' mas pi wang sgreng*/ / rgyab nas 'chi med bu mos gdugs dkar 'dzin/ / nus ldan kun gyi gtso mo khyod la bstod/ / bcu drug lang tsho chags pa'i nyams ldan ma/ / lta bas mi ngoms ye shes sgyu ma'i sku/ / dran pa tsam gyis bde ba kun ster ma/ / lhag pa'i lha mo dbyangs can ma la 'dud/ / 'gro ba kun la gsung rab ma lus pa/ / gsal bar 'chad pa'i spobs pa bdag la stsol/ / mkhas pa'i mdun sar phyir rgol pham byed pa'i/ / rnam rgyal rtsod pa'i spobs pa bdag la stsol/ / tshig dang ngag gi sbyor ba dri med pa'i/ / gzhung brgya rtsom pa'i spobs pa bdag la stsol/ / de ltar bstod pa'i dge ba gang yin pas/ / bdag ni phyogs las rnam par rgyal bar shog / tshe rabs kun tu khyed kyis rjes bzung nas/ / 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi go 'phang myur thob shog / 'di ni 'dzin nam 'chang ngam klog kyang rung*/ / dge legs yar ngo'i zla ltar rgyas byed shog /

Graceful on a seat of the blooming lotus Of excellent wisdom and the stainless moon of compassion, With the sweet sound of your lute, an ocean of melody, Goddess, you inspire the three realms. I bow to you. Most beautiful maiden, you outshine the brilliance Of a snow-covered mountain. You have one face and two hands, With which you strum the gandharvas’ lute. You are like a swan maiden In a lotus garden humming with young bees. I bow to you. You are like a crystal vine moved by the wind. Even if thousands of beauties from higher realms were gathered, They would be fit only to be your servants. I bow to you, pleasing amrita for the eyes. Your face, like the stainless moon, gleams white with your smile. Your cheeks are as red as the rising sun. Your deep blue eyes are as wide as utpalas. I bow to you who look brightly from side to side. Your topknot and earrings blaze with jewels. You are beautiful with fragrant flower garlands. Your braids are as black as kohl. They are shiny and as beautiful as a peacock’s colors. I bow to you. Your ears are adorned by blue utpalas Picked today from the gardens of Parijata. You are as beautiful as a cuckoo spreading its wings On a crystal tree-branch. I bow to you. Your precious earrings hang from your ears All the way to your throat, Meeting your necklaces as though holding hands, Encircling you. I bow to you. Your breasts are round and full, like two snow-covered mountains, Veiled by the white clouds of your blouse. On it fall necklaces with clusters of pearls. I bow to you who have a sparkling fan. The pool of your navel is like a fragrant utpala, Its shore beautified by a golden belt and strings of jewels. Your colorful skirt is studded with jewels. I bow to you, beautiful one, who wear it well. From below, naginis offer you oceans of water. From the sides, siddhas wave beautiful fans. In front, vidyadhara maidens play cymbals. I praise you, foremost of all with beauty. On your right, kinnaras sing melodious songs. On your left, delightful gandharva maidens strum lutes. Behind you, immortal maidens hold white parasols. I praise you, principal of all with power. Ravishing maiden of sixteen years, I could never see enough Of your illusory body of pristine wisdom. The mere thought of you brings bliss. I bow to Sarasvati, my special devi. Give me the ability to clearly explain All teachings to all beings. Give me the ability to debate victoriously In the presence of the learned. Give me the ability to compose a hundred treatises With stainless words and language. Through the virtue of praising you in this way, May I be victorious over all directions. In every life may you care for me. May I quickly attain the state of Manjushri. For all who memorize, keep, or read this, May virtue and goodness wax like the moon.
ces pa 'di'ang dpal phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba'i paN+Di ta dbyangs can dga' bas mdzad pa'o/
This was composed by Pal Yangchen Gawa, the pandita victorious over all directions.
gu ru pad+ma'i tshig bdun gsol 'debs/
The Seven-Line Prayer of Guru Rinpoche

hU~M: o rgyan yul gyi nub byang mtshams: pad+ma ge sar sdong po la: ya mtshan mchog gi dngos grub brnyes: pad+ma 'byung gnas zhes su grags: 'khor du mkha' 'gro mang pos bskor: khyed kyi rjes su bdag bsgrub kyi: byin gyis brlab phyir gshegs su gsol: gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M:

hūṃ In the northwest of Uddiyana On the center of a lotus stem You achieved the wondrous supreme siddhi And are renowned as Lotus Born Encircled by many ḍākinis We practice following your example And ask you come and grant your blessings guru padma siddhi hūṃ
gsol 'debs bar chad lam sel/
The Supplication Clearing the Path of Obstacles

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: chos sku snang ba mtha' yas la gsol ba 'debs: longs sku thugs rje chen po la gsol ba 'debs: sprul sku pad+ma 'byung gnas la gsol ba 'debs: bdag gi bla ma ngo mtshar sprul pa'i sku: rgya gar yul du sku 'khrungs thos bsam mdzad: bod yul dbus su zhal byon dregs pa btul: o rgyan yul du sku bzhugs 'gro don mdzad: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ I supplicate the dharmakaya Amitabha. I supplicate the sambhogakaya Mahakarunika. I supplicate the nirmanakaya Padmakara. My guru, the wondrous nirmanakaya, Was born in India, where he engaged in hearing and thinking. He came to Central Tibet and subdued the haughty. Abiding in Uddiyana, he benefits beings. Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: sku yi ngo mtshar mthong ba'i tshe: g.yas pas ral gri'i phyag rgya mdzad: g.yon pas 'gugs pa'i phyag rgya mdzad: zhal bgrad mche gtsigs gyen la gzigs: rgyal ba'i gdung 'dzin 'gro ba'i mgon: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When the wondrousness of your body was first seen, Your right hand formed the sword mudra. Your left formed the mudra of summoning. With gaping mouth and bared fangs, you gazed upward. Gyalway Dungdzin, beings’ protector, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: dam chos rin chen gsan pa'i tshe: sku gsal 'od zer mdangs dang ldan: phyag g.yas sde snod glegs bam bsnams: g.yon pas phur pa'i pusti bsnams: zab mo'i chos rnams thugs su chud: yang le shod kyi paN+Di ta: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When listening to the precious genuine Dharma, Your body was lustrous and brilliant with light-rays. Your right hand held a volume of the tripitaka. Your left hand held a volume of Kila. You’ve comprehended profound Dharma. Pandita of Yangleshö, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: dam can dam la btags pa'i tshe: dri med gnas mchog nyams re dga': rgya gar bod yul sa mtshams su: byin gyis brlabs nas byon pa'i tshe: dri bsung spos ngad ldan pa'i ri: me tog pad+ma dgun yang skye: chu mig byang chub bdud rtsi'i chu: bde ldan de yi gnas mchog tu: skyes mchog tshul bzang chos gos gsol: phyag g.yas rdo rje rtse dgu bsnams: g.yon pas rin chen za ma tog: rak+ta bdud rtsis nang du gtams: mkha' 'gro dam can dam la btags: yi dam zhal gzigs dngos grub brnyes: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When binding those you bound to samaya, You passed through a stainless, delightful place. Crossing the border between India and Tibet, You blessed it as you went. On Fragrant Mountain Lotus flowers were born even in winter. Springs gave forth the amrita of awakening. In that supreme, delightful place, Kyechok Tsulzang, you wore the three Dharma robes. Your right hand held a nine-pointed vajra. Your left hand held a precious vessel Filled with rakta and amrita. You bound dakinis and others to samaya. You saw the faces of yidams and attained siddhi. Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: rgyal ba'i bstan pa btsugs pa'i tshe: g.ya' ri'i nags la sgrub pa mdzad: bsnyen phur nam mkha'i dbyings su 'phang : rdo rje'i phyag rgyas blangs shing bsgril: bsgril zhing tsan+dan nags su 'phang : me 'bar 'khrugs shing mtsho yang skem: srib kyi mu stegs sa gang bsregs: yak+Sha nag po rdul du brlag: 'gran gyi do med bdud kyi gshed: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When planting the Buddhadharma, You practiced in a slate-mountain forest. You cast your approach kila into the expanse of the sky. You retrieved it with the vajramudra and rolled it. Rolling it, you cast it into the sandalwood forest. It blazed with fire, drying up a lake. At night, it burnt the tirthikas’ land And pulverized the black yaksha. Peerless Dükyi Shechen, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: srin po'i kha gnon mdzad pa'i tshe: khye'u chung sprul sku'i cha lugs can: ya mtshan gzugs bzang kha dog legs: tshems 'grigs dbu skra ser la mdzes: dgung lo bcu drug lon pa'i tshul: rin chen rgyan cha sna tshogs gsol: phyag g.yas 'khar ba'i phur pa bsnams: bdud dang srin po'i kha gnon mdzad: g.yon pas seng ldeng phur pa bsnams: mos pa'i bu la srung skyobs mdzad: mgul na lcags kyi phur pa bsnams: yi dam lha dang gnyis su med: gnyis med sprul sku 'dzam gling rgyan: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When subjugating the rakshasas, You have the appearance of a young boy With a wondrous form and a fine complexion. Your teeth are even, your hair blond and beautiful. With the form of a sixteen-year-old, You wear a variety of precious jewelry. Your right hand holds a kila of brass. You subjugate maras and rakshasas. Your left hand holds a kila of sandalwood. You protect your devoted disciples. You wear at your throat a kila of iron. You are not other than the yidam deva. Nondual nirmanakaya Dzamling Gyen, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: 'dre yi yul du dgongs pa'i tshe: me dpung shod kyi sa gzhi la: mda' rgyang gang gi mtsho nang du: pad+ma'i steng du bsil bsil 'dra: pad+ma'i nang na dgongs pa mdzad: mtshan yang pad+ma 'byung gnas zhes: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dngos su byon: de 'dra'i sprul sku ya mtshan can: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When you considered the land of spirits, On the ground amid a mass of fire Appeared a lake of a bowshot’s width. Within it, you appeared, cool and unharmed, on a lotus. You dwelled in wisdom on that lotus. You became known as Padmakara, A buddha actually present. Nirmanakaya of such wonders, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: bod kyi nyi ma mdzad pa'i tshe: dad ldan 'gro ba 'dren pa'i dpal: gang la gang 'dul skur bstan nas: gtsang kha la yi la thog tu: dgra lha'i dge bsnyen dam la btags: yul ni tsha ba'i tsha shod du: lha yi dge bsnyen dregs pa can: nyi shu rtsa gcig dam la btags: mang yul de yi byams sprin du: dge slong bzhi la dngos grub gnang : khyad par 'phags pa'i rig 'dzin mchog: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When you became the sun of Tibet, Glorious leader of faithful beings, You displayed whatever form would tame. In the pass of Tsangkhala You bound drala upasakas to samaya. In hot Tsashö you bound Twenty-one haughty deva upasakas To samaya. At Jamtrin In Mangyul you bestowed siddhi Upon four bhikshus. Great Kyepak Rikdzin, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: dpal mo thang gi dpal thang du: brtan ma bcu gnyis dam la btags: bod yul kha la'i la thog tu: gangs dkar sha med dam la btags: 'dam shod lha bu'i snying drung du: thang lha yar bzhud dam la btags: has po ri yi yang gong du: lha srin thams cad dam la btags: che ba'i lha 'dre thams cad kyis: la las srog gi snying po phul: la las bstan pa bsrung bar byas: la las bran du khas blangs byas: mthu dang rdzu 'phrul stobs po che: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ In the valley of Palmotang You bound the twelve Tenmas to samaya. In the Khala Pass into Tibet You bound Gangkar Shamey to samaya. In front of Damshö Lhanying You bound Thanglha Yarshu to samaya. On the peak of Mount Hepo You bound all gods and rakshasas to samaya. Of all those great gods and rakshasas, Some offered their life-essence mantras. Some began to guard the Dharma. Some promised to serve. You with great power, miracles, and strength, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: dam pa chos kyi bstan pa ni: rgyal mtshan lta bur btsugs pa'i tshe: bsam yas ma bzhengs lhun gyis grub: rgyal po'i dgongs pa mthar phyin mdzad: skyes mchog gsum gyi mtshan yang gsol: gcig ni pad+ma 'byung gnas zhes: gcig ni pad+ma sam+b+ha wa: gcig ni mtsho skyes rdo rje zhes: gsang mtshan rdo rje drag po rtsal: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ When you planted the sublime Dharma like a victory banner, Samye arose spontaneously, without being built. You fulfilled the king’s intentions. Great being, you bear three names. One is Padmakara. One is Padmasambhava. One is Lake-Born Vajra. Your secret name is Dorje Drakpotsal. Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: bsam yas mchims phur sgrub pa mdzad: rkyen ngan zlog cing dngos grub gnang : rje blon thar pa'i lam la bkod: gdon gzugs bon gyi bstan pa bsnubs: chos sku dri med rin chen bstan: skal ldan sangs rgyas sa la bkod: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ At Samye Chimpu you engaged in accomplishment. You repelled adversity and bestowed siddhi. You placed the king and ministers on the path of liberation. You defeated the demonic Bön tradition. You displayed the stainless, precious dharmakaya. You placed the worthy on the level of buddhahood. Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: de nas o rgyan yul du byon: da lta srin po'i kha gnon mdzad: mi las lhag gyur ya mtshan che: spyod pa rmad byung ngo mtshar che: mthu dang rdzu 'phrul stobs po che: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ Then you went to Uddiyana, And are now subjugating the rakshasas. You are wondrous, superhuman. Your deeds are marvelous, amazing. You with great power, miracles, and strength, Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.

oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: sku gsung thugs ldan 'gro ba 'dren pa'i dpal: sgrib pa kun spangs khams gsum sa ler mkhyen: dngos grub mchog brnyes bde chen mchog gi sku: byang chub sgrub pa'i bar chad nges par sel: thugs rjes bdag la byin gyis rlobs: brtse bas bdag sogs lam sna drongs: dgongs pas bdag la dngos grub stsol: nus pas bdag sogs bar chad sol: phyi yi bar chad phyi ru sol: nang gi bar chad nang du sol: gsang ba'i bar chad dbyings su sol: gus pas phyag 'tshal skyabs su mchi:

oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ Guide of beings, with glorious body, speech, and mind, You’ve abandoned all veils and clearly know the three realms. You’ve gained supreme siddhi, the body of great bliss. You dispel all obstacles to the accomplishment of awakening. Grant your blessings with compassion. Lead us down the path with love. Through your wisdom, grant us siddhi. Clear away our obstacles with power. Clear outer obstacles outside! Clear inner obstacles inside! Clear secret obstacles in the expanse! I humbly bow and go for refuge.
oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma sid+d+hi hU~M: oM AHhU~M badz+ra gu ru pad+ma thod phreng rtsal badz+ra sa ma ya dzaH_sid+d+hi pha la hU~M AH
oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma siddhi hūṃ oṃ aḥ hūṃ vajra guru padma tötrengtsal vajra samaya ja siddhi phala hūṃ aḥ

sprul pa'i gter ston chen po mchog gyur bde chen gling pas zla nyin kha la rong sgo'i dpal chen po'i zhabs 'og las spyan drangs pa'i bla ma'i thugs sgrub bar chad kun sel gyi zhal gdams snying byang yid bzhin nor bu las/ phyi gsol 'debs kyi sgrub pa las khol du byung ba'o/

That was excerpted from “Outer Accomplishment through Supplication” in Wish-fulfilling Jewel Heart Scripture of Oral Instructions on the Sadhana of the Guru’s Mind, Dispelling All Obstacles, recovered by the emanated treasure-revealer Chokgyur Dechen Lingpa from beneath the feet of the Great Splendor of Danyin Kala Rongo.
gsol 'debs bsam pa lhun grub/
The Supplication Spontaneous Fulfillment of Wishes

e ma ho: nub phyogs bde ba can gyi zhing khams su: snang ba mtha' yas thugs rje'i byin rlabs g.yos: sprul sku pad+ma 'byung gnas byin brlabs te: 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gro ba'i don la byon: 'gro don rgyun chad med pa'i thugs rje can: o rgyan pad+ma 'byung gnas la gsol ba 'debs: bsam pa lhun gyis 'grub par byin gyis rlobs: rgyal po khri srong lde'u btsan man chad nas: chos rgyal gdung brgyud mtha' la ma stong bar: dus gsum rgyun chad med par byin gyis rlobs: bod kyi chos skyong rgyal po'i gnyen gcig pu: rgyal po chos spyod skyong ba'i thugs rje can: o rgyan pad+ma 'byung gnas la gsol ba 'debs: bsam pa lhun gyis 'grub par byin gyis rlobs: sku ni lho nub srin po'i kha gnon mdzad: thugs rjes bod kyi sems can yongs la gzigs: ma rig log pa'i sems can 'dren pa'i dpal: nyon mongs gdul dka'i sems can thabs kyis 'dul: brtse gdung rgyun chad med pa'i thugs rje can: o rgyan pad+ma 'byung gnas la gsol ba 'debs: bsam pa lhun gyis 'grub par byin gyis rlobs: dus ngan snyigs ma'i mtha' la thug pa'i
