The invitation: Glorious, peerless king of the Shakyas and retinue of the ocean-like assembly of the noble Sangha and innumerable disciples, so that I and all beings may purify the stains of our faults and downfalls and increase our accumulation of merit, I invite you. Now it is time; moved by your great compassion, please accept my invitation. As you have come to know all things, you are fully awakened buddhas. The brilliant sunlight of your awakening has opened the lotus of wisdom. Without any bias, the garlands of your illuminating rays fill with samadhi all the places where lotuses grow. The mandala of light that issues from within your ushnishas brightens all mandalas even at the end of time, and the lord of yakshas touches the great jewel of his crown to your toenails. You teach the Dharma. You lead us down the path to peace. You guide the world. You befriend us. You are our only friends, as bright as a string of lamps or row of golden stupas. I pray that you come to and bless this precious palace endowed with inexhaustible treasure just as you wondrously appear in my crystalline mind. For each and every being, a protector, You vanquished the ferocious hordes of Mara. You know all things just as they are, Bhagavan; I pray you come here with your retinue. Bhagavan, who for many countless aeons Trained in compassion out of love for beings, Now is the time to fulfill your vast aspirations By benefitting beings as you wished. I pray that out of the spontaneous palace Of dharmadhatu you and your pure retinue Will come, displaying miracles and blessings To liberate infinite sentient beings. I pray that you protectors of wanderers, Who have the eye of compassion, rise out of The dharmakaya free of elaborations As a form kaya and come to benefit beings.

byon legs zhu ba ni/ bcom ldan 'dir ni byon pa legs/ / bdag cag bsod nams skal bar ldan/ / bdag gi mchod yon bzhes slad du/ / 'di nyid du ni bzhugs su gsol/ / stong gsum kun dang mnyam pa yi/ / pad+ma 'dab brgya ge sar bcas/ / bde zhing yangs pa 'bul lags na/ / ci bde bar ni bzhugs su gsol/ /

The welcome: The Bhagavan is welcome here! We have such merit and good fortune. We ask that you remain right here In order to accept our offerings. I offer you this hundred-petaled lotus, Spacious and comfortable, equal in size To this realm of a billion worlds. I pray you take your seat with ease.

mchod yon dung gi chu bzed zhal du sbreng bzhin du/ chu bo gang+gA'i rgyun bzhin du/ / ar+g+haM rgyun yang mi 'chad de/ / bla med mchod pa 'di 'bul na/ / thugs rjes dgongs te bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa dag ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su dag pa thob par gyur cig / zhabs bsil 'di dang zhabs la mchod yon 'di dag zhabs dag la dbul bar bgyi'o/ / dUrba ma nyams pa dang dri dang me tog dang bcas pa rung ba'i chu yis zhabs dag bkru bar bgyi'o/ / chu bo gang+gA'i rgyun bzhin du/ / zhabs bsil rgyun yang mi 'chad de/ / bla med mchod pa 'di 'bul na/ / thugs rjes dgongs te bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi bying ba dang rgod pa'i dri ma dag ste rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yang dag pa thob par gyur cig /

While presenting a conch shell filled with drinking water to their mouths: Just like the current of the River Ganges, The stream of argham also is unceasing. I give this best of offerings to you And pray that you accept it with compassion. May my thoughts and those of all beings be purified. May we achieve the utterly pure bodies of Tathagatas. I offer your feet this water for washing. I bathe your feet with purified water, unbroken dūrva grass, fragrance, and flowers. Just like the current of the River Ganges, This stream of cooling water is unceasing. I give this best of offerings to you And pray that you accept it with compassion. May my stains of torpor and agitation and those of all infinite beings be purified. May we achieve the true feet of miracles.

de nas khrus gsol ba la/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas/ rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo bsgyur ba/ bla na med pa/ lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa de la yo byad thams cad dang ldan pa'i khrus 'di gsol bar bgyi'o/ / khrus kyi khang pa shin tu dri zhim pa/ / shel gyi sa gzhi gsal zhing 'tsher ba bstar/ / rin chen 'bar ba'i ka ba yid 'ong ldan/ / mu tig 'od chags bla re bres pa der/ / de bzhin gshegs dang de yi sras rnams la/ / rin chen bum pa mang po'i spos kyi chu/ / yid 'ong legs par bkang ba glu dang ni/ / rol mor bcas pa du mas sku khrus gsol/ / 'di ni khrus mchog dpal dang ldan/ / thugs rje'i chu ni bla na med/ / byin brlabs ye shes chu yis ni/ / ci 'dod dngos grub stsal du gsol/ / ri bo ltar ni mdzes pa yi/ / yon tan dam pa'i rgyan ldan pa/ / mchod gnas rin chen de dag la/ / bdag gis khrus 'di gsol bar bgyi/ / snying rje yis ni nges gang bas/ / rtag tu phan dang bde mdzad pa'i/ / mchog tu dul ba de dag la/ / bdag gis khrus 'di gsol bar bgyi/ / zhes pas khrus gsol nas/

Next, the ablution: The bhagavan, tathagata, arhat, completely perfect buddha, the one with awareness and conduct, the sugata, the one who knows the world, the charioteer who tames beings, the unsurpassable, the teacher of gods and humans: I offer him this bath replete with all the requisites. Within this sweetly fragrant house for bathing, Where the bright and lustrous floors are paved with crystal, Alluring pillars are aglow with jewels, And glistening pearls are draped in canopies, I bathe the sugatas and bodhisattvas From precious vases that have been filled full Of water imbued with many fragrances, Accompanied by song and instruments. This is the glorious, supreme ablution With the unsurpassed water of compassion, The water of your blessings and your wisdom: I pray you grant the siddhis I desire. To those we venerate as precious, Adorned with sublime qualities, Who are as magnificent as mountains, I offer this ablution. To those, whom compassion truly fills So that they always bring benefit And happiness, the supremely peaceful, I offer this ablution. Thus offer ablution, and then:
de dag sku la mtshungs pa med pa'i gos/ / gtsang la dri rab bsgos pas sku phyi'o/ / zhes sku phyi/
With cloths that are beyond compare and clean, Infused with a fine scent, I dry their bodies. Thus dry their bodies.

de nas de la kha dog legs bsgyur ba'i/ / na bza' shin tu dri zhim dam pa 'bul/ / gos bzang srab la 'jam pa sna tshogs dang*/ / rgyan mchog brgya phrag de dang de dag gis/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang de sras dang*/ / skyes mchog dam pa rnams la'ang brgyan par bgyi/ / zhes gos rgyan phul/

And then I offer them the finest robes, Well-dyed and most delightfully perfumed. I adorn the buddhas, bodhisattvas, And great, exalted beings as well With fabrics that are delicate and soft And hundreds of the finest ornaments. Thus offer them robes and jewelry.
stong gsum kun tu dri ngad ldang ba yi/ / dri mchog rnams kyis thub dbang kun gyi sku/ / gser sbyangs btso ma byi dor byas pa ltar/ / 'od chags 'bar ba de dag byug par bgyi/ / zhes byug pa 'bul lo/ /
Like polishing the purest refined gold, I apply the finest scents, whose fragrances Waft everywhere throughout the billion worlds, To the radiant bodies of all sugatas. Thus offer anointment.

tshogs bsag bgyi ba la/ phyag 'tshal ba ni/ gang gis 'ching rnams thams cad rab bcad cing*/ / mu stegs tshogs rnams thams cad bcom byas te/ / sde dang bcas pa'i bdud ni btul nas su/ / byang chub mchog brnyes de la phyag 'tshal lo/ / mi mchog 'dul ba kha lo bsgyur mdzad cing*/ / kun sbyor 'ching ba gcod mdzad de bzhin gshegs/ / dbang po zhi zhing nyer zhi zhi la mkhas/ / mnyan yod bzhugs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo/ / yon tan rin chen mang po'i tshogs mnga' zhing*/ / mtshan rab ye shes yongs su dag pa'i sku/ / gser gyi mdog can lha dang mis mchod pa/ / bcom ldan lha yi lha la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

To gather the accumulations, first offer prostrations: I bow to him who severed every bond, Who vanquished all the tirthikas, Who subdued Mara and his hordes, And achieved the supreme awakening. Best among humans, the tathagata Tames us and guides; he cuts the bonds and fetters. His faculties pacified, peaceful, skilled in peace— To him who dwelled in Shravasti, I prostrate. His body of utterly pure pristine wisdom With many precious qualities, great marks, And golden hue is revered by gods and humans. I prostrate to the Bhagavan, the god of gods.

gling ras bla ma mchod pa las/ gang gi 'khor ba'i nyes pa ni/ / dran pa tsam gyis 'joms mdzad cing*/ / bla med byang chub thob mdzad pa'i/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi ma rig mun pa'i tshogs/ / smag tu gyur pa sel mdzad pa/ / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi/ / tshad gdung ma lus sel mdzad pa/ / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i/ / nyon mongs nad rnams sel mdzad pa/ / sman pa'i rgyal po lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi zag med bde chen gyi/ / grong khyer mchog tu skyel mdzad pa/ / rta mchog rin chen lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi skye rga na 'chi yi/ / chu bo che las sgrol mdzad pa/ / mnyan pa'i rgyal po lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi 'gro ba'i dgos 'dod rnams/ / yid bzhin rdzogs par 'byung 'gyur ba'i/ / nor bu rin chen lta bu yi/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi chos rnams thams cad kun/ / 'du 'bral med pa khyab gyur pa/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i thugs mnga' ba'i/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / gang gi gsung gi 'od zer gyis/ / bdag sogs rmongs pa ma lus pa/ / snying gi pad+mo kha phyes pa'i/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

From Lingrepa’s Offering to the Gurus: It’s he whom just remembering Conquers the evils of samsara And brings the highest awakening— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who dispels the pitch black, The darkness of our ignorance, Who’s like the bright orb of the sun— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who cools the torments of The heat of suffering in samsara, Who’s like the cool orb of the moon— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who dispels all the illness Of the afflictions such as lust, Who’s like the king of all physicians— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. He takes us to the supreme city Of undefiled great bliss. It’s he who’s like the precious, supreme steed— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who frees us from great floods Of birth and aging, illness and death, Who’s like the king of ferrymen— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who fulfills all desires And needs of beings as they wish, Who’s like a wish-fulfilling jewel— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he who permeates all things, Not ever coming, never parting, Who has a wisdom mind like space— I prostrate at my guru’s feet. It’s he, the light rays of whose speech Open the lotus of our hearts, Dispelling all our ignorance— I prostrate at my guru’s feet.

mchod pa 'bul ba ni/ dpang skong phyag rgya pa'i mdo las/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams rab 'byams las byung ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i mchod pa sna tshogs/ mchog /gtso bo/ dam pa/ khyad par can/ bzang po/ gya nom pa/ bla na med pa/ mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas phyogs bcu'i snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad phyur bur bkang ste/ chos kyi mchod pa dang bcas pas ma lus mi lus lus pa med pa'i dkon mchog gsum la phyi ma'i mu mthar rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mchod cing 'don no/ / dbul zhing gsol lo/ /bkur stir bgyi'o/ / bla mar bgyi'o/ /ri mor bgyi'o/ /mnyes par bgyi'o/ /

The presentation of offerings: From The Sutra of the Hundredfold Homage for Amending Breaches: Born of the infinite merit of bodhisattvas, assortments of supreme offerings— the best and most excellent, special and fine, bounteous, unsurpassable offerings equal to the unequalled— fill all the external worlds in the ten directions to overflowing. Along with the offering of Dharma, I proffer and present these evermore and unceasingly to the Three Jewels until the very end of time so that nothing has been, is, or will ever be left out. I offer and give. I pay you respect. I exalt you. I venerate you. I please you.

zhes pas mtshams sbyar te/ thog mar nyer spyod lnga 'bul ba ni/ mthar so so'i 'dod don rnams sbyar bar bya ste/ rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i mchod rdzas las grub pa'i/ / zhing khams rgya mtsho'i me tog rgya mtsho'i tshogs/ / yon tan rgya mtsho'i rgyal ba 'khor bcas la/ / dad pa rgya mtshos 'bul lo bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang ldan par gyur cig / rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i mchod rdzas las grub pa'i/ / zhing khams rgya mtsho'i bdug spos rgya mtsho'i tshogs/ / yon tan rgya mtsho'i rgyal ba 'khor bcas la/ / dad pa rgya mtshos 'bul lo bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad tshul khrims rnam par dag ste yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cig / rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i mchod rdzas las grub pa'i/ / zhing khams rgya mtsho'i snang gsal rgya mtsho'i tshogs/ / yon tan rgya mtsho'i rgyal ba 'khor bcas la/ / dad pa rgya mtshos 'bul lo bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma dang ldan par gyur cig / rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i mchod rdzas las grub pa'i/ / zhing khams rgya mtsho'i dri chab rgya mtsho'i tshogs/ / yon tan rgya mtsho'i rgyal ba 'khor bcas la/ / dad pa rgya mtshos 'bul lo bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi chus rnam par g.yengs pa'i dri ma dag ste bde zhing tshim par gyur cig / rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i mchod rdzas las grub pa'i/ / zhing khams rgya mtsho'i zhal zas rgya mtsho'i tshogs/ / yon tan rgya mtsho'i rgyal ba 'khor bcas la/ / dad pa rgya mtshos 'bul lo bzhes su gsol/ / bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad bkres pa'i sdug bsngal bsal nas yid bzhin gyi zas skom dang ldan par gyur cig /

To continue, offer the five enjoyments first: I offer with an ocean of faith these oceans of flowers Made from the offerings of oceans of buddhas In oceans of pure realms to the oceans of qualities, The buddhas and their retinues. I pray that you accept them. May I and all infinite beings gain the seven factors of enlightenment. I offer with an ocean of faith these oceans of incense Made from the offerings of oceans of buddhas In oceans of pure realms to the oceans of qualities, The buddhas and their retinues. I pray that you accept them. May my discipline and that of all infinite sentient beings be completely pure; may we have authentic discipline. I offer with an ocean of faith these oceans of lamps Made from the offerings of oceans of buddhas In oceans of pure realms to the oceans of qualities, The buddhas and their retinues. I pray that you accept them. May the darkness of my ignorance and that of all beings be dispelled; may we have the lamp of omniscient pristine wisdom. I offer with an ocean of faith these oceans of scented water Made from the offerings of oceans of buddhas In oceans of pure realms to the oceans of qualities, The buddhas and their retinues. I pray that you accept them. May the water of samadhi purify me and all infinite sentient beings of the stains of distraction; may we be happy and satisfied. I offer with an ocean of faith these oceans of food Made from the offerings of oceans of buddhas In oceans of pure realms to the oceans of qualities, The buddhas and their retinues. I pray that you accept them. May my suffering from hunger and that of all infinite sentient beings be dispelled; may we have all the food and drink we wish.
'dod yon lnga ni/ rgyal ba zag med 'byor la mnga' bsgyur yang*/ / 'gro ba'i don du 'dod yon rnam lnga yis/ / mchod pas mkha' mnyam sems can thams cad kyis/ / bsod nams mi zad gter la spyod par shog /

The five sensory pleasures: Although the victors have undefiled riches, By offering the five sensory pleasures For the sake of beings, may all throughout space Enjoy a treasury of inexhaustible merit.
rgyal srid sna bdun ni/ mi dbang rin chen sna bdun 'di dag ni/ / sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa ma lus la/ / bdag gis bshams shing yid kyis phul ba yis/ / 'gro ba mi zad gter la spyod par shog /
The seven articles of royalty: By arranging here and mentally offering The seven precious articles of kings To all the buddhas and to all their children, May all beings enjoy an endless trove.

bkra shis rdzas brgyad ni/ lha yi dbang po lha min g.yul rgyal nas/ / bkra shis lha mo brgyad kyis mchod pa ltar/ / rgyal dbang rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' la/ / bkra shis rdzas brgyad dag gis mchod par bgyi/ /

The eight auspicious substances: Just as the eight auspicious goddesses make offerings to The lord of gods when he defeats the demigods, I make this offering of the eight auspicious substances To the victorious buddhas and the bodhisattvas.

bkra shis rtags brgyad ni/ mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / bsod nams rgyu las byung ba'i 'khor lo 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / dri med shin tu mdzes pa'i dpal be'u 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / kun mkhyen ye shes nyid dang ldan par shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / rin chen bcud kyis gang ba'i bum pa 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / bsod nams tshogs rdzogs rgyan gyis brgyan par shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / dri med shin tu dag pa'i pad+ma 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / 'khor ba'i nyes pa'i skyon gyis ma gos shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / dri med shin tu dkar ba'i dung chen 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / rtsod ngan pham byed chos sgra sgrogs par shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / dri med shin tu dag pa'i gser nya 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho che las sgrol bar shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / skyabs kyi dam pa rin chen gdugs mdzes 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / kun la skyabs kyi dam pa byed par shog / mgon po thugs rje chen pos byin brlabs pa'i/ / dam chos mi nub rgyal mtshan dam pa 'di/ / gang la phul ba de yis skad cig la/ / dam chos mi nub rgyal mtshan 'dzugs par shog /ces pa bcug go /

The eight auspicious symbols: At the very moment that I offer This wheel that has arisen out of merit, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May the wheel of genuine Dharma turn. At the very moment that I offer This stainless and most beautiful endless knot, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May we have omniscient pristine wisdom. At the very moment that I offer This precious vase filled with elixir, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May we be adorned by the perfection of merit. At the very moment that I offer This lotus, stainless and immaculate, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May we be untainted by samsaric faults. At the very moment that I offer This stainless and completely white great conch, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May the sound of Dharma ring and defeat all dispute. At the very moment that I offer This stainless golden fish so very pure, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May all be freed from the great ocean of samsara. At the very moment that I offer The highest protection, the precious parasol, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May we give all the highest protection. At the very moment that I offer This unwaning victory banner of True Dharma, Which the compassionate protector blessed, May the unwaning banner of True Dharma be planted.

tsA ru'i bza' ba ni/ nam mkha' mdzod kyis byin gyis brlabs te/ na maHsarba ta thA ga te b+h+yo bi shwa mu khe b+h+ya_sarba thA kaM ut+ga te s+pha ra Na i maM ga ga na khaM gr-ih+na daM ba li de swA hA/
The Feast of Tsaru: Bless it with the sky-treasury mantra and mudra: namaḥ sarva tathāgatebhyo viśvamukhebhyaḥ sarva thākhaṃ utgate spharaṇa imaṃ gaganakhaṃ gṛihnedaṃ baliṃde svāhā

gzugs sgra dri ro reg ldan pa/ / mchog tu gyur pa'i zas mchog 'di/ / bdag gis dad pas 'bul lags kyis/ / ci bde bar ni bzhes su gsol/ / zhal zas ro brgya ldan pa yid 'phrog pa/ / legs sbyar 'di ni rgyal ba sras bcas la/ / dad pas phul bas 'gro ba 'di dag kun/ / 'byor ldan ting 'dzin zas la spyod par shog / rgyal bas bdud bcom byang chub sangs rgyas te/ / rgyal ba'i sku la sbribs skyems mi mnga' yang*/ / bdag cag bsod nams zhing du 'gyur slad du/ / sbyar ba'i bshos dang zhal zas 'di phul bas/ / dus kun dge ba'i lo tog 'phel rgyas nas/ / bde ba can du pad+mo las skyes te/ / ting 'dzin chos dang zas la longs spyod shog / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor ba rnams la zhal zas sna tshogs pa'i tshod ma dang 'khur ba dang bshos dang zho la sogs pa lha'i rdzas gya nom pa dri bzang po rung ba'i chus gang ba'i bum pa dang bcas pa rnams/ bdag dang sbyin pa'i bdag po la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad rjes su bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang la rab tu 'god pa'i slad du dbul bar bgyi'o/ /

This supreme food has the best form, Sound, fragrance, taste, and texture. I offer it with faith and pray That you accept it as you please. By offering to the victors and their children With faith this well-prepared, enticing food That has a hundred flavors, may all beings Enjoy the food of samadhi endowed with riches. The victor conquered Mara and awoke to enlightenment. The victor’s body has no hunger or thirst. Yet as a field for us to gather merit, We offer you this food we have prepared. Thus may our crops of virtue ever flourish; May we be born from lotuses in Sukhavati And enjoy the food and Dharma of samadhi. To the completely perfect buddhas surrounded by a sangha of bodhisattvas, I present this assortment of bountiful, fragrant, divine foods—vegetables, breads, grains, yoghurt, and more—along with vases filled with pure water. I offer this that you take care of me as well as the donor and all other sentient beings, and bring us to the unexcelled completely perfect state of buddhahood.

lnga phrag lnga ni/ rgyal ba mgon po dpal gyis lham mer bzhugs/ / bsod nams ye shes sku lnga brnyes pa la/ / lnga phrag lnga ldan snying po dam pa 'bul/ / 'gro bas bde gshegs snying po thob par shog / 'bru rnam pa lnga phul bas sems can thams cad la 'jig rten gyi lo tog 'phel zhing dge ba'i lo tog dus kun tu rgyas par gyur cig / rin po che rnam pa lnga phul bas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po ches sems can thams cad kyi dgos dgu yid bzhin du bskangs nas 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sman rnam pa lnga phul bas sems can thams cad nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'i sdug bsngal dang bral nas thugs rje'i sman gyis dug gsum gyi nad las thar bar gyur cig / snying po rnam pa lnga phul bas sems can thams cad de kho na nyid kyi snying po dang ldan par gyur cig / dri rnam pa lnga phul bas sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi chus rnam par g.yeng ba'i dri ma thams cad rnam par dag ste bde zhing tshim par gyur cig /

The five fives: Victorious protector, dwelling in resplendent glory, Who achieved through merit and through pristine wisdom the five kayas, By offering you the sublime five sets of five essences, May every wandering being realize their own buddha essence. Through my offering you the five grains, may the world’s crops increase for all beings, and may the harvest of virtue flourish at all times. Through my offering you the five jewels, may the precious wish-fulfilling jewel satisfy the many needs of all beings as they wish, so that they enjoy abundant prosperity. Through my offering you the five medicinal herbs, may all beings be freed from the suffering of the four hundred and four illnesses, and may the medicine of compassion free them from the illnesses of the three poisons. Through my offering you the five essences, may all beings possess the essence of suchness. Through my offering you the five perfumes, may all the stains of distraction of all beings be purified by the water of samadhi. May they be happy and satisfied.

mchod pa'i dngos po gzhan yang grub chen gling gis mdzad pa'i bla ma mchod pa las/ nam mkha' nyi zla gza' skar 'ja' tshon dang*/ / mdzes pa'i sprin dang khug rna la sogs pas/ / rab tu brgyan cing yid rab dwang gyur pa/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / ri bo mchog dang de bzhin ri phran dang / / gangs ri sman ri rin chen ri bo sogs/ / dgos 'dod 'byung ba'i ri gzhan ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / rin chen sa gzhir lo tog smin byed cing*/ / skyed mos tshal dang kun dga' rwa ba dang*/ / gtsug lag khang sogs pho brang bzhin gyur pa/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / gzhal med khang chen bsil khang sgo khang dang*/ / rta babs la sogs mdzes pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan/ / ngo mtshar mchog tu gyur pa de dag kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / gtsug lag khang dang rgyal po'i pho brang dang*/ / mkhar dang yul 'khor grong dang grong khyer dang*/ / yid 'ong mdzes pa'i khang bzang ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / bla bre gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan dang*/ / dar dpyangs lhab lhub 'phan dang lda ldi dang*/ / yol ba la sogs bkod pa'i khyad par rnams/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / gser dngul zangs lcags de bzhin mu tig dang*/ / baiDUr+ya dang dung dang man shel dang*/ / byu ru la sogs rin chen ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / rgya mtsho che dang chu bo chu phran dang*/ / mtsho dang rdzing bu lteng ka chu mig sogs/ / rnyog pa med cing yan lag brgyad ldan chab/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / lo tog rtsi thog shing tog ji snyed pa'i/ / dri dang ro ldan 'gro ba'i gsos gyur pa/ / dbang po'i spyod yul ngo mtshar sna tshogs pa/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / tsan dan ga bur gur gum la sogs te/ / ro dang nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / nad sel sman gyi rnam pa ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / rgyu mchog rkyen gyis legs par sbyar ba yi/ / bza' dang bca' dang ldag dang btung la sogs/ / 'jig rten zas mchog ma lus ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / 'jig rten dag na na bza'i mchog gyur pa/ / khyad 'phags sku la 'jam zhing mdzes pa yi/ / bye brag dpag med ji snyed yod pa kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / zhes dang*/

Additional offerings from the Offerings to the Gurus written by the mahasiddha Lingrepa: I offer to the precious, supreme beings The sky embellished with the sun, moon, planets, Stars, rainbows, lovely clouds, and plumes of mist, And more as well, my mind truly sincere. I offer to the precious, supreme beings The supreme mountain, lesser peaks, snow mountains, Herb-bearing mountains, and great hills of gems, And mountains that yield all we need and want. I offer to the precious, supreme beings The precious earthen ground that ripens crops, And pleasant groves, walled gardens, temples, and Such other buildings that are like great mansions. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All of the wondrous and best palaces That have cool chambers, archways, and gate houses, Bedecked with beautiful embellishments. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All temples and all royal palaces, And every tower, city, town, and all The attractive, beauteous buildings there may be. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All kinds of decorations—canopies, Parasols, banners, pennants, waving ribbons, And streamers, curtains, strings of flags, and such. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All of the precious substances there are, Such as gold, silver, copper, iron, pearls, Conch, beryl, crystal, coral, and all gems. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All unpolluted water with eight traits— Great oceans, rivers, streams and rivulets, Lakes, ponds, pools, springs, and other waters, too. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All of the fragrant and delicious grains, And vegetables and fruits that sustain beings— A wonderful variety for the senses. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All healing medicines that there may be— Sandalwood, camphor, saffron, and so forth With inconceivable taste and potency. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All the best foods to be found in the world— Foods to be eaten, chewed or licked or sipped, Prepared well from the finest ingredients. I offer to the precious, supreme beings The best of fabrics found in any world, Each of the infinite varieties So soft and lovely on your sublime bodies. And:

lha yi dbang po nye ba'i dbang po dang*/ / bu dang bu mo mdzes pa'i 'khor dang bcas/ / longs spyod 'dod yon tshogs bcas de dag kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / lha min klu dang gnod sbyin dri za dang*/ / dbang po la sogs bu dang bu mo dang*/ / 'khor dang longs spyod ngo mtshar ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / 'khor los bsgyur rgyal mi yi dbang phyug mchog / btsun mo sras bcas rin chen sna bdun dang*/ / dpung gi tshogs dang bcas pa ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / rgyal phran la sogs skyes pa bud med dang*/ / khye'u bu mo mdzes pa'i gos gyon cing*/ / rin chen rgyan gyis brgyan pa de dag kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / seng ge khyu mchog la sogs stobs chen dang*/ / e n+ya sogs mdzes pa'i ri dwags sogs/ / nags khrod ri bo'i sul na rgyu ba kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / rta dang glang po de bzhin shing rta dang*/ / 'jig rten dag na theg chen bzhon pa'i mchog / shugs chen mgyogs par 'gro ba de dag kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / mkha' lding rgyal po ka la ping ka dang*/ / khrung khrung rma bya khu byug ngur pa sogs/ / skad snyan mdzes pa'i 'dab chags ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / lha mi'i longs spyod yongs su bzung ba dang*/ / yongs su gzung min rang bzhin gnas pa'i rigs/ / ngo mtshar spyad du rung ba ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / snod kyi 'jig rten pho brang gzhal yas khang*/ / bcud kyi sems can sna tshogs sprul pa'i rigs/ / yid 'ong mdzes pa'i rol mo ji snyed kun/ / skyes mchog rin chen rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / bdag gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad dang*/ / mkha' dang mnyam pa'i 'gro ba ma lus kun/ / skyes mchog khyed kyi 'bangs su 'bul lags na/ / thugs rjes dgongs nas bzhes te bskyab tu gsol/ /

I offer to the precious, supreme beings The ruler of the gods, his vassal kings, His sons and daughters, beautiful retinue, And all the pleasurable things he has. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All demigods, all nagas, yakshas, and Gandharvas, with their rulers, children, courts, And all the wondrous things that they possess. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All of the universal emperors Of humans that there are, their queens and children, Their seven precious articles and armies. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All lesser monarchs and all men and women, Young boys and girls, dressed in attractive clothes And wearing gems and precious jewelry. I offer to the precious, supreme beings Lions, great bulls, other such powerful beasts, Gazelles, and all the beautiful wild creatures Who roam the forests and the mountainsides. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All swift and powerful conveyances Like horses, elephants, and chariots, And all great mounts there are in every world. I offer to the precious, supreme beings Garuda kings and kalavingka birds, And cranes and peacocks, cuckoos, ruddy geese, And all the lovely birds who sing sweet song. I offer to the precious, supreme beings All of the wondrous things that can be used— What gods and humans enjoy as their own, As well as natural things that are unclaimed. I offer to the precious, supreme beings The external world, its palaces, and mansions, Its denizens, various beings and emanations, And all the beautiful music there may be. If I should give my body and all possessions And all the beings that there are throughout space To you, the best of beings, as your subjects, I pray that you accept us with compassion and protect us.

sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni/ thos pa'i mchod yon rgya mtshos legs gtams shing*/ / rnam bkra rig pa'i me tog kun tu bkram/ / tshul khrims rnam dag dri yi bdug spos 'thul/ / 'chad pa nyin mor byed pa'i sgron me sbar/ / rtsod pa nyes pa rnam sbyong dri chab gtams/ / bsam gtan ro brgya ldan pa'i zhal zas bshams/ / rtsom pa sdeb legs snyan pa'i rol mo sogs/ / 'phags rnams dgyes byed mchod pa 'di dag gis/ / bla med bla ma rgyal ba sras dang bcas/ / mchod par 'os pa'i skyabs kun mchod par bgyi/ / ston pa mchog gis ji ltar bstan pa bzhin/ / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i theg pa rab gsal bar/ / zhin rnams kun tu nub med 'bar mdzad pa/ / bka' brgyud rim par byon rnams mchod par bgyi/ /

The offering of practice: I pour oceans of the drinking water of study, Strew everywhere the flowers of brilliant awareness, Waft the scents of the incense of pure discipline, Light the lamps of explanation, bright as daylight, Pour the scented water of debate that cleanses faults, Lay out the hundred-flavored food of meditation, And play the sweet tune of elegant composition. I offer all of this that pleases the nobles To the great lama, the victors, and their children— To all the venerable sources of refuge. I offer this to the succession of Kagyus, Who make the vehicles of cause and result Shine brilliantly in all realms, never waning, Just as they were taught by our supreme Teacher.

bstod pa'i rim pa ni/ 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las/ mtshan mchog ldan pa dri med zla ba'i zhal/ / gser mdog 'dra ba khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / rdul bral khyod 'dra srid pa gsum ma mchis/ / mnyam med mkhyen can khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Praises from The Sutra Requested by Noble Rashtrapala: You have the supreme marks; your face, a stainless moon. Your color is like gold; I prostrate to and praise you. Immaculate, there’s none like you in the three worlds. You’ve great and peerless wisdom; I praise and prostrate to you.

de bzhin gshegs pa la bdud kyi bu mo bzhis bstod par grags pa/ rnam dag sku mnga' mchog tu gzugs bzang ba/ / ye shes rgya mtsho gser gyi lhun po 'dra/ / grags pa 'jig rten gsum na lhang nge ba/ / mgon po mchog brnyes khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

The following praise of the Tathagata is said to have been offered by the four daughters of Mara: Your body is utterly pure, your form supremely handsome. Ocean of wisdom, you are like a mountain of gold. Your fame resounds throughout all the three worlds. We prostrate to and praise you, the supreme protector.

de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal po chen po sde bzhis bstod par grags pa/ rgyal ba zla ba dri ma med pa'i sku/ / rgyal ba nyi ma 'od zer stong gi 'od/ / rgyal ba pad+ma dri ma med pa'i spyan/ / rgyal ba me tog pad rtsa rdul med tshems/ / rgyal ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho lta bu ste/ / rin po che ni du ma'i 'byung gnas gyur/ / rgyal ba rgya mtsho ye shes chu yis gang*/ / ting 'dzin brgya phrag stong gis kun tu gang*/ / rgyal ba'i zhabs ni 'khor lo bris pa ste/ / khor yug mu khyud de bzhin rtsibs ma stong*/ / phyag dang zhabs ni drwa bas spras pa ste/ / zhabs kyi drwa ba ngang pa'i dbang po bzhin/ / gser gyi ri bo lta bur rab tu gda'/ / rgyal ba dri med gser gyi ri dbang po/ / yon tan thams cad ri dbang 'dra ba ste/ / sangs rgyas ri dbang rgyal la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / de bzhin gshegs pa zla ba chu zla 'dra/ / nam mkha' dang yang mtshungs shing 'dra ba ste/ / sgyu ma smig rgyu lta bur chags pa med/ / rgyal ba dri ma med la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

The following praise of the Tathagata is said to have been offered by the four great kings: The Victor’s body is a stainless moon. The Victor shines the light of a thousand suns. The Victor’s eyes are stainless lotuses. The Victor’s teeth, immaculate lotus roots. The Victor’s qualities are like an ocean That is the font of many precious gems. The Victor, an ocean filled with wisdom’s waters, Is wholly filled with millions of samadhis. Two wheels are drawn upon the Victor’s feet With outer rims, a thousand spokes as well. His hands and feet are graced with webs of skin; His feet are webbed just like the lord of swans. He is so very like a golden mountain! The Victor, stainless, golden king of mountains, Is like the Meru of all qualities I prostrate to the Buddha, lord of mountains. Tathagata, like the moon, a moon in water, Is equal to and like the sky as well. Illusory and mirage-like, nothing clings. I prostrate to the Victor, free of stains.

bla ma mchod pa yon tan kun 'byung las/ sku la tshad med bgrang du med/ / nam mkha' dang ni mnyam gyur cing*/ / sna tshogs dbang phyug mi shigs pa/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / thams cad stong pa'i cho 'phrul las/ / 'byung lnga'i bdag nyid rang byung dpal/ / sgyu 'phrul chen po che ba'i bdag / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / 'dus ma byas shing lhun gyis grub/ / dngos med dngos kun bdag nyid can/ / gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa'i mchog / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / thog mthar 'gro 'ong mi mnga' zhing*/ / skye 'jig 'du 'bral mi mnga' yang*/ / 'gro don cir yang ston mdzad pa'i/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / rnam sprul sgyu ma'i skur bstan nas/ / sna tshogs sgyu ma'i gar mdzad cing*/ / rnam grol 'bras bu ster mdzad pa'i/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / sku yi rnam sprul re res kyang*/ / sems can khams ni dpag med pa'i/ / dgos 'dod yid bzhin skong mdzad pa'i/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / ji srid 'khor ba de srid du/ / sku la mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad/ / thugs rje'i lcags kyus 'gro ba 'dren/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / brjod du med pa'i ngang nyid las/ / tshangs pa la sogs snyan pa'i dbyangs/ / phyogs bcu kun tu sgrogs mdzad pa/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / srid gsum 'gro ba ma lus pa'i/ / rna ba'i dbang po tshim mdzad cing*/ / thams cad yid dang mthun gyur pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / gsung gi brjod pa re res kyang*/ / ma rig mun pa sel mdzad cing*/ / thar pa'i lam mchog ston mdzad pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / zhi sogs las rnams thams cad kun/ / zhal nas brjod pa tsam gyis ni/ / tshul bzhin du ni grub gyur pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / zab cing rgya che'i gsung dbyangs kyis/ / the tshom drwa ba gcod mdzad cing*/ / yid bde dang ba ster mdzad pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / 'gro ba'i dgos 'dod thams cad kun/ / thugs rje chen po'i smon lam gyis/ / phun sum tshogs par 'byung gyur pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / gsung gi rnam sprul rang byung gsung*/ / nam mkha' la sogs dngos rnams la/ / chos kyi sgra ni 'byung gyur pa'i/ / rnam dag gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / phung po khams dang skye mched dang*/ / gzung dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i/ / rtog pa kun las rnam par grol/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med/ / tshad med gzhal du med gyur cing*/ / mnyam pa med cing dpe med pa'i/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / 'khor 'das chos rnams ma lus kun/ / nyid kyi thugs su mkhyen gyur cing*/ / mkha' ltar dri ma mi mnga' ba'i/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / 'jig rten spyod pa sna tshogs kun/ / kun rdzob sgyu ma ltar gzigs shing*/ / skye 'jig med par mkhyen gyur pa'i/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / dus gsum shes bya ma lus kun/ / skye ba med cing gzhi med par/ / skad cig nyid la mkhyen gyur pa'i/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / skye ba med cing 'gag pa med/ / dmigs med rab tu mi gnas pa/ / mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid can/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / rnam dag spros dang bral ba'i thugs/ / skyon spangs thugs rje'i bdag nyid can/ / sangs rgyas phrin las mdzad pa po/ / ye shes thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

From The Offerings to the Gurus “Source of All Qualities”: Your body, beyond measure or count, Is equal to space—indestructible, The master of the myriad: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. Out of the miracle of all being empty, Arises of his own the great lord of illusions, The glorious essence of five elements: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. Noncomposite, yet spontaneously present; Nothing, yet the essence of all things; Formless, yet the finest supreme fine form: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. You have no beginning, no end, no coming or going, No birth or perishing, no joining or parting, And yet display whatever benefits beings: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. Your emanations as illusory bodies Perform the dance of myriad illusions, Bestowing the result, full liberation: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. Each one of your emanated bodies Fulfills the needs and desires of beings In infinite realms just as they wish: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. For as long as there is samsara, The ceaseless activity of your bodies Guides beings with the hook of compassion: I prostate to and praise your vajra body. Out of an inexpressible state You sound sweet melodies such as Brahma’s Everywhere in the ten directions: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. Your voice delights and sates the ears Of every being in the three worlds As suited best to each of them: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. Each single utterance you speak Dispels the darkness of ignorance And shows the supreme path to freedom: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. When you merely mention an act Of pacifying and so forth, It is accomplished accordingly: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. Your profound and vast melodies Of speech cut through the webs of doubt, Bestowing sincere happiness: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. All needs and wishes of wanderers Spring forth abundantly out of Your greatly compassionate aspirations: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. Your vocal emanations self-arisen, The sound of Dharma issues forth Within the sky and all such things: I prostate to and praise your utterly pure speech. Completely freed from any thought Of aggregate, element, sense base, Perceiver, perceived, or anything else: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. Beyond conception, beyond all measure, Inestimable, beyond appraisal, Unequalled, and incomparable: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. Your mind knows every phenomenon Of samsara and of nirvana; Like space, it has no stains at all: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. You see all various worldly acts Are relative, like to illusions, And know there’s no birth, no perishing: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. In a single instant you know that each knowable Of the three times without exception Has no arising and no basis: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. Unborn, unceasing, without focus, Not dwelling at all, its characteristic Is that it lacks all characteristics: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom. Your pure mind, free of elaboration, All flaws discarded, in essence compassion, Performs the activity of a buddha: I prostate to and praise your mind of pristine wisdom.

sdig pa bshags pa ni/ dpang skong phyag rgya'i mdo las gsungs pa/ bdag cag gi skye ba 'di dang skye ba thog ma dang tha ma ma mchis pa nas srid pa gsum gyi 'khor ba na 'khor zhing 'dod chags dang*/ zhe sdang dang*/ gti mug gsum gyi dbang gis lus dang*/ ngag dang*/ yid kyi sgo nas mi dge ba bcu dang*/ mtshams med pa lnga la sogs te/ gsung rab kun las 'gal ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las bdag gis ci bgyis pa dang*/ gzhan la bcol ba dang*/ gzhan bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba de dag rdul tsam bag tsam yang ma lus par mthol zhing bshags so/ / sbyangs shing bsal to/ / gzhig cing gdon no/ / mi 'chab bo/ /mi sbed do/ / mi bsnyen mi bgyid do/ / phung po gsum pa'i mdo yang 'don/

The confession of wrongdoing. From The Sutra of the Hundredfold Homage for Amending Breaches: I admit and confess all of the misdeeds and wrong acts I have done, told others to do, or rejoiced in when done by others with body, speech, or mind, out of desire, anger, or ignorance during this life and throughout my beginningless and endless series of births while circling through the three realms of samsara, including the ten nonvirtues, the five heinous acts, and all acts contradictory to all the scriptures. Not leaving out even the tiniest speck, I admit and confess them. I purify and remove them. I destroy and expunge them. I conceal none of them. I hide none of them. I will neither pursue nor perform any of them again! Also recite The Sutra in Three Sections.

skyabs 'gro dang sems bskyed kyi sdom pa bzung ba ni/ slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i cho ga las/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par bgyi ba'i slad du/ dus 'di nas bzung ste/ byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rkang gnyis kyi mchog la skyabs su mchi ste/ thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa/ thams cad gzigs pa/ 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba/ skyes bu chen po/ skyes bu khyu mchog / sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ bla na med pa'i sku/ chos kyi sku mnga' ba la skyabs su mchi'o/ / chos 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mchog la skyabs su mchi ste/ bla na med pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa la mnga' ba/ zhi ba chos kyi sku so sor rang gis rig pa la skyabs su mchi'o/ / dge 'dun dul ba tshogs kyi mchog la skyabs su mchi ste/ phyogs bzhi'i 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o/ / de skad lan gsum bzla/ skyabs su 'gro ba'o/ /

The vows of refuge and bodhichitta: From the ritual for the generation of bodhichitta by the noble master Nagarjuna: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please think of me. In order that the line of the descendants of the buddhas be unbroken, from this time onward until I dwell in the essence of awakening I, [name], go for refuge to the completely perfect buddhas, supreme among all who walk on two feet: I go for refuge to those with great compassion, the omniscient, all-seeing, utterly fearless great beings, the leaders of beings, who possess the inconceivable body, the unsurpassable body, the dharmakaya. I go for refuge to the Dharma, supreme among all that is free of desire: I go for refuge to that possessed by the tathagatas, the peaceful dharmakaya known distinctly by itself. I go for refuge to the Sangha, supreme among peaceful communities: I go for refuge to the Sangha of irreversible great bodhisattvas, the aryas of the four directions. Repeat that three times. That was taking refuge.

sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung ste/ byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dus ji lta ba dang stobs ci mchis pa bzhin du bdag 'bul zhing mchis na/ mgon po thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa dag bdag bzhes su gsol/ de skad lan gsum bzla/ bdag dbul ba'o/ /

All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please think of me. From this time onward until I dwell in the essence of awakening, I, [name], offer myself to all buddhas and bodhisattvas for all time and with all my strength. I pray that the compassionate protectors accept me! Repeat three times. That was offering oneself.

sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ ji ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang*/ sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang*/ sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang*/ sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang*/ sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i slad du/ ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa de bzhin du/ bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yang dus 'di nas bzung ste/ byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang*/ sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang*/ sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang*/ sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang*/ sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do/ / ji ltar sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang*/ byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag gis dngos po thams cad dang bral ba/ phung po dang*/ khams dang*/ skye mched dang*/ gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa/ chos bdag med pa mnyam de/ nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du/ bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yang bdud dpung dang bcas pa mtha' dag pham par bgyis te/ bdag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi'o/ / ji par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas tshogs yongs su bsdus pa de bzhin du/ bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bgyi'o/ /

All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please think of me. Just as the tathagatas, arhats, completely perfect buddhas of the past while engaging in the conduct of a bodhisattva generated the resolve to achieve unsurpassable, complete and perfect awakening in order to free all beings, release all beings, inspire all beings, bring all beings to parinirvana, and establish all beings in omniscient pristine wisdom, so too shall I, [name], from this time onward until I reach the essence of enlightenment, generate the intention to achieve unsurpassable complete and perfect awakening in order to free all beings, release all beings, inspire all beings, bring all beings to parinirvana, and establishall beings in omniscient pristine wisdom. Just as the bhagavan buddhas and great bodhisattvas of the past roused the bodhichitta of the essential nature of emptiness, free of all things, having abandoned the aggregates, elements, sense bases, perceiver, and perceived, their minds primordially unborn through the selflessness of dharmas and equality, so too shall I, [name], rouse bodhichitta from this time onward until I reach the essence of enlightenment. Just as the tathagatas, arhats, completely perfect buddhas of the past defeated Mara and his hordes and awakened to true and perfect buddhahood themselves, so too shall I, [name], defeat Mara and all his hordes and awaken to true and perfect buddhahood. Just as the tathagatas, arhats, completely perfect buddhas of the past awakened to true and perfect buddhahood and then turned the wheel of Dharma, so too shall I, [name], awaken to true and perfect buddhahood and then turn the wheel of Dharma. Just as the tathagatas, arhats, completely perfect buddhas of the past awakened to true and perfect buddhahood and then gathered a Sangha, so too shall I [say your name] awaken to true and perfect buddhahood and then gather a Sangha.

spyod 'jug las gsungs pa/ byang chub snying por mchis kyi bar/ / sangs rgyas rnams la skyabs su mchi/ / chos dang byang chub sems dpa' yi/ / tshogs la'ang de bzhin skyabs su mchi/ / ji ltar sngon gyi bde gshegs kyis/ / byang chub thugs ni bskyed pa dang*/ / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la/ / de dag rim bzhin gnas pa ltar/ / de bzhin 'gro la phan don du/ / byang chub sems ni bskyed bgyi zhing*/ / de bzhin du ni bslab pa la'ang*/ / rim pa bzhin du bslab par bgyi/ / de skad lan gsum bzla/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o/ /

From The Way of the Bodhisattva: Until I reach enlightenment’s essence, I go for refuge to the buddhas. I go for refuge to the Dharma And Sangha of bodhisattvas, too. Just as the sugatas of the past Aroused the mind of bodhichitta; Just as they followed step-by-step The training of the bodhisattvas, So too shall I, to benefit wanderers, Arouse the mind of bodhichitta. So too shall I, follow step-by-step, The bodhisattva’s training. Recite that three times to generate bodhichitta.

rjes su yi rang ba ni/ spyod 'jug las/ sems can kun gyi ngan song gi / sdug bsngal ngal gso'i dge ba dang*/ / sdug bsngal can dag bder gnas la/ / dga' bas rjes su yi rang ngo*/ / byang chub rgyur gyur dge bsags pa/ / de la rjes su yi rang ngo*/ / lus can 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las/ / nges par thar la yi rang ngo*/ / skyob pa rnams kyi byang chub dang*/ / rgyal sras sa la'ang yi rang ngo*/ / sems can thams cad bde mdzad pa'i/ / thugs bskyed dge ba rgya mtsho dang*/ / sems can phan par mdzad pa la/ / dga' bas rjes su yi rang ngo*/ /

Rejoicing: From The Way of the Bodhisattva: I rejoice, delighted in the virtues Of beings that relieve The agonies of the lower realms And make the suffering happy. I celebrate the virtues gathered That cause enlightenment. I rejoice in beings’ emancipation From the suffering of samsara, In the protectors’ buddhahood, And in bodhisattvahood. I rejoice gladly in the ocean Of bodhichitta that brings All sentient beings to happiness And gives them benefit.
chos 'khor bskul ba ni/ phyogs rnams kun gyi sangs rgyas la/ / thal mo sbyar te gsol ba ni/ / sems can sdug bsngal mun 'thoms la/ / chos kyi sgron me sbar du gsol/ /
The request to turn the wheel of Dharma: With my palms joined, I implore the buddhas In all directions: Light The lamp of Dharma in the gloom Of ignorant beings’ woes.
mya ngan las mi 'da' bar bzhugs gsol ni/ rgyal ba mya ngan 'da' bzhed la/ / thal mo sbyar te gsol ba ni/ / 'gro 'di ldongs par mi dgod cing*/ / bskal pa grangs med bzhugs par gsol/ /
Beseeching not to pass into nirvana: Joining my palms, I beseech the victors Who wish to pass to nirvana, Don’t leave these wanderers in blindness— Please stay for countless aeons.

bsngo smon bya ba ni/ de ltar 'di dag kun byas te/ / dge ba bdag gis bsags pa gang*/ / des ni sems can thams cad kyi/ / sdug bsngal thams cad bsal bar shog / 'gro ba nad pa ji srid du/ / nad sos gyur gyi bar du ni/ / sman dang sman pa nyid dag dang*/ / de yi nad g.yog byed par shog / zas dang skom gyi char phab ste/ / bkres dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal bsal/ / mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma'i tshe/ / bdag Aspirations and dedications: May the virtue that I have amassed By doing all of this Eliminate all the suffering Of every sentient being. As long as sentient beings are ill, Until their ailments are cured, May I be their medicine and doctor; May I be their nurse as well. May showers of food and drink relieve The torments of hunger and thirst. In intermediate aeons of famine, May I become food and drink. May I be an inexhaustible treasure For poor and deprived beings And stay nearby them as the various Things they need and want. To benefit all sentient beings, I give without hesitation My body, my belongings, and All virtues of the three times. Nirvana’s relinquishing everything. My wish is to gain nirvana. At some point, all must be relinquished— It’s best to give it to beings. As I have given living beings This body for their pleasure, May they always do with it as they like— Let them kill, revile, or beat it. They may make my body a cause for sport, Or jest or snickering, But I have given them my body. Why bother holding it dear? So let them do whatever acts Will not bring them any harm. May thinking of me never be Meaningless for any. When someone thinks of me and has A thought of anger or faith, May that be the cause of what fulfills Their every benefit. May anyone who slanders me, Any others who cause harm, And all who criticize me have The fortune to awaken. May I be a guardian of the defenseless, A leader of travelers, A boat or ship or even a bridge For those who wish to cross, A lamp for those who need a lamp, A bed for those without. For all those beings who want a servant May I become their slave. May I be a wish-fulfilling jewel, Fine vase, accomplished mantra, Great medicine, wish-fulfilling tree, And bountiful cow for beings. Like earth and the other elements, Like space, may I always be The ground, supporting in many ways The lives of sentient beings. Likewise in all ways for all beings Out to the edges of space, May I be, till all pass to nirvana, That which provides their living.

thugs rgyud bskul ba'i tshul du sher phyin yi ge nyung ngu las gsungs pa'i gzungs ni/ tad+ya thA/ /oM mu ne mu ne ma hA mu na ye swAhA/ zhes ci rigs dang*/ mkhas grub karma chags med kyi nang gzhug bzhag thabs las/ bla brgyud tshang ma kun gyi mtshan sngags ni/

Repeat the dharani from the brief Prajnaparamita as an appeal: TADYATHĀ OM MUNE MUNE MAHĀMUNAYE SVĀHĀ Recite it as many times as possible. The name mantra of all lineage gurus from The Means of Inner Placement by the wise and attained Karma Chakme is:
oM A sarba gu ru hU~M swAhA/
oṃ ā sarva guru hūṃ svāhā

bkod pa chen po bstan te/ 'od zer de dag sems can thams cad kyi yan lag gi dam par nub par gyur/ de'i 'khor gyi 'od zer rnams kyang sems can rnams kyi mgor nub par gyur/ 'od zer de dag gis phog ma can thams cad kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul la mngon par dbang bskur ba thob ste/ stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs nas ni/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su bgrang ba yang thob par This contains all the name mantras. Repeat it as many times as possible. Imagining the empowerment of great light-rays described in the “Dharma Cloud” chapter of The Sutra of the Ten Levels: Because we have called him by name and repeated the dharanis, the Tathagata Arhat Completely Perfect Buddha and his retinue emit from their brows and from all parts of their bodies innumerable millions of the light rays called the Clairvoyance of the Omniscient. These light rays illuminate all the world-realms in the ten directions, circle this world ten times, display the Tathagata’s great miracles, exhort billions upon billions of bodhisattvas, shake all the innumerable buddha realms six times, pacify all birth and death in lower realms, darken all the abodes of Mara, show all the seats everywhere where all the tathagatas awaken to truly perfect enlightenment, show the power of the buddhas to bring their retinue into their mandala, illuminate all world-realms throughout the dharmadhatu and the reaches of space, and then return and circle above the mandalas of all beings, revealing their great array. The light rays then dissolve into the highest extremity of all beings. The light rays of his retinue also dissolve into the heads of all sentient beings. As soon as they are struck by the light, all beings attain ten thousand previously unattained samadhis each. As all those light rays simultaneously descend into their highest extremity, all beings receive the empowerment of completely perfect buddhahood. They totally perfect the ten powers and become completely perfect buddhas.

Making aspirations: From The Sutra of the Hundredfold Homage for Amending Breaches: From this time onward until I reach the essence of enlightenment, may I never in any life be born in or fall into the three lower realms or other obstructed states except by intentional emanation. May I never turn toward or commit any wrong, unvirtuous acts. May I never turn toward or accumulate the causes, karma and the afflictions. Freed from all inferior bodies and resultant suffering, may I never experience them again. From this time onward until I reach the essence of enlightenment, may my three gates be engaged in a stream of virtue as unceasing as a river’s current. Throughout all future lives, wherever I am born, may I possess abundant happiness and comfort as well as the ability and power to benefit all beings. May I comprehend without mistake and meditate on suchness, the dharma which is realized only by tathagatas, the meaning of awakening beyond a doubt to unsurpassed enlightenment. May I also teach it unmistakenly to others and guide them to it. From this time onward until I reach the essence of enlightenment, I go for refuge to the Three Jewels. I offer them my bodies. May those with great compassion always accept each of them. Just as the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the three times generate the bodhichitta of the nature of emptiness, primordially unborn, free of all reality, equal to the selflessness of dharmas that is beyond the aggregates, elements, or sense bases, so too shall I, [name], from this time onward and until I reach the essence of enlightenment, generate bodhichitta. May I never, ever forsake bodhichitta, and may I never be separated from true spiritual friends. Just as all buddhas of the three times rejoice in unsurpassable merit, I, [name], also rejoice in all mundane and supramundane merit. At the time when death is certain, may I actually see the faces of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas. May they extend their golden-colored right hands, place them on the crown of my head, and grant me a prophecy. May I die with a mind unconfused by the afflictions, with an intention compatible with the selflessness of phenomena, and with immeasurable bodhichitta. In brief, may I purify all imprints, none excepted, And then perfect the accumulations of merit and wisdom. To liberate each and every being through my powers, May I awaken swiftly to manifest buddhahood.

The true words for the Dharma’s flourishing from The Sutra of Chandragarbha: Through whatever hardships I have undergone In the past for beings’ benefit; And through my giving up pleasure, May the Dharma blaze for a long time. Through my past sacrifice of my own welfare In the service of the sick, So that beings may be protected from poverty, May my teachings blaze for a long time. Through giving away my sons, Daughters, spouses, wealth, elephants, chariots, And jewels for the sake of precious awakening, May the Dharma blaze for a long time. Through my veneration Of buddhas, pratyekabuddhas, Shravakas, parents, and rishis, May the Dharma blaze for a long time. Through my having experienced a variety of sufferings Throughout millions of kalpas, In search of learning, for the sake of awakening, May the Dharma blaze for a long time. Through my long practice of discipline, Morality, and austerity And through my seeing the buddhas of the ten directions, May the Dharma blaze for a long time. Through my past diligence, Always stable and outstanding, So that all beings may be liberated, May the Dharma long blaze! Through my constant patience and discipline, And my patience with abuse By beings degraded by kleshas, May the teachings remain for a long time Through the power of my meditation On the dhyanas, gates of liberation, formless states, And as many samadhis as the Ganges’ sand grains, May the Dharma long blaze! Through my having in the past remained, For the sake of pristine wisdom, in forests, living in austerity; And through my past teaching of many shastras, May the Dharma long blaze! Through my having given, out of love, My flesh, my blood, My life, and my limbs, May Dharma flourish. Through my having in the past Lovingly ripened evil beings, Establishing them in the three vehicles, May offerings of Dharma flourish. Through my having in the past with means And wisdom freed beings from inferior views And established them in the authentic view, May Dharma flourish. Through my having freed beings from the kleshas’ fire Through the four means of nurturing; And through my increasing their virtue and defeat of evil, May my assembly long remain. Through my liberation of tirthikas From the mire of views And establishment of them in the authentic view, May my assembly be always devoted.

nongs pa bshags te gshegs su gsol ba ni/ ma 'byor pa dang nyams pa dang*/ / gang yang bdag rmongs blo yis ni/ / bgyis pa dang ni bgyid stsal gang*/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ / dus ngan sems can bsod nams dman/ / ma rig nyon mongs dang 'dres pas/ / 'phags pa'i thugs dgongs ma rdzogs pa/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ / ser sna'i dbang gyur mi mkhas pas/ / mchod pa ngan zhing bshams nyes pa/ / mgon po thugs rje che ldan pas/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ / bag med spyod pa ma dag pas/ / mdo las byung ba'i cho ga bzhin/ / ma lcogs 'khrul pa ci mchis pa/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ / lhag pa dang ni chad pa dang*/ / cho ga'i yan lag nyams pa dang*/ / bdag gis brjed ngas ci mchis pa/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ / 'phags pa'i tshogs rnams kyis bdag cag la sogs pa 'gro ba nyam thag pa rnams kyi don mdzad cing bka' drin stsal lags te/ da dung du yang bdag cag la thugs brtse bas yang dang yang du gdan 'dzoms pa mdzad par dgongs shing so so'i gdul bya'i zhing rnams su 'gro ba mang po'i don la gshegs par stsal du ci gnang*/

The confession of faults and the request to depart: We ask that you be patient with Anything we’ve left out or marred, With anything that we did or Had others do from ignorance. We beings of bad times with little merit, Polluted by ignorance and the afflictions, Have not fulfilled the wishes of the nobles ones: We pray that you be patient with this, too. We’re overcome by stinginess, unskilled, So our offerings are poor and badly arranged. Protectors who have great compassion, We pray that you be patient with this, too. We ask as well that you be patient with What we’ve done wrong or been unable to do According to the rituals from the sutras Due to our carelessness and impure conduct. We also beg your patience with Our adding things and leaving things out, Our spoiling parts of the ritual, And anything that we have forgotten. Noble ones, you have been so kind in benefiting desperate beings like us. With the intention to kindly and repeatedly return to us in the future, please depart in order to benefit many beings in the realms where there are beings for you to tame.

dge ba bsngo ba ni/ rgyal ba 'bri gung pa'i gsung*/ bdag dang 'khor 'das thams cad kyis dus gsum du bsags pa dang yod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag dang sems can thams cad myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rin po che thob par gyur cig /ces dang*/ dge ba'i rtsa ba des lus kyis sems can thams cad la phan thogs par gyur cig / ngag gis sems can thams cad la phan thogs par gyur cig / yid kyis sems can thams cad la phan thogs par gyur cig / nyon mongs pa 'dod chags kyi bsam pa mi 'ong bar gyur cig / zhe sdang gi bsam pa mi 'ong bar gyur cig / nga rgyal dang*/ phrag dog /rnyed pa dang bkur sti/ grags pa dang snyan pa/ tshe 'di'i bsam pa mi 'ong bar byams pa dang snying rje/ byang chub kyi sems kyis rgyud brlan nas/ yongs su 'dzin pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam mkha' dang mnyam par gyur nas/ bdag tshe 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub thob par gyur cig / nam 'chi ba'i tshe gnad gcod pa'i sdug bsngal mi 'ong*/ gshis ngan du 'chi bar mi 'byung*/ dus ma yin par 'chi ba mi 'ong bar/ 'chi ba la dga' ba dang bcas/ bde dang bcas nas/ sems nyid shin tu gsal ba dang*/ chos nyid shin tu gsal ba dang 'grogs nas/ 'chi kha dang bar dor cis kyang phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub thob par gyur cig / de de kho na bzhin du gyur cig / de de kho na bzhin du gyur cig / de de kho na bzhin du gyur cig /

The dedication of virtue: The words of Gyalwa Drikungpa: Through all roots of virtue accumulated by me or by anyone in samsara or nirvana throughout the three times, may I and all beings quickly achieve unsurpassable, authentic, perfect, precious awakening. And: Through these roots of virtue, may I benefit all beings with my body. May I benefit all beings with my speech. May I benefit all beings with my mind. May thoughts of the affliction of desire never arise. May thoughts of hatred never arise. May thoughts of pride, jealousy, gain, position, fame, renown, and this life never arise. May my being be moistened by love, compassion, and bodhichitta, and may I become a spiritual friend equal to space. In this very life may I achieve the supreme siddhi of mahamudra. When I die, may I not have agonizing pain. May I not die in a state of resentment. May I not die before my time. May I die in a state of joy and happiness. May I become familiar with the utterly clear mind essence and the utterly clear dharmata and then achieve the supreme siddhi of mahamudra either at the time of death or in the bardo. May it be just so! May it be just so! May it be just so!

bkra shis brjod pa ni/ bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag des pa la gsungs pa/ che ba'i che mchog ston mchog bla na med/ / chos rje nyi ma rgyal ba'i byin rlabs kyis/ / bdud dang bgegs rigs gnod pa'i dgra zhi ste/ / rtag tu dpal gnas nyin mtshan bkra shis shog / chos nyid bden pa'i chos mchog bla na med/ / dam chos bdud rtsi bden pa'i byin rlabs kyis/ / nyon mongs sdug bsngal gdung ba'i dgra zhi ste/ / rtag tu dpal gnas nyin mtshan bkra shis shog / dge 'dun yon tan rin chen dpal 'bar ba/ / rgyal sras phan mdzad bden pa'i byin rlabs kyis/ / nyes pa'i skyon bral dge tshogs rnam 'phel ba/ / rtag tu dpal gnas nyin mtshan bkra shis shog / tshangs dang lha dbang srung ma'i byin rlabs kyis/ / phan mdzad lha yi bkra shis gnas gyur te/ / bde legs bsam pa yid bzhin 'grub pa dang*/ / tshe ring nad med bde skyid ldan par shog /

The declaration of auspiciousness: Spoken by the Bhagavan to the householder named Gentle: May the blessings of the Dharma lord, the sun, the victor, The unsurpassable supreme Teacher, greatest of all greats, Subdue our harmful enemies, the maras and obstructors! May we always dwell in glorious good fortune day and night! May the blessings of the nectar of the truth of genuine Dharma, The unsurpassable supreme Dharma, the truth of dharmata, Subdue the foe, the torments of afflictions and suffering! May we always dwell in glorious good fortune day and night! May the blessings of the truth of bodhisattvas’ helpful deeds, The qualities of the Sangha, all ablaze in precious splendor, Free us from any moral flaws and make our virtue flourish! May we always dwell in glorious good fortune day and night! Through the blessings of Brahma and Indra, and of the protectors, May there be the auspiciousness of the benevolent gods; May there be joy and goodness, may our wishes be accomplished, And may we have long lives, good health, comfort, and happiness!

bla ma mchod pa'i cho ga 'di ni dgos pa dang ched du bya ba du ma la brten nas karma par 'bod pa o rgyan phrin las rdo rjes/ bod yul du chos la snga ba dpang skong phyag rgya pa'i mdo dang*/ rgyal sras zhi ba lha'i spyod 'jug dang*/ grub chen gling gis mdzad pa'i bla ma mchod pa dang*/ paN chen blo bzang chos rgyan gyis mdzad pa'i bla ma mchod pa/ 'jam mgon bla ma blo gros mtha' yas kyis mdzad pa'i dwags brgyud spyi'i bla ma mchod pa/ mkhas pa chen po mi pham 'jam dbyangs rnam rgyal gyis mdzad pa'i thub chog /karma zhwa dmar pa chos grags ye shes kyis mdzad pa'i gnas chog /sa skya pa'i bshes gnyen chen po 'gas mdzad pa'i mdo chog sogs grub mtha' ris med kyi bla mas mdzad pa'i cho ga du ma'i tshig don la mjal zhing legs par brtags nas skabs don gyi dgos ched dang brjod bya mthun pa rnams legs par btus te/ skyes bu thun mong ba'i bgo skal dang 'tshams par/ ston mchog shAkya'i dbang pos lnga sder bden bzhi'i chos 'khor gdams pa'i gnas/ drang srong smra ba ri dwags kyi nags/ badz+ra bid+yA'i gtsug lag khang du spyi lo _2005_lor sbyar ba'o/ /

This ceremony of offering to the gurus was composed for many reasons by Ogyen Trinley Dorje, the one called “Karmapa”. I read and carefully studied the words and meaning of ceremonies composed by gurus of many traditions, including The Sutra of the Hundredfold Homage for Amending Breaches, which was the first Dharma to reach Tibet; The Way of the Bodhisattva by Shantideva; Offerings to the Gurus by the mahasiddha Lingrepa; the Offerings to the Gurus by Panchen Lobsang Chögyen; Offerings to the Gurus of All the Dakpo Kagyu by the guru Jamgön Lodrö Thaye; the Shakyamuni Ceremony by the great scholar Mipham Jamyang Namgyal; The Ceremony of the Elders by Shamar Chödrak Yeshe; and sutra rituals composed by several great spiritual friends of the Sakya tradition. I then carefully extracted from them everything that matched the present purpose and topic in a way that is accessible to ordinary people. It was composed in 2005 at the Vajra Vidya Institute at Deer Park in Sarnath, Varanasi, where the supreme Teacher Shakyamuni taught the Dharma wheel of the Four Truths to his first five disciples.

oṃ svasti siddhaṃ Pristine pervasive awareness, Inseparable ground and wisdom, Knowing how things are and all there is, You’ve achieved the dharmakaya: I pray that you live long. Rid of the two veils’ darkness, you are loving, Non-composite, glorious, spontaneous presence. Source and lord of the strengths and all qualities, Buddha’s regent in Tibet: I pray that you live long. Unceasing radiance of the dharmadhatu, Your rupakaya, indivisible from it, is newly revealed. Inconceivable magic of the five certainties, Pervasive, perfect source of the coemergent: I pray that you live long. Inexhaustible, ornamental wheel of unlimited appearances; Great source of all that tames each; Unrivaled ornament of the three realms; Emanated guide of beings: I pray that you live long. Source of buddhas, you’ve taken countless intentional births. In each of them, you’ve granted us fearless joy. Fearless, peerless, glorious lord, armored with Unrivaled generosity: I pray that you live forever. You distinctly see the great ground of morality. You are the master of your actions. Lord of effortless speech, your knowledge is perfect. Lotus of morality: I pray that you live long. Your vision is vast; you’ve studied oceans of dharma. Beings’ minds appear distinctly to you. With endless confidence, profound ocean of intelligence, Your transcendent patience is unequaled: I pray that you live long. From deep and vast knowledge of all things as they are Arises unobstructed, inexhaustible wisdom of the ground And path that liberates, ripens, frees, and cares for beings. Your commitment to diligence is firm: I pray that you live forever. The greatest jewels among the wise and attained of Tibet, Glorious Atisha and Lobsang Drakpa, taught the four truths Free from eternalism and nihilism. Best holder of their teachings, Your meditation is transcendent: I pray that you live long. Far beyond even the slightest doubt about scripture and reasoning, Through learning you’ve conquered the four maras. Your resultant freedom and ripening are an unfathomable, boundless ocean. Splendid treasure of wisdom and love: I pray that you live long. The majesty continuously born from your three wheels Has seated you on the fearless lion throne of dharma. Effortlessly endowed with the royal primordial seven, You are the crown jewel of the teachings of all traditions. May his good intentions and aspirations For a wondrous new age of perfection Fill Jambudvipa and this whole realm of Saha. Like the true words of sages’ aspirations, May my prayers be fulfilled. For as many kalpas as there are in the future, Please always care for and protect me.

zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni pad dkar 'chang ba'i sku phreng bcu bzhi pa rje btsun ngag dbang blo bzang ye shes bstan 'dzin rgya mtsho srid gsum dbang bsgyur mtshungs pa med pa'i sde mchog gi lugs gnyis kyi skyabs 'og tu 'khod pa karma'i ming 'dzin bcu drug pas zla ba gsum pa'i yar tshes dge ba'i nyin mchog gi mtshan dpe rjes su dran pas thal mo spyi bor bkod de zhabs pad bskal pa rgya mtsho'i bar du brtan cing 'dzam gling rgyal bstan yongs rdzogs kyi mgon du bzhugs par gsol ba lan brgyar 'debs pa lags na de de bzhin du 'grub par gyur cig /shub+haM/ dzayan+tu/ dzayan+tu/

The sixteenth holder of the name Karmapa—who is under the dual protection of the fourteenth incarnation of the holder of a white lotus, His Holiness Ngawang Lobsang Yeshe Tenzin Gyatso Sisum Wangyur Tsungpa Mepay De—composed these verses on an auspicious day in the waxing phase of the third month. Thinking of this great being’s marks and signs, I place my joined palms atop my head and pray a hundred times that his lotus feet remain firm for oceans of kalpas, and that he continue to protect all the buddhadharma throughout Jambudvipa. May my prayers be fulfilled! Śhubham! Jayantu! Jayantu!

In the northern pure land of Tibet, a land of Dharma, Encircled by a ring of snow mountain ranges, You are a treasure of compassion, the source of all That benefits all beings and brings them happiness. The great Noble Chenrezik in human form, You, Tenzin Gyatso, are the crown jewel of The oceans of those who uphold the Sage’s teachings. May you live unwaveringly until the end of existence. Composed by Karmapa Ogyen Trinley Dorje.

oṃ svasti May the King of the Shakyas, the glory of the excellent ten powers, The lord of the world, Gyalwa Gyatso, The essence of compassion, the Lake-Born Vajra, And all the sources of refuge grant good fortune here and now. The dawn of your impeccable bodhichitta brings forth The brilliant marks and signs of a supreme nirmanakaya, The sun that shines brightly on the fortunate aeon of this realm And fulfills our hopes and benefit. The glory that upholds the Victor’s teachings of scripture and realization, You are the embodiment of the ocean of pervasive compassion. I bow to the Karmapa, who holds the vajra That fully possesses the activity of spontaneous power. The Karmapa’s successive births, a string of pearls, Glow with the luster of white deeds for the teachings. You are skilled in properly upholding their examples. Glorious protector of beings, I pray that you live long. The fine silk of vast scriptures, draped and waving, Is beautified by the jewel of complete experience and realization Atop the firm golden staff of intelligence: May this great being, the victory banner of the teachings, live long. You have received the treasury of instructions from many mahasiddhas Such as the crown jewel of siddhas, Lhodrak Marpa, and others. Protector who sustains and spreads the siddhas’ teachings, Lord of the mandala of siddhas, I pray that you live long. By embracing China, Tibet, and all other countries, From east to west, as the realm of your deeds, You have planted the seeds of all beings’ joy and goodness: May the good traditions of excellent dharma and prosperity flourish. By the blessings of truth from the lama, yidam, and three jewels; By the union of dharmata and interdependence, the nature of things; And by the mighty strength of truthful words from a pure motivation: May what we wish for be effortlessly accomplished.

ces pa 'di bzhin/ 'dren mchog karma pa rin po che'i mchog sprul o rgyan 'gro 'dul phrin las rdo rje gtan 'khel byung 'phral mtshan gsol yong ba zhes si tu rin po che dang*/ rgyal tshab rin po che gnyis nas gsung bskul byung bar mgyogs myur rab byung sgrub gnang skabs mtshan gsol bgyi rgyu'i bsam pas da bar nar lus gyur pa da cha rum bteg mtshur phu bla brang dang*/ sbir shes rab gling bla brang*/ ra lang dpal chen bla brang sogs nas zhabs brtan gsol 'debs shig 'bri dgos zhes nan bskul byung ba ltar/ (bstan 'dzin kun khyab dbang gi rdo rje )_zhes pa'i mtshan gsol dang 'brel zhabs brtan gsol 'debs 'dod don lhun grub ces pa 'di nyid/ shAkya'i dge sbyong bstan 'dzin rgya mtshos/ rab byung bcu bdun pa'i me glang zla ba _10_tshes _17_phyi lo _1997_zla _12_tshes _15_la dwang ba'i yid kyis sbyar ba dge legs 'phel/

After determining that Ogyen Drodul Trinley Dorje is the emanation of the supreme guide, the precious Karmapa, Situ Rinpoche and Gyaltsap Rinpoche requested that I should grant him a name. I had intended to grant him a name quickly when giving him monastic vows, but until now that has remained undone. Now the Tsurphu Labrang in Rumtek, the Sherap Ling Labrang in Bir, the Ralang Palchen Labrang, and others have earnestly requested me to write a prayer for his long life. Accordingly, in addition to bestowing upon him the name “Tendzin Kunkhyap Wang gi Dorje,” I, the Buddhist monk Tenzin Gyatso, composed this sincere prayer entitled “Spontaneous Fulfillment of Our Wishes” on the 17th day of the 10th month of the Fire Ox year of the 17th cycle, December 15, 1997. May virtue flourish!
