A Prayer for the Long Lives of the Kagyu Gurus

oM swasti/ shes bya'i mkha' la mkhyen rab dkyil 'khor rgyas/ / mdzad pa'i 'od stong gdul bya'i gling la phog / rgyal ba'i bstan pa kun nas gsal mdzad pa/ / bka' brgyud rin po che rnams zhabs brtan gsol/ / nA ro mai tri las brgyud shangs pa dang*/ / sgra sgyur mar pa thugs sras ka chen bzhi/ / ras chung pa dang gdan sa bka' brgyud sogs/ / bstan 'dzin skyes mchog rnams kyi zhabs brtan gsol/ / bskyed rim rnal 'byor lhan cig skyes ma dang*/ / rdzogs rim rlung sems gnyis med rang dbang 'byor/ / rgyal kun 'phrin las bdag nyid karma pa/ / sprul pa'i brgyud 'dzin chen po'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / bde stong phyag chen bsre 'pho gnad du bsnun/ / gnas lugs phyag chen gseb lam mngon du gyur/ / bla ma'i zhabs tog phul phyin 'ba' rom pa/ / bstan 'dzin skyes mchog gang de'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / gsung rab ma lus dgongs pa gcig tu 'dril/ / lnga ldan man ngag zab mos thugs rgyud gtams/ / sdom brtson 'gran zla bral ba 'bri gung pa/ / skyabs mgon nyi zla gnyis kyi zhabs brtan gsol/ / ngo mtshar rmad byung rnam thar so dgus brgyan/ / nor bu bzhi skor chos kyi che bas brjid/ / mos gus mthar thug dpal ldan stag lung pa/ / zhabs drung rin po che yi zhabs brtan gsol/ / phyi nang rten 'brel kun gyi don la mkhas/ / phung sogs chos rnams dbyer med ro gcig snyoms/ / gangs ljongs grub pa'i tshang chen dbyar rnga pa/ / rgyal dbang 'brug pa chen po'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / gzhan yang phag gru tshal pa khro phu dang*/ / smar yel shug gseb bka' brgyud la sogs pa/ / byin rlabs 'byung gnas gdams ngag rgya mtsho'i mdzod/ / brgyud 'dzin rin chen rnams kyi zhabs brtan gsol/ / dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad brtan pa dang*/ / mkha' mnyam yongs la bde skyid 'byung ba dang*/ / bdag gzhan ma lus tshogs bsags sgrib sbyangs nas/ / myur du sangs rgyas sa la 'god par shog /

oṃ svasti Your orb of wisdom fills the space of all that is knowable; Your thousand rays of deeds strike the ground, disciples, Clearly illuminating all the Buddha’s teachings. Precious Kagyu gurus, I pray that you live long. Descendents of Naro and Maitripa, the Shangpa, Of Marpa the Translator’s close sons—the four great pillars— Of Rechungpa, the Densa Kagyus, and other great beings Who uphold the teachings: I pray that you live long. With mastery over creation of the Co-emergent Yogini And completion of indivisible mind and wind, The Karmapas embody the activity of all buddhas. Great holder of the line of incarnations, I pray that you live long. Striking the vital points of bliss and emptiness, mahamudra, mixing, and phowa, And manifesting mahamudra of the nature, the secret path, Barom perfected service to the lama. All great beings who uphold his lineage, I pray that you live long. The meaning of all scriptures coalesced into one, Your wisdom mind is filled with the profound fivefold instructions. The Drikungpas are unrivalled in holding their vows. Sun and Moon Kyabgon: I pray you both live long. Adorned with the wondrous, amazing thirty-nine life stories, Majestic with the great dharma of the four jewels, The Taklungpas have reached the ultimate through their devotion. Shapdrung Rinpoche, I pray that you live long. You are wise in outer and inner interdependence, And know the aggregates and all dharmas are indivisibly of one taste. The Drukpas are the great nest of the Snow Land’s siddhas. Gyalwang Drukchen, I pray that you live long. Additionally, the Pakdru, Tsalpa, and Tropu Kagyu, The Mar, Yelpa, and Shugsep Kagyu, and others: The sources of blessings and treasuries of instructions: I pray the precious beings who uphold these lineages live long. May the glorious lamas live long; May all beings who fill space be happy. Gathering merit and wisdom and purifying obscurations, May we and all others quickly reach buddahood.

rje mar pa'i sgrub brgyud/ dwags po'i bka' brgyud 'di la da lta bstan pa dang de 'dzin gyi skyes bu'i rgyun 'ga' tsam las gzhan rnams go thos med pas sems skyo mo rang zhig yong mod/ rjes 'jug tshos legs nyes ci mdzad rung da lta zhal bzhugs pa'i bka' brgyud 'di rnams la bshad sgrub las gsum dga' mo rang zhig yod pas nged kyang brgyud pa 'di dag la mi ldog pa'i dad pa yod pa'i thog /gdan sa rum bteg gi byang 'dren 'od zer rab brtan nas bka' brgyud smon lam du 'don rgyu'i zhabs brtan 'di 'dra zhig rtsoms dang zer bas/ de 'dra mi shes mod kyang khong gi ngo ma ldog nas go thos ci yod kyis 'bol rtsom du byas pa yin/ spyir bla ma mi mnyam pa'i yon tan mnga' ba de tshor mtho dman dang 'gangs che chung sogs kyi go rim nges nges po zhig mi bdog cing*/ skabs rer slob ma gus zhen che ba 'gas sangs rgyas phal par gtong ba'i bya ba mi dgos pa de 'dra byed pa'ang yod mod/ re zhig go rim phal cher rje ban sgar ba'i rdo rje 'chang thung ma ltar bkod pa yin la/ da dung thugs blo ma bde na chos thog tu ban+de dbang che ba'i dpe ltar 'don pa'i go rim ci 'dod du thongs shig /de skad ces me mo phag gi lo nag pa zla ba'i tshes bcu gsum la karma pa o rgyan phrin las rdo rje des d+ha sa rgyud stod du spyi lo _2007_zla _4_tshes _30_sbyar ba dge'o/

It is truly disheartening that nowadays in Lord Marpa’s practice lineage, the Dakpo Kagyu, one hears about just a few of the lines of teachings and the beings who uphold them, but not of the others. However, whether their followers act well or badly, the teaching, practice, and activity of these living Kagyu masters is truly encouraging, and this gives me irreversible faith in these lineages. In addition, the chant master of the monastic seat of Rumtek, Öser Rabten, asked me to compose these long-life prayers for recitation at the Kagyu Monlam. Although I do not know about such things, I could not turn him down, so I have put whatever I have heard and learned into these simple verses. In general, these lamas who have unsurpassable qualities cannot be definitively ranked as higher and lower, as more or less significant, etc. Occasionally some students, whose devotion is predominantly attachment, have even been known to needlessly turn buddhas into ordinary people. In this case, I have arranged the verses in the order given in Je Pengar’s Short Vajradhara Lineage Prayer. If that still causes you some unease, then just as in the saying, since monks have power when it comes to the dharma, recite these in whatever order you wish. This was composed on the thirteenth day of the Nakpa month of the Female Fire Pig year (April 30, 2007) by the Karmapa Ogyen Trinley Dorje at Gyuto Monastery in Dharamsala. Virtue!
kaM tshang yab sras bdun gyi zhabs brtan gsol 'debs/
A Prayer for Long Lives of the Seven Masters and Disciples of the Karma Kamtsang

oM swasti/ gzhan phan rnam rol pad+ma 'byung gnas dang*/ / sa ra ha dang klu yi byang chub sogs/ / sa bcu'i dbang phyug gcig tu bsdus pa'i sku/ / karma pa zhes grags de'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / gar dbang rdo rje 'chang gi sgyu 'phrul las/ / 'jig rten dbang phyug dpal ldan karma pa'i/ / bstan pa'i khur chen 'degs la mnga' brnyes pa/ / zhwa dmar cod pan 'dzin pa'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / byams pa mgon dang DA+om b+hi he ru ka'i/ / thugs rje'i byin stobs gong bur 'khyil ba'i sku/ / mkha' mnyam 'gro la lam bzang ston mdzad pa'i/ / kwan ting tA yi si tu'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / dpal ldan rigs kun khyab bdag rdo rje 'chang*/ / gu ru'i rgyal tshab mtshungs med bai ro rje'i/ / rnam 'phrul 'dzam gling bstan pa'i sgron me mchog / 'jam mgon bla ma bskal brgyar zhabs brtan gsol/ / kun bzang ye shes thugs rje'i sprul bsgyur gyis/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing khams dmigs med thugs rje yi/ / thabs mkhas zab mo'i chos kyi mnga' bdag mchog / rgyal ba'i rgyal tshab dam pa'i zhabs brtan gsol/ / rab 'byams grub pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi ni/ / gcig tu 'dus pa'i byin rlabs rgya mtsho che/ / rigs drug sdug bsngal drung nas 'byin byed pa/ / dpa' bo'i dbang phyug mchog gi zhabs brtan gsol/ / tshe dpag med dngos gang 'dul thabs zab mos/ / 'gro blo rnyog pa'i mun pa kun tu bcil/ / thar pa'i lam bzang rtse mor 'god mkhas pa/ / rnam 'dren tre bo mchog gi zhabs brtan gsol/ / de ltar snying po'i bstan pa rin po che/ / 'dzin skyong spel ba'i byed po mchog rnams la/ / dad cing gus pas gsol ba btab pa'i mthus/ / mkha' mnyam 'gro kun rdzogs sangs rgyas thob shog /

oṃ svasti Embodiment of all lords of the tenth stage, Shenpen Namrol, Padmasambhava, Saraha, Luyi Jangchub, and others: Renowned Karmapa, I pray that you live long. Lord of Dance, magic display of Vajradhara, You bear the great burden of the teachings Of the glorious Karmapa, who is Lokeshvara. Holder of the Shamar red crown, I pray that you live long. Combining the compassionate blessings and power Of the protector Maitreya and Dombhi Heruka, You teach the true path to beings throughout space. Kenting Tai Situ, I pray that you live long. Glorious Vajradhara, lord of all families, magic display Of Guru Rinpoche’s peerless regent Vairochana, Great torch of the doctrine in Jambudvipa: Jamgön Rinpoche, I pray that you live for a hundred kalpas. Emanations of Samantabhadra’s wisdom Fill all realms with non-conceptual compassion. Skillful lord of profound dharma, holy Gyaltsap, Regent of the buddhas, I pray that you live long. Vast ocean of blessing, you hold The wisdom amrita of countless siddhas. You eradicate the sufferings of the six states. Great Pawo, lord of heroes, I pray that you live long. Truly Amitayus, through profound means of taming You remove all the obscurity that sullies beings’ minds, Skillfully bringing us to the end of the path to liberation. Great guide Treho, I pray that you live long. Through the power of praying with faith and devotion To the great beings who hold, guard, and spread The precious essence of the teachings, May all beings throughout space achieve perfect buddhahood.

de ltar yab sras rim byon spyir mya ngan las mi 'da' bar bzhugs par gsol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag rgyal ba'i dbang po drung bcu gsum pas mdzad pa'i gsol 'debs sor bzhag la/ 'jam mgon bla ma'i gsol 'debs rje bco lnga pas mdzad pa gsar snon dang bcas/ zhabs brtan du zhal bsgyur ba tsam las dus dbang gis rang rtsom bgyi bar gegs dogs che bas btang snyoms kyi gnas su ma btang ka med las/ gzhan rje btsun gong ma rnams kyi bden tshig grub pa'i gsung dang rang ngos nas dad zhen ma nor tsam yod pa'i stobs des rgyal mchog yab sras rnams skye sngon smon lam dang dge tshogs mthun par spyad de/ zhing 'dir rdo rje'i dpon slob kyi tshul gyis thugs nang gtsang ma'i phrin las ji ltar bzhed pa mtha' dag gegs med du grub pas 'tsho zhing gzhes nas/ bdag sogs gdul bya rnams dad pa dang dag pa'i snang ba kho na la sbyor ba'i bka' drin mdzad par gsol ba'i smon 'dun shugs drag bcas/ karma par 'bod pa o rgyan phrin las pas/ rab byung bcu bdun pa'i mgo zla ba'i tshes _3_nang lo _2549_phyi lo _2005_zla _12_tshes _4_nyin ra mo che'i rgyud pa grwa tshang du sbyar ba dge /

These verses of prayer that the masters and disciples live long without passing into nirvana are based on a prayer written by the Thirteenth Gyalwang Karmapa. I added to it words from the Fifteenth Lord Karmapa’s supplication to Jamgön Rinpoche. Other than transforming those into a long-life prayer, I felt it necessary to refrain from original composition because of the impediments present at this time. Through the power of the true words of our holy predecessors, who accomplished infallible speech; and through the power of my unmistaken faith and devotion, may all the supreme victors, the masters and disciples, behave in accordance with the aspirations they made in previous lives and the roots of virtue they accumulated then. May whatever pure activity they engage in as vajra masters and disciples in this realm be accomplished without impediment. May they live long and well. May they kindly inspire us, their disciples, to faith and pure perception. With this fervent prayer of aspiration, I, Ogyen Trinley, called “Karmapa”, composed this at the Tantric University of Ramoche on the third day of the month “Go” in the Buddhist year 2549 in the seventeenth cycle, the fourth day of December in the common year 2005. Virtue!

bla ma sku khams bzang bar gsol ba 'debs/ / mchog tu sku tshe ring bar gsol ba 'debs/ / phrin las dar zhing rgyas la gsol ba 'debs/ / bla ma dang 'bral ba med par byin gyis rlobs/ / dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad brtan pa dang*/ / mkha' mnyam yongs la bde skyid 'byung ba dang*/ / bdag gzhan ma lus tshogs bsags sgrib sbyangs nas/ / myur du sangs rgyas sa la 'god par shog /

I supplicate that the lamas may be healthy. I supplicate that their lives be supremely long. I supplicate that their activity spread and flourish. Bless me to never be separate from the lamas. May the glorious lamas’ lotus feet be firm. May happiness come to all throughout space. May I and all others gather the accumulations, purify obscurations, And swiftly be brought to buddhahood.

Mandala Offerings with the Thirty-Seven Features

skyabs 'gro dang sems bskyed jo bo'i lugs ni/ sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs kyi mchog rnams la/ / byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ / bdag gis sbyin sogs bgyis pa 'di dag gis/ / 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog /

Refuge and bodhichitta from Atisha’s tradition: Until enlightenment, I go for refuge To the Buddha, Dharma, and the supreme Sangha. By acting generously and so forth, May I become a buddha to help beings.

The seven-branch prayer: I prostrate to all lions among humans, As many as appear, excepting none, In the three times in worlds of ten directions Sincerely with my body, speech, and mind. With the power of this prayer for excellent conduct, I fully prostrate to all victors with As many bodies as atoms in all realms With all the victors right before my mind. Upon one atom, numerous as atoms Are buddhas in the midst of bodhisattvas. I thus imagine that victorious ones Completely fill the entire dharma expanse. With sounds from oceans of melodious traits I extol the qualities of all the victors, Whose oceans of praiseworthiness will never Run dry, and praise all of the sugatas. I make an offering to these victors of The best of flowers and the finest garlands, Cymbals and ointments, the best parasols, The best of lamps, and incense the most fine. I make an offering to these victors of The finest robes, the finest fragrances, And powders in heaps equal to Mount Meru, Arranged in the most sublime of displays. I also imagine offering to all victors That which is vast and unsurpassable. I offer and bow to the victors with The power of faith in excellent conduct. Under the influence of desire, hatred, And ignorance, I have committed wrongs Using my body, speech, and also mind— I confess each and every one of them. And I rejoice in all that is the merit Of all the victors and the buddhas’ children, Pratyekabuddhas, learners, and nonlearners, Of all the wanderers of the ten directions. I request all those guardians who have Wakened to buddhahood and found detachment— The lamps of the worlds of the ten directions— To turn the Wheel that cannot be surpassed. With my palms joined, I supplicate all those Who wish to demonstrate nirvana to stay As many aeons as atoms in the realms To aid and bring well-being to all wanderers. I dedicate to enlightenment whatever Slight merit I have gathered from prostrating, And offering, confessing, and rejoicing, Requesting, and from making supplications.

maN+Dal so bdun ma ni/ oM badz+ra b+hU mi AHhU~M/ gzhi rnam par dag pa dbang chen gser gyi sa gzhi/ oM badz+ra re khe AHhU~M/ phyi lcags ri'i khor yug gi ra bas yongs su bskor ba'i dbus su ri'i rgyal po ri bo mchog rab/ shar lus 'phags po/ lho 'dzam bu gling*/ nub ba glang spyod/ byang sgra mi snyan/ lus dang lus 'phags/ rnga yab dang rnga yab gzhan/ g.yo ldan dang lam mchog 'gro/ sgra mi snyan dang sgra mi snyan gyi zla/ rin po che'i ri bo/ dpag bsam gyi shing*/ 'dod 'jo'i ba/ ma rmos pa'i lo tog / 'khor lo rin po che/ nor bu rin po che/ btsun mo rin po che/ blon po rin po che/ glang po rin po che/ rta mchog rin po che/ dmag dpon rin po che/ gter chen po'i bum pa/ sgeg mo ma/ phreng ba ma/ glu ma/ gar ma/ me tog ma/ bdug spos ma/ snang gsal ma/ dri chab ma/ nyi ma/ zla ba/ rin po che'i gdugs/ phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyal mtshan/ dbus su lha dang mi'i dpal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa ma tshang ba med pa/ rab 'byams rgya mtsho'i rdul gyi grangs las 'das pa mngon par bkod pa 'di nyid

The thirty-seven feature mandala: oṃ vajra bhūmi āḥ hūṃ The ground is the powerful golden earth. OṂ VAJRA REKHE ĀḤ HŪṂ The outside is encircled by a ring of iron mountains. In the center is the king of mountains, Mount Meru. To the east is Superior Body, to the south Rose Apple Land, to the west Bountiful Cow, and to the north Unpleasant Sound. Deha and Videha, Chāmara and Avara, Śhaṭhā and Uttaramantriṇa, Kurava and Kaurava, the mountain of jewels, wish-fulfilling tree, the cow who fulfills wishes, the untilled crops, the precious wheel, the precious jewel, the precious queen, the precious minister, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious general, the vase of great treasure, the maiden of charm, the maiden of garlands, the maiden of song, the maiden of dance, the maiden of flowers, the maiden of incense, the maiden of lamps, the maiden of perfume, the sun, the moon, the jeweled parasol, the banner victorious in all directions, and in the center all the resplendent wealth of gods and humans, none left out, more numerous than the atoms in infinite oceans.

khyab bdag rdo rje 'chang chen po dang dgongs pa dbyer ma mchis pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam pa don gyi slad du mtshan nas smos na/ dpal khyab bdag rang byung o rgyan rgyal ba'i myu gu 'gro 'dul phrin las rdo rje rtsal phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba'i sde lta bus mtshon chos nod pa po'i mtshan rgyas pa nas smos/

I offer this arrangement to the glorious exalted lama who is inseparable from the Lord of All Families, Great Vajradhara, who is called by the name Pal Khyapdak Rangjung Orgyen Gyalway Nyugu Drodul Trinle Dorje Tsal Chokle Nampar Gyalway De (or say the long name of the lama who gave the teaching),
dpal bzang po'i zhal snga nas theg pa chen po dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba'i don du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ /
the glorious and good, in order to request the amrita of Mahayana Dharma.
dbang zhu ba'i skabs/ zhal snga nas/ smin byed kyi dbang bskur zab mo zhu ba'i don du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ /
When requesting empowerment: in order to request the profound empowerment that ripens.
lung zhu ba'i skabs/ zhal snga nas/ dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba'i don du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ /
When requesting a transmission: in order to request the nectar of genuine Dharma.
khrid kyi rigs la/ zhal snga nas/ grol byed khrid kyi rim pa zab mo zhu ba'i don du/ zhes bsgyur/
When requesting instructions: in order to request the profound stages of instructions that liberate.

bka' chos grub rjes kyi gtang rag lta bu'i tshe/ zhal snga nas/ smin byed kyi dbang bskur zab mo'am/ grol byed kyi khrid zab mo'am/ dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi legs par thob pa'i sku drin gtang rag gi yon du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ /

In thanksgiving such as at the end of a teaching: as an offering in thanksgiving for the kindness of granting an empowerment that ripens or profound instructions that liberate or the nectar of genuine Dharma.
brtan bzhugs lta bu la/ zhal snga nas/ zhabs pad bskal pa rgya mtshor brtan cing zab rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo rtag pa rgyun du bskor bar gsol ba 'debs pa'i slad du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ /
For a long life offering: as a supplication that your lotus feet be firm for a hundred aeons and that you continuously turn the Wheel of profound and vast Dharma.

brtan bzhugs kyi gtang rag skabs/ zhal snga nas/ zhabs pad bskal pa rgya mtshor brtan cing zab rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo rtag pa rgyun du bskor ba'i zhal bzhes bzang po legs par thob pa'i bka' drin gtang rag gi yon du 'bul bar bgyi'o/ / zhes kha bsgyur ba bya'o/ /

In thanksgiving for a long life offering: as an offering in thanksgiving for the kindness of promising to live for oceans of aeons and continuously turn the wheel of the profound and vast Dharma. Alter the text as necessary.
gang ltar yang mthar/ thugs rjes 'gro ba'i don du bzhes su gsol/ bzhes nas byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ /zhes dang*/
In any case, at the end recite: We pray you accept this compassionately for the sake of beings. We pray you then grant your blessings.

sa gzhi spos chus byugs shing me tog bkram/ / ri rab gling bzhi nyi zlas brgyan pa 'di/ / sangs rgyas zhing du dmigs te phul ba yis/ / 'gro kun rnam dag zhing la spyod par shog / idaM gu ru rat+na maN+Dal khaM nIr+Ya taya mi/ sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / / blo yi bye brag ji lta bar/ / che chung thun mong theg pa yi/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du gsol/ /

This earth, perfumed with scented water, strewn with flowers, Graced with Mount Meru, the four lands, the sun and moon, I visualize to be a buddha realm and offer So that all beings enjoy a perfectly pure realm. idam guru ratna maṇḍala kham nīryatayami I pray that you turn the Wheels of Dharma Of the lesser, greater, and common vehicles In accordance with the thoughts And various intellects of beings.

gsung chos grub rjes/ bsod nams 'di yis thams cad gzigs pa nyid/ / thob nas nyes pa'i dgra rnams pham byas nas/ / skye rga na 'chi'i rba rlabs 'khrug pa yi/ / srid pa'i mtsho las 'gro ba sgrol bar shog / srid zhi'i dpal 'byor ma lus 'byung ba'i gzhi/ / thub pa'i bstan pa yun ring gnas pa dang*/ / de 'dzin byed pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams/ / dpal 'byor gyis brgyan yun ring zhabs brtan shog / phan bde 'byung ba'i gnas gcig pu/ / bstan pa yun ring gnas pa dang*/ / bstan pa 'dzin pa'i skyes bu rnams/ / sku tshe rgyal mtshan brtan gyur cig / rgyal kun snying rje'i rang gzugs karma pa/ / rgyal kun phrin las gcig bsdus karma pa/ / rgyal kun gdung 'tshob dbang bskur karma pa/ / o rgyan 'gro 'dul phrin las zhabs brtan gsol/ / lta bu chos nod pa po'i zhabs brtan rgyas bsdus ci rigs 'don/

At the end of the teaching: By this merit, may we attain omniscience, Defeat the enemy wrongdoing, and free All wanderers from the ocean of existence Churned by great waves of birth, age, sickness, and death. May long remain the teachings of the Buddha, The ground from which all the prosperity In peace and existence springs. May the great beings Who uphold them live long lives rich with glory. Sole source of benefit and happiness, May Buddhism remain for a long time, And may the beings who uphold the teachings Have lives as steadfast as a victory banner. Karmapa who embodies the compassion of all buddhas, Karmapa who unites the activity of all buddhas, Karmapa who is empowered as the regent of all buddhas, We pray that Ogyen Drodul Trinley live long. Alternatively, recite prayers for the long life of the lama who gave the teaching.
bstan rgyas smon lam phyogs bcu dus bzhi ma/
The Aspiration for the Teachings to Flourish "Buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and four times…"

oM:_na mo gu ru:_sprel lo sprel zla ra ba'i tshes bcu la bsam yas bar khang g.yu zhal can du rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor zhal phyes tshe o rgyan gyis smon lam 'di gsungs pas rje 'bangs thams cad kyi thugs dam nar mar mdzad/ phyi rabs rnams kyis kyang 'di la thugs dam rtse gcig tu mdzod/

Namo guru. On the tenth day of the monkey month in the monkey year, when uncovering the mandala of Vajradhatu in the Turquoise Shrine at Samye, Orgyen said this prayer, and the master and his disciples practiced it regularly. Later practitioners should also recite this one-pointedly.

phyogs bcu dus bzhi'i rgyal ba sras dang bcas: bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro chos skyong tshogs: ma lus zhing gi rdul snyed gshegs su gsol: mdun gyi nam mkhar pad zla'i gdan la bzhugs: lus ngag yid gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo: phyi nang gsang ba de bzhin nyid kyis mchod: rten mchog bde gshegs rnams kyi spyan snga ru: sngon gyi sdig pa'i tshogs la bdag gnong zhing : da lta'i mi dge 'gyod pas rab tu bshags: phyin chad de las ldog phyir bdag gis bsdam: bsod nams dge tshogs kun la yi rang ngo : rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams mya ngan mi 'da' bar: sde snod gsum dang bla med chos 'khor bskor: dge tshogs ma lus 'gro ba'i rgyud la bsngo: 'gro rnams bla med thar pa'i sar phyin shog: sangs rgyas sras bcas bdag la dgongs su gsol: bdag gis brtsams pa'i smon lam rab bzang 'di: rgyal ba kun tu bzang dang de sras dang : 'phags pa 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi mkhyen pa ltar: de dag kun gyi rjes su bdag slob shog: bstan pa'i dpal gyur bla ma rin chen rnams: nam mkha' bzhin tu kun la khyab par shog: nyi zla bzhin du kun la gsal bar shog: ri bo bzhin du rtag tu brtan par shog: bstan pa'i gzhi ma dge 'dun rin po che: thugs mthun khrims gtsang bslab gsum gyis phyug shog: bstan pa'i snying po gsang sngags sgrub pa'i sde: dam tshig ldan zhing bskyed rdzogs mthar phyin shog: bstan pa'i sbyin bdag chos skyong rgyal po yang : chab srid rgyas shing bstan la sman par shog: bstan pa'i zhabs 'degs rgyal rigs blon po yang : blo gros rab 'phel rtsal dang ldan par shog: bstan pa'i gsos byed khyim bdag 'byor ldan rnams: longs spyod ldan zhing nyer 'tshe med par shog: bstan la dad pa'i yangs pa'i rgyal khams kun: bde skyid ldan zhing bar chad zhi bar shog: lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyang : dam tshig mi nyams bsam pa 'grub par shog: bdag la bzang ngan las kyis 'brel gyur gang : gnas skabs mthar thug rgyal bas rjes 'dzin shog: 'gro rnams bla med theg pa'i sgor zhugs nas: kun bzang rgyal srid chen po thob par shog:

Buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and four times, Lamas, yidams, dakinis, protectors of the Dharma, As numerous as atoms in the universe, I ask you come. Please sit on lotus and moon seats in the sky before me. I bow respectfully with body, speech, and mind. And make the outer, inner, secret, and thatness offerings. In the presence of the supreme support, the sugatas, I feel remorse for all misdeeds I’ve done in the past And regret for present non-virtues, so I confess them fully. I vow that from now on I’ll turn away from them. I rejoice in all the gatherings of merit and virtue. Gatherings of Victors, without passing to nirvana, Turn the Wheels of the three baskets and the highest Dharma. I dedicate all virtue to wandering beings. May beings reach unsurpassable liberation. Buddhas and your children, think of me. Just as Samantabhadra and his children And the noble Manjushri have known This most excellent of prayers I have written, May I train following all of their examples. May the precious lamas, splendor of the teachings, Pervade everything like space. Like the sun and moon, may they shine clearly on all, And always be as stable as a mountain. May the precious sangha, the foundation of the teachings, Be harmonious, disciplined and rich with the three trainings. May the essence of the teachings, practitioners of the secret mantra, Hold their commitments, and perfect creation and completion. May the kings who protect Dharma, the sponsors of the teachings, Have increasing power and benefit the teachings. May nobles and ministers, servants of the teachings, Increase in intelligence and have power. May the wealthy patrons who support the teachings Have wealth and be free from harm. May the vast countries, faithful to the teachings, Have happiness and may their problems be pacified. May we, the yogis on the path, maintain Our commitments and accomplish our intentions. May those with karmic links to us, both good and bad, Be cared for by the Victors temporarily and ultimately. May all wanderers enter the gate of the highest vehicle And attain the great kingdom of Samantabhadra.

de ltar gyi smon lam dus drug tu brtson par bya/ sa ma ya rgya:_lha sras mu rub rnam 'phrul gter chen mchog gyur bde chen gling pas gnas mchog seng chen gnam brag gi g.yas zur brag ri rin chen brtsegs pa'i gong mo 'og ma nas khrom gter du spyan drangs pa'i bai ro'i sku chos dar shog ngos mtsho rgyal gyi phyag bris bod yig bshur ma las de 'phral nyid du pad+ma gar dbang blo gros mtha' yas kyis dag par bshus pa dge legs 'phel/

Strive at such aspirations at the six times. Samaya gya. The great Tertön Chokgyur Dechen Lingpa, an emanation of Prince Murup, revealed this in a crowd from below the top of the rock mountain Rinchen Tsek to the right of the sacred site of Great Lion Sky Cliff. Yeshe Tsogyal had written it by hand in the shurma script on one side of Vairochana’s robe, and Pema Garwang Lodrö Taye copied it correctly. May virtue flourish!
mar me smon lam/
The Marme Monlam
thugs rje chen po'i sgom bzlas 'gro don mkha' khyab ma/
The Meditation on the Great Compassionate One: Benefitting Beings Throughout Space

skyabs 'gro sems bskyed ni/ sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs kyi mchog rnams la/ / byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ / bdag gis sbyin sogs bgyis pa'i bsod nams kyis/ / 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog lan gsum/

Refuge and bodhichitta: Until enlightenment, I go for refuge To the Buddha, Dharma, and the supreme Sangha. By the merit of being generous, and so forth, May I become a buddha to help beings. Recite three times.

lha bskyed ni/ bdag sogs mkha' khyab sems can gyi/ / spyi gtsug pad dkar zla ba'i steng*/ / hrIHlas 'phags mchog spyan ras gzigs/ / dkar gsal 'od zer lnga ldan 'phro/ / mdzes 'dzum thugs rje'i spyan gyis gzigs/ / phyag bzhi'i dang po thal sbyar mdzad/ / 'og gnyis shel phreng pad dkar bsnams/ / dar dang rin chen rgyan gyis spras/ / ri dwags pags pa'i stod g.yogs gsol/ / 'od dpag med pa'i dbu rgyan can/ / zhabs gnyis rdo rje skyil krung bzhugs/ / dri med zla bar rgyab brten pa/ / skyabs gnas kun 'dus ngo bor gyur/ /

Visualizing the deity: Above the crown of myself and all beings Throughout all space, on a white lotus And moon from HRĪḤ is Chenrezik, Bright white and shining lights of five colors. His smile is handsome, his gaze compassionate. Of his four hands, the first two are joined in prayer. The lower two hold a crystal mala and white lotus. He is bedecked with silks and precious jewelry. He wears a deerskin upper robe, And Amitabha graces his crown. He sits with two legs in vajra posture; A stainless moon supports his back. He is the union of all sources of refuge.

bdag dang sems can thams cad kyis mgrin gcig tu gsol ba 'debs par bsam la/ skyon gyis ma gos sku mdog dkar/ / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis dbu la brgyan/ / thugs rje'i spyan gyis 'gro la gzigs/ / spyan ras gzigs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / zhes ci nus bsags/

Thinking that you and all sentient beings are supplicating in unison, recite: Unstained by faults, your body is white. A perfect buddha crowns your head. Your eyes view beings compassionately. I bow to Avalokiteshvara. As many times as you can.

de ltar rtse gcig gsol btab pas/ / 'phags pa'i sku las 'od zer 'phros/ / ma dag las snang 'khrul shes sbyangs/ / phyi snod bde ba can gyi zhing*/ / nang bcud skye 'gro'i lus ngag sems/ / spyan ras gzigs dbang sku gsung thugs/ / snang grag rig stong dbyer med gyur/ / oM ma Ni pad+me hU~M/ 'khor gsum mi rtog pa'i rang ngor mnyam par bzhag

From praying thus one-pointedly, light shines From the Arya’s body and purifies the impure Karmic appearances and confused mind. The outer world becomes Sukhavati; The body, speech and mind of the beings within Become Chenrezik’s body, speech, and mind— Appearance, sound, awareness, and emptiness inseparable. oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ Rest in equipoise in your nature without conceiving of the three spheres.

bdag gzhan lus snang 'phags pa'i sku/ / sgra grags yi ge drug ma'i dbyangs/ / dran rtog ye shes chen po'i klong / / dge ba 'di yis myur du bdag / spyan ras gzigs dbang 'grub gyur nas/ / 'gro ba gcig kyang ma lus pa/ / de yi sa la 'god par shog /

The appearance of my own and others’ bodies is the Arya’s body. Sounds that resound are the melody of the six syllables. Thought and memory are the expanse of great wisdom. By this merit, may I swiftly Accomplish Noble Chenrezik. May I bring every sentient being, Not one left out, into that state.
mar me smon lam/
The Lamp Prayer

mar me'i snod ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'jig rten khams kyi khor yug dang mnyam par gyur cig / sdong bu ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab tsam du gyur cig / mar khu ni mtha'i rgya mtsho tsam du gyur cig / grangs ni sangs rgyas re re'i mdun du dung phyur re re 'byung bar gyur cig / 'od kyis srid pa'i rtse mo man chad nas/ mnar med pa'i dmyal ba yan chad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad bsal nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i zhing khams thams cad mngon sum du mthong zhing gsal bar gyur cig / oM badz+ra a lo ke AHhU~M`/

May the bowl of this lamp become equal to the outer ring of this world realm of the great Three Thousands. May its stem be the size of the King of Mountains, Mount Meru. May its oil fill the surrounding oceans. In number, may a hundred million appear before each and every buddha. May its light dispel all the darkness of ignorance from the Peak of Existence to the Incessant Hell and illumine all the Pure Realms of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions so they are clearly seen. oṃ vajra aloke āḥ hūṃ

e ma ho/ ngo mtshar rmad byung snang gsal sgron me 'di/ / bskal bzang sangs rgyas stong rtsa la sogs pa'i/ / rab 'byams phyogs bcu'i zhing khams ma lus pa'i/ / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro chos skyong dang*/ / dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul bar bgyi/ / pha mas gtso byas sems can thams cad kyi/ / tshe rabs 'di dang skye gnas thams cad du/ / rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i zhing khams mngon mthong nas/ / 'od dpag med mgon nyid dang dbyer med shog / dkon mchog gsum dang rtsa gsum lha tshogs kyi/ / bden pa'i mthu yis smon lam 'di btab ste/ / myur du 'grub par byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / tad+ya thA/ pany+tsen+d+ri ya A ba bo d+hA nA ye swAhA/

EMAHO! I offer this amazing, wonderful, bright lamp To the one thousand buddhas of this fortunate aeon The lamas, yidams, dakinis, Dharma protectors, And gatherings of deities in the mandalas Of all pure realms of the infinite ten directions. My parents in the fore, may every sentient being In this lifetime and all the places they take birth See the pure realms of the perfect buddhas directly And then become inseparable from Amitabha. Out of the power of the truth of the Three Jewels And the deities of the Three Roots I’ve made this prayer. Please grant your blessings that it be quickly accomplished. TADYATHĀ PAÑCHANDRIYA ĀVA BODHĀNAYE SVĀHĀ
zhes jo bo rje dpal ldan a ti shas dbus gtsang gi mchod khang rnams la dpon slob bco brgyad tsam gyis 'ur 'don mdzad ces grags so//
The glorious Lord Atisha with just seventeen of his students recited this prayer in a roar in the temples of Ü Tsang, it is heard.
